subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements specified in Schedule 2A are also applicable to and in relation to an authorized institution using the IMM(CCR) approach in respect of an internal model to which a significant change referred to in section 10B(9)(a) relates (whether or not the institution has, in respect of that change, been given the prior consent referred to in that section) and the other provisions of this section apply accordingly; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (4) does not operate to prejudice the generality of the circumstances in which the Monetary Authority may exercise the power under section 97F of the Ordinance in respect of an authorized institution to which that subsection applies.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Specific Requirements relating to Use of IRB Approach

section.name: s11
section.heading: Adoption of IRB approach

subsection.leadIn: When an authorized institution applies to the Monetary Authority under section 8(1) for approval to use the IRB approach, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: submit an implementation plan agreed with the Monetary Authority that specifies to what extent and when the institution intends to use the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), choose one or more IRB adoption classes set out in Table 1AAB for which the institution applies to use the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures.

td.content: Public sector entities (excluding sovereign foreign public sector entities)
Residential mortgages to property-holding shell companies

subsection.content: An authorized institution must not choose only the IRB adoption class of “Others” to apply for the use of the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for exposures falling within the IRB class of “Other exposures”.

Subject to section 12, if an authorized institution uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for an IRB adoption class, the institution must use the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for all exposures that fall within that IRB adoption class.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, the following expressions have the meanings given to them by section 139(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cash items;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: corporate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: financial institution treated as corporate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: specialized lending.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Exemption for exposures

subsection.content: An authorized institution which has made an application under section 8(1) to use, or which uses, the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures (referred to in this section as relevant calculation) may apply to the Monetary Authority to have such of its non-securitization exposures as specified in the application exempted from inclusion in the relevant calculation. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall determine an application under subsection (1) from an authorized institution by— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: exempting from inclusion in the relevant calculation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the exposures in an IRB adoption class which are specified in the application; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the exposures falling within a business unit which are specified in the application,

paragraph.continued: if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: it is not practicable for the institution to include the exposures referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii), as the case may be, in the relevant calculation; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the exemption will not materially prejudice the calculation of the institution’s regulatory capital for credit risk; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution to which an exemption under subsection (2)(a) is granted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall use the STC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures to which the exemption relates.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution is granted an exemption (referred to in this subsection as existing exemption) under subsection (2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution is at any time thereafter satisfied that if it were to make a fresh application under subsection (1) for an exemption (referred to in this subsection as new exemption) in respect of the exposures to which the existing exemption relates, the new exemption would be, or may be, refused by virtue of subsection (2),

subsection.continued: the institution shall, as soon as is practicable after it is so satisfied, give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority of the case.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Revocation of exemption under section 12

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution uses the STC approach to calculate its credit risk for certain non-securitization exposures to which an exemption under section 12(2)(a) relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that, if the institution were to make a fresh application under section 12(1) for an exemption in respect of those non-securitization exposures, the exemption would be refused by virtue of section 12(2),

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may take one or more of the measures set out in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The measures referred to in subsection (1) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the fresh application referred to in subsection (1)(b) would be refused by virtue of section 12(2), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require the institution to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: submit to the Monetary Authority a plan, within such period (being a period which is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case) as specified in the notice, which satisfies the Monetary Authority that, if it were implemented by the institution, the institution would be able to use the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for those non-securitization exposures within a period which is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, revoke the exemption on such date, or the occurrence of such event, as specified in the notice.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subsection (2)(a).

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that an authorized institution’s compliance with a requirement referred to in subsection (2)(a) does not prejudice the generality of the Monetary Authority’s power under subsection (2)(c).

division.name: D4
division.heading: Prescribed Approaches to Calculation of Credit Risk for Securitization Exposures

section.name: s15
section.heading: Authorized institution must use SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA to determine risk-weight of securitization exposure

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must use the SEC-IRBA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction that is not a re-securitization exposure if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction is classified as an IRB pool; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all of the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.content: the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction is classified as a mixed pool;
the institution is able to calculate the KIRB in accordance with section 254(1) for at least 95% of the total nominal amount of the underlying exposures.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution is to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the securitization exposure has—

subparagraph.content: an ECAI issue specific rating issued by an ECAI nominated by the institution under section 4C for the purposes of Part 7; or (L.N. 167 of 2023)
if subparagraph (i) does not apply, an inferred rating,

subsection.continued: then, subject to subsection (2B), the institution must use the SEC-ERBA to determine the risk-weight of the securitization exposure based on that rating if all of the conditions specified in subsection (2A) are met. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the securitization exposure is not a re-securitization exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the pool of underlying exposures of the securitization transaction is classified as an SA pool; or

subparagraph.leadIn: both of the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the pool of underlying exposures of the securitization transaction is classified as a mixed pool;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the institution is unable to calculate the KIRB in accordance with section 254(1) for at least 95% of the total nominal amount of the underlying exposures. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the securitization exposure—

subparagraph.content: does not have an ECAI issue specific rating issued by an ECAI nominated by the institution under section 4C for the purposes of Part 7; but (L.N. 167 of 2023)
has an internal credit rating,

subsection.continued: then, subject to subsection (2C), the institution may determine the risk-weight of the securitization exposure by using the SEC-ERBA based on the internal credit rating in accordance with section 266A if the securitization exposure is an eligible ABCP exposure and falls within a category of securitization exposures covered by the institution’s IAA approval. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2B) does not apply to an authorized institution in determining the risk-weight of a securitization exposure if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution’s IAA approval has attached to it under section 33A(1) or (2) any condition that prohibits the institution from using the IAA to determine the risk-weight of the exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice issued by the Monetary Authority under section 15D has the effect of prohibiting the institution from using the IAA to determine the risk-weight of the exposure. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must use the SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the securitization exposure is unrated and the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction is classified as an SA pool;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all of the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.content: the securitization exposure is unrated and the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction is classified as a mixed pool;
the institution is unable to calculate the KIRB in accordance with section 254(1) for at least 95% of the total nominal amount of the underlying exposures; (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the securitization exposure is a re-securitization exposure (whether rated or not); or (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution is required to do so pursuant to a notice under section 15D given to it by the Monetary Authority. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1), (2), (2B) and (3), an authorized institution must use the SEC-FBA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction if— (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any of the due diligence requirements in section 15A is not complied with in respect of the exposure or the transaction; (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution is unable to use the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA and SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight; or (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution is required to do so pursuant to a notice under section 15D given to it by the Monetary Authority. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

section.name: s15A
section.heading: Due diligence requirements for using SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA

subsection.content: The due diligence requirements for the purposes of section 15(4)(a) are set out in subsections (2), (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The authorized institution concerned must have a comprehensive understanding, on a continuous basis, of the risk characteristics of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the securitization exposure concerned (whether on-balance sheet or off-balance sheet); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pool of underlying exposures of the securitization transaction that gave rise to the securitization exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must be able to access the following information on a continuous basis and in a timely manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the transaction is not a re-securitization transaction—performance information on the underlying exposures (including issuer name and credit quality); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the transaction is a re-securitization transaction—

subparagraph.content: performance information on the underlying exposures (including issuer name and credit quality); and
information on the risk characteristics and performance of the underlying exposures of the original securitization transaction being re-securitized through the re-securitization transaction.

subsection.content: The institution must have a thorough understanding of each structural feature of the transaction that has the potential to materially affect the performance of the securitization exposure referred to in subsection (2).

section.name: s15B
section.heading: Meaning of eligible ABCP exposure
section.leadIn: For the purposes of these Rules, a securitization exposure of an authorized institution having an IAA approval (specified exposure) is an eligible ABCP exposure if all of the following criteria are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified exposure is an exposure to an ABCP programme (ABCP programme);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: one of the following persons is the sponsor of the ABCP programme—

subparagraph.content: the institution;
a member of a group of entities of which the ultimate holding company is the same as that of the institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the ABCP programme has in place—

subparagraph.content: adequate and prudent standards on the underwriting and structuring of asset purchase transactions; and

adequate and prudent policies, processes and structural features for assessing, controlling and mitigating risks associated with underlying exposures and other parties involved such as sellers of the underlying exposures and servicers;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: there is an ECAI issue specific rating assigned to each of the debt securities with an original maturity of one year or less issued under the ABCP programme by an ECAI that has been nominated by the institution under section 4C for the purposes of Part 7; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances of the institution and the specified exposure are such that if all of the senior debt securities issued under the ABCP programme were held by the institution—

subparagraph.content: the debt securities would be required by section 15 to be risk-weighted by the institution by using the SEC-ERBA based on the ECAI issue specific ratings of the debt securities if section 267(4) did not exist; or

if the debt securities would overlap with the specified exposure or other securitization exposures of the institution to the ABCP programme—the debt securities would be required by section 15 to be so risk-weighted if sections 239 and 267(4) did not exist;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the specified exposure is not a re-securitization exposure;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the specified exposure is backed by a pool of underlying exposures that is classified as an SA pool;

the institution, if it did not have an IAA approval, would be required by section 15 to determine the risk-weight of the specified exposure by using the SEC-ERBA based on an inferred rating of the specified exposure (if such a rating is available) or by using the SEC-SA;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: the initial internal credit rating assigned to the specified exposure by the institution in accordance with the approved internal assessment process is at least equivalent to an ECAI issue specific rating that maps to—

subparagraph.content: a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 or 10 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table made by the Monetary Authority under section 4B(2)(c) for securitization exposures; or
a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3 in the ST ECAI rating mapping table made by the Monetary Authority under section 4B(2)(c) for securitization exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s15C
section.heading: Authorized institution may apply for approval to use IAA to determine risk-weight of eligible ABCP exposure

subsection.content: An authorized institution that has obtained the Monetary Authority’s approval under section 8 to use the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures may make an application to the Monetary Authority for approval to use the IAA to determine the risk-weights of its eligible ABCP exposures (application).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Monetary Authority must determine the application by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: granting approval to the institution to use the IAA to determine the risk-weights of its eligible ABCP exposures falling within—

subparagraph.content: the categories of securitization exposures specified in the application; or
any categories of securitization exposures that the Monetary Authority specifies in the approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval (whether in whole or in part).

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2)(b), the Monetary Authority must refuse to grant an approval to an authorized institution to use the IAA unless the institution satisfies the Monetary Authority that the institution, and its internal assessment process that is the subject of the application, are subject to an appropriate governance and risk management framework (framework) which ensures at all times that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is effective oversight of the internal assessment process and other related activities of the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the rating methodologies used for assessing the institution’s securitization exposures to an ABCP programme are—

subparagraph.content: prudent; and
appropriate to the characteristics of the ABCP programme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: there are adequate and prudent policies, procedures and internal controls for ensuring that—

subparagraph.content: the internal assessment process is risk-sensitive and robust; and
requirements under these Rules, for the time being in force in respect of the use of the IAA, are complied with; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: there are regular and independent reviews conducted by qualified persons to assess the adequacy and validity of the internal assessment process and its outputs.

subsection.content: An authorized institution having an IAA approval must not, without the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, make any significant change to the framework in respect of elements that are relevant to ensuring at all times that the descriptions in subsection (3)(a), (b), (c) and (d) are met.

section.name: s15D
section.heading: Measures that may be taken by Monetary Authority if authorized institution using IAA no longer satisfies specified requirements

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may take one or more of the measures set out in this section in respect of an authorized institution that has an IAA approval if the Monetary Authority determines that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the governance and risk management framework that the institution and its internal assessment process are subject to has ceased to be capable of ensuring at all times that the descriptions in section 15C(3)(a), (b), (c) and (d) are met, or the institution has contravened section 15C(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has contravened a condition attached under section 33A(1) or (2) to its IAA approval; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the institution has used the IAA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure—

subparagraph.content: that is not an eligible ABCP exposure; or
that is an eligible ABCP exposure but does not fall within a category of securitization exposures covered by the institution’s IAA approval.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require the institution to use the SEC-SA or the SEC-FBA, instead of the IAA, to determine the risk-weights of the securitization exposures or categories of securitization exposures specified in the notice, during the period or beginning on the date or on the occurrence of an event specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require the institution to adopt one or more than one measure within the period specified in the notice (being a period that is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case) that, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: will cause the institution to cease to fall within subsection (1) within a period that is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: will otherwise mitigate the effect of the institution falling within subsection (1).

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subsection (2) or (3).

section.name: s16
section.heading: Classification of underlying exposures

subsection.content: An authorized institution must classify the pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the institution must classify the pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction as an IRB pool if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the underlying exposures in the pool are IRB underlying exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has all the data and information necessary for calculating the risk-weighted amounts of all the IRB underlying exposures in accordance with Part 6.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must classify the pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction as a mixed pool if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: some or all of the underlying exposures in the pool are IRB underlying exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has all the data and information necessary for calculating the risk-weighted amounts of some, but not all, of the underlying exposures in the pool in accordance with Part 6.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must classify the pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction as an SA pool if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: some or all of the underlying exposures in the pool are IRB underlying exposures, but the institution is unable to calculate the risk-weighted amount of any of the IRB underlying exposures in accordance with Part 6 due to a lack of necessary data and information;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the securitization transaction is a re-securitization transaction; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution is required by a notice given to it under subsection (5) to do so.

subsection.leadIn: Even if the conditions in subsection (2)(a) and (b) are met, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require it to classify the pool of underlying exposures as an SA pool if the Monetary Authority considers that the classification of the pool as an IRB pool would result in a less prudent estimate of the capital charge for the institution’s securitization exposure to the transaction given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particular structure of the transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the characteristics of the underlying exposures of the transaction.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with the requirement of a notice given to it under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: IRB underlying exposures (IRB組成項目) means underlying exposures that fall, or would fall if they were held directly by the authorized institution concerned, within an IRB class or IRB subclass for which the institution has an approval granted under section 8 to use the IRB approach to calculate the credit risk.

division.name: D4A
division.heading: Calculation of Credit Risk for Exposures to CCPs, etc.

section.name: s16A
section.heading: Authorized institution must use Division 4 of Part 6A to calculate its credit risk for exposures to CCPs, etc.
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate in accordance with Division 4 of Part 6A—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its credit risk for exposures to CCPs in respect of derivative contracts and SFTs cleared by the CCPs and, if the institution is a clearing member of any CCP, its credit risk for exposures to that CCP arising from its default fund contributions to that CCP;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its credit risk for exposures to clearing members in respect of CCP-related transactions and offsetting transactions; (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its credit risk for exposures to direct clients, or higher level clients or lower level clients within multi-level client structures, in respect of CCP-related transactions and offsetting transactions; (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: its credit risk for exposures to direct clients in respect of guarantees of the clients’ performance under transactions or contracts cleared by CCPs; and (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: its credit risk for exposures to persons who hold the collateral posted by the institution in respect of transactions or contracts cleared by CCPs.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Prescribed Approaches to Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge

section.name: s17
section.heading: Authorized institution must use STM approach, SSTM approach or IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution (other than an authorized institution exempted under section 22(1))—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), must use the STM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may use the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge if it has approval to do so under section 17A; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to sections 18(7), 19 and 19A, may use the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of any trading desk for which it has an approval under section 18(2)(a).

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not prevent an authorized institution from using a combination of the STM approach and the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in accordance with another provision of these Rules that expressly permits that combination.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must not use either of the following to calculate its market risk capital charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a combination of the STM approach and the SSTM approach;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a combination of the SSTM approach and the IMA.

section.name: s17A
section.heading: Approval for authorized institution to use SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge

subsection.content: An authorized institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to use the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the Monetary Authority must determine an application from an authorized institution under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to use the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the Monetary Authority may grant approval to an authorized institution to use the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s risk-weighted amount for market risk under the SSTM approach—

subparagraph.content: does not exceed $1 billion on a permanent basis; and
does not exceed 2% of its total risk-weighted assets on a permanent basis;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the institution is not a G-SIB, a D-SIB or a subsidiary of a G-SIB; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution does not hold a CTP.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may refuse to grant approval to an authorized institution that meets the criteria set out in subsection (3) if the Monetary Authority considers that it is prudent to do so, having regard to the complexity and size of the risks in any of the institution’s risk classes.
The Monetary Authority must specify in an approval under this section the date on which the approval takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: If an approval under this section for an authorized institution is in effect, the institution must give written notice to the Monetary Authority if the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no longer on a permanent basis fulfils all of the criteria set out in subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expects that any of those criteria will not be fulfilled.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: D-SIB has the meaning given by section 3E(1);
G-SIB has the meaning given by section 3E(1).

section.name: s17B
section.heading: Revocation of approval for authorized institution to use SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge
section.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to an authorized institution, revoke an approval granted to the institution under section 17A if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that, if the approval were not in effect and the institution were to make a fresh application under section 17A(1), that application would be refused; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has given the Monetary Authority a notice under section 17A(6).

section.name: s18
section.heading: Approval for authorized institution to use IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of trading desks

subsection.content: An authorized institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to use the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of any one or more trading desks.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), the Monetary Authority must determine an application from an authorized institution under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to use the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of any one or more trading desks specified in the approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may grant approval to an authorized institution if, following the approval, at least 10% of its aggregate market risk capital charges will be based on positions held on trading desks referred to in the approval.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must refuse to grant approval in respect of a trading desk that holds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securitization exposures; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: equity investments in a collective investment scheme that cannot be looked through but are assigned to the trading book.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must refuse to grant approval to an authorized institution if any one or more of the requirements in Schedule 3 applicable to the institution are not satisfied.
The Monetary Authority must specify in an approval the date on which, or an event on the occurrence of which, the approval takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that uses the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of any one or more trading desks—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must also calculate its market risk capital charge using the STM approach in respect of each trading desk for which it uses the IMA; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must also calculate its market risk capital charge using the STM approach across all trading desks.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approval (批准) means an approval under subsection (2)(a);
core model documentation (核心模式文件) means the core model documentation referred to in section 1(1)(d)(i) of Schedule 3.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Measures which may be taken by Monetary Authority if authorized institution using IMA no longer satisfies specified requirements

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may take one or more of the measures set out in subsection (2) in relation to an authorized institution that uses the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of one or more trading desks if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the approval under section 18(2)(a) were not in effect and the institution were to make a fresh application under section 18(1)—the application would be refused because of section 18(5);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an internal model falls into the back-testing red zone referred to in item 7 of Table 32A. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: The measures referred to in subsection (1) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to the institution, require the institution to use the STM approach instead of the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of the trading desks specified in the notice beginning on a date, or on the occurrence of an event, as specified in the notice; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require the institution to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: submit to the Monetary Authority a plan, within such period (being a period which is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case) as specified in the notice, which satisfies the Monetary Authority that, if it were implemented by the institution, the institution would cease to fall within subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) within a period which is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: implement the plan;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, advise the institution that the Monetary Authority is considering exercising the power under section 97F of the Ordinance to vary any capital requirement rule applicable to the institution, including by increasing all or any of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the institution’s CET1 capital ratio;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the institution’s Tier 1 capital ratio;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the institution’s Total capital ratio; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require the institution to calculate its market risk capital charge by the use of such higher multiplication factor as specified in the notice in accordance with section 322E(3); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, require the institution to reduce its market risk exposures in such manner, or to adopt such measures, specified in the notice which, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, will cause the institution to cease to fall within subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) within a period which is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case, or will otherwise mitigate the effect of the institution falling within that subsection. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subsection (2)(a), (b), (d) or (e).

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements specified in Schedule 3 are also applicable to and in relation to an authorized institution using the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of the use by the institution of an internal model to which a change of the core model documentation referred to in section 18(7)(a) relates (whether or not the institution has, in respect of that change, been given the prior consent required by that section), and subsection (1) and the other provisions of this section apply to the institution accordingly; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (2)(c) does not operate to prejudice the generality of the circumstances in respect of which the Monetary Authority may exercise the power under section 97F of the Ordinance in the case of an authorized institution to which that subsection applies. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.name: s19A
section.heading: Authorized institution that has approval to use IMA must use STM approach in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a trading desk in respect of which an authorized institution has an approval under section 18(2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no longer fulfils the back-testing requirements under section 322G(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time on or after the first anniversary of the day on which section 322G comes into operation*, is assigned to the red zone in the profit and loss attribution test under section 322G(3).

subsection.leadIn: The institution must use the STM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of the trading desk until the trading desk—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has satisfied the back-testing requirements over the past 12 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been reassigned to the green zone in the profit and loss attribution test.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must give written notice to the Monetary Authority if the institution because of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: switches from using the IMA to using the STM approach; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: switches back from using the STM approach to using the IMA.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may permit an authorized institution to continue using the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge in respect of a trading desk to which subsection (1) applies if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that there are the most extraordinary circumstances with systemic relevance.

If the Monetary Authority permits under subsection (4) an authorized institution to continue using the IMA in respect of a trading desk, the institution must, as quickly as it is able, update its internal models to take into account the regime shift or significant market stress resulting from the circumstances referred to in that subsection.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Exemption from section 17

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to an authorized institution (other than an authorized institution which uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk), exempt the institution from section 17 if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that— (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s market risk positions—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: never exceed 5% of its total on-balance sheet and off-balance sheet exposures; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: only sporadically exceed 5%, and never exceed 6%, of its total on-balance sheet and off-balance sheet exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s market risk positions—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: never exceed $50 million; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: only sporadically exceed $50 million and never exceed $60 million.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the amount of an authorized institution’s market risk positions is calculated by aggregating—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the institution’s total gross (long plus short) positions in debt securities and debt-related derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the arithmetic mean of the institution’s total long and total short positions in interest rate derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the institution’s total gross (long plus short) positions in equities and equity-related derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the institution’s total net open position in foreign exchange exposures as derived in section 296; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the institution’s total gross (long plus short) positions in commodities and commodity-related derivative contracts; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized institution’s total on-balance sheet and off-balance sheet exposures are derived by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: aggregating the institution’s total liabilities, total assets less specific and collective provisions, and the principal amount (within the meaning of section 51(1)) of all of the institution’s off-balance sheet exposures; and (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deducting therefrom the institution’s paid-up capital, reserves (including current year’s profit or loss) and perpetual or term subordinated debt.

subsection.leadIn: The date in relation to which an authorized institution’s market risk positions are assessed for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), the calendar quarter end date of each of the 4 consecutive calendar quarters of the same calendar year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), the calendar quarter end date of the consecutive calendar quarters, being not more than 4 consecutive calendar quarters, specified by the Monetary Authority by notice in writing given to the institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date specified by the Monetary Authority by notice in writing given to the institution. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution is exempted under this section from section 17, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not, except with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, include market risk in the calculation of its capital adequacy ratio;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an increase in its market risk positions which causes, or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, the institution to cease to fall within subsection (1)(a) or (b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an intention to increase its market risk positions which will cause, or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, the institution to cease to fall within subsection (1)(a) or (b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall apply Part 4, 5 or 7, as the case requires, to calculate the credit risk for the institution’s market risk positions except for its total net open position in foreign exchange exposures as derived in section 296.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, the following expressions have the respective meanings assigned to them by section 281—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: debt security; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: equity.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Revocation of exemption under section 22

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution is exempted under section 22(1) from section 17; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that, if the institution were not already so exempted, the exemption would be refused by virtue of the institution failing to satisfy the Monetary Authority as specified in section 22(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the institution has given the Monetary Authority a notice referred to in section 22(4)(b), (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, revoke the exemption granted under section 22(1), beginning on such date, or the occurrence of such event, as specified in the notice.

subsection.content: Section 17 applies to an authorized institution immediately upon the revocation under this section of an exemption under section 22(1).

division.name: D5A
division.heading: Prescribed Approaches to Calculation of CVA Risk Capital Charge

section.name: s23C
section.heading: Approaches authorized institution must use to calculate its CVA risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: may use the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge in respect of one or more transactions if the institution has approval to do so under section 23D; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (5), in the circumstances specified in subsection (2), may calculate its risk-weighted amount for CVA risk as the aggregate of—

subparagraph.content: the IMM(CCR) risk-weighted amount of the transactions or contracts concerned that are covered by the IMM(CCR) approval;
the SA-CCR risk-weighted amount of the transactions or contracts concerned that fall within section 10B(5) or (7); and
the SFT risk-weighted amount of the SFTs that are not covered by the IMM(CCR) approval or that fall within section 10B(5) or (7).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), the circumstances are that the total notional amount of the institution’s OTC derivative transactions that are not cleared with a CCP does not exceed $1 trillion on a permanent basis.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prevent an authorized institution from using a combination of the reduced basic CVA approach and the standardized CVA approach, or a combination of the full basic CVA approach and the standardized CVA approach, to calculate its CVA risk capital charge for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: different counterparties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: different netting sets with the same counterparty; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: different transactions within the same netting set, if—

subparagraph.content: the netting set is split into 2 synthetic netting sets, where one is subject to the standardized CVA approach and the other is subject to the reduced basic CVA approach or the full basic CVA approach; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the split—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is consistent with the treatment of the legal netting set used by the institution for accounting purposes; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: results from the fact that the approval under section 23D does not cover all transactions within the netting set.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must not use any of the following to calculate its CVA risk capital charge or risk-weighted amount for CVA risk—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a combination of the reduced basic CVA approach and the approach set out in subsection (1)(d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a combination of the full basic CVA approach and the approach set out in subsection (1)(d);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a combination of the standardized CVA approach and the approach set out in subsection (1)(d).

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to an authorized institution, prohibit the institution from using the approach set out in subsection (1)(d) to calculate its risk-weighted amount for CVA risk if the Monetary Authority considers that the CVA risk of the institution materially contributes to the overall risk of the institution.
An authorized institution must comply with a notice given to it under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: CEM risk-weighted amount (CEM風險加權數額) has the meaning given by section 106(7);
SFT risk-weighted amount (SFT風險加權數額) has the meaning given by section 52(9) or 106(7), as the case requires.

section.name: s23D
section.heading: Approval for authorized institution to use standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge

subsection.content: An authorized institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to use the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge in respect of the types of transactions specified in the application.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Monetary Authority must determine an application from an authorized institution under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to use the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge in respect of the transactions specified in the approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may only grant approval to an authorized institution if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the institution meets the requirements specified in Schedule 1B that are applicable to it.
The Monetary Authority must specify in an approval the date on which, or the event on the occurrence of which, the approval takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: If an approval for an authorized institution under this section is in effect, the institution must give written notice to the Monetary Authority if the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no longer meets all of the requirements specified in Schedule 1B that are applicable to it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expects that any of those requirements will not be met.

section.name: s23E
section.heading: Revocation of approval under section 23D

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to an authorized institution, revoke an approval granted under section 23D, and require the institution, on and after the date specified in the notice or the occurrence of an event specified in the notice, to use another approach instead of the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge in respect of the transactions specified in the approval if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: if the approval were not in effect and the institution were to make a fresh application under section 23D(1), that application would be refused; or
the institution has contravened a condition attached under section 33A(1) or (2) to the approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has given the Monetary Authority a notice under section 23D(5).

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with a notice given to it under subsection (1).

division.name: D7
division.heading: Calculation of Capital Adequacy Ratio: Solo Basis, Solo-consolidated Basis and Consolidated Basis

section.name: s27
section.heading: Authorized institution shall calculate its capital adequacy ratio on solo basis, solo-consolidated basis or consolidated basis

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis or, if it has the approval to do so under section 28(2)(a), calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 33, calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 33, the Monetary Authority may, in a section 3C requirement, require an authorized institution to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis in respect of a subsidiary of the institution (other than a subsidiary which is an insurance firm or securities firm) where— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: more than 50% of the total assets or total income of the subsidiary relate to or arise from the carrying out of one or more than one relevant financial activity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that, after taking into account the nature of the business undertaken by the subsidiary, the institution should calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis in respect of that subsidiary if a relevant risk of the institution is to be adequately identified and assessed.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—

def.name: RelevantFinancialActivity
def.leadIn: relevant financial activity (有關財務活動), in relation to a subsidiary of an authorized institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an activity which is ancillary to a principal activity of the institution, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: owning and managing the institution’s property; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: performing information technology functions for the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: lending, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the provision of consumer or mortgage credit;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: factoring;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: forfaiting; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the provision of guarantees and other financial commitments;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: financial leasing;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: money transmission services;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: issuing and administering a means of payment, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: credit cards;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: travellers’ cheques; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: bank drafts;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: trading for the subsidiary’s own account, or for accounts of the subsidiary’s customers, in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: money market instruments;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: foreign exchange;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: financial instruments which are traded on an exchange;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: OTC derivative transactions; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: transferable securities;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: participating in securities issues, including the provision of services relating to the issues;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the provision of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: advice to undertakings on capital structure or industrial strategy, including any matter relating to capital structure or industrial strategy; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: advice and services relating to mergers and the purchase of undertakings;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: money broking; (L.N. 128 of 2014)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: portfolio management and the provision of advice in relation to portfolio management; or (L.N. 128 of 2014)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: custodial and safekeeping services. (L.N. 128 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis shall give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority of any of the following matters as soon as is practicable after the institution is aware of the matter or ought to be aware of the matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the institution’s consolidation group ceasing to be a subsidiary of the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsidiary of the institution becoming a member of its consolidation group;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the principal activities of a subsidiary referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any significant change to the principal activities of the institution or any of its subsidiaries (including a subsidiary referred to in paragraph (b)).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Authorized institution may apply for approval to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on solo-consolidated basis

subsection.content: An authorized institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis instead of a solo basis in respect of such of its subsidiaries which are members of its consolidation group as specified in the application.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Monetary Authority shall determine an application under subsection (1) from an authorized institution by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis instead of a solo basis in respect of such subsidiaries of the institution as specified in the approval, and giving the institution a section 3C requirement to give effect to the approval; or (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2)(b), the Monetary Authority shall refuse to grant approval to an authorized institution to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis instead of a solo basis in respect of a subsidiary of the institution unless the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the subsidiary is wholly owned by, and managed as if it were an integral part of, the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the subsidiary is wholly financed by the institution such that the subsidiary has no depositors or other external creditors except external creditors for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: audit fees;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: company secretarial services; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sundry operating expenses; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there are no regulatory, legal or taxation constraints on the transfer of the subsidiary’s capital to the institution.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has been granted an approval under subsection (2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an event (referred to in this subsection as relevant event) which could reasonably be construed as causing, or potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, a subsidiary of the institution to fall outside subsection (3)(a), (b) or (c), occurs,

subsection.continued: the institution shall, as soon as is practicable after the relevant event occurs, give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority of the relevant event.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Solo basis for calculation of capital adequacy ratio

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall in calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: aggregate the institution’s (including the institution’s local branches’ and overseas branches’) risk-weighted amounts for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: credit risk;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: CVA risk; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
market risk; (L.N. 222 of 2018)
operational risk; and (L.N. 222 of 2018)
sovereign concentration risk; (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deduct from the aggregate amount derived under paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that portion, as determined on a solo basis, of the total regulatory reserve for general banking risks and collective provisions of the institution apportioned to the STC approach or BSC approach, and to the SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA, which is not included in the Tier 2 capital of the institution; and (L.N. 175 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount, as determined on a solo basis, of the net book value of the institution’s reserves attributable to fair value gains arising from the revaluation of the institution’s holdings of land and buildings, which is not included in the Tier 2 capital of the institution; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determine the institution’s capital base, in accordance with Part 3, to reflect the fact that it is calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this section, an authorized institution shall risk-weight the exposures of an overseas branch of the institution in accordance with these Rules.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Solo-consolidated basis for calculation of capital adequacy ratio

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution shall in calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: aggregate the institution’s (including the institution’s local branches’ and overseas branches’) and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries’ risk-weighted amounts for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: credit risk;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: CVA risk; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
market risk; (L.N. 222 of 2018)
operational risk; and (L.N. 222 of 2018)
sovereign concentration risk; (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deduct from the aggregate amount derived under paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that portion, as determined on a solo-consolidated basis, of the total regulatory reserve for general banking risks and collective provisions of the institution and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries apportioned to the STC approach or BSC approach, and to the SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA, which is not included in the Tier 2 capital of the institution and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries; and (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 175 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount, as determined on a solo-consolidated basis, of the net book value of the institution’s and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries’ reserves attributable to fair value gains arising from the revaluation of the institution’s and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries’ holdings of land and buildings, which is not included in the Tier 2 capital of the institution and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determine the capital base of the institution and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries, in accordance with Part 3, to reflect the fact that it is calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that, for the purposes of this section, an authorized institution shall risk-weight the exposures of an overseas branch of the institution in accordance with these Rules.

An authorized institution which calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis shall ensure that, in calculating that ratio, the risk-weighting of a relevant risk does not include inter-company balances with, and transactions between, the institution and its solo-consolidated subsidiaries.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Consolidated basis for calculation of capital adequacy ratio

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall in calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: aggregate the institution’s consolidation group’s (including the institution’s local branches’ and overseas branches’) risk-weighted amounts for— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: credit risk;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: CVA risk; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
market risk; (L.N. 222 of 2018)
operational risk; and (L.N. 222 of 2018)
sovereign concentration risk; (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deduct from the aggregate amount derived under paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that portion, as determined on a consolidated basis, of the total regulatory reserve for general banking risks and collective provisions of the institution’s consolidation group apportioned to the STC approach or BSC approach, and to the SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA, which is not included in the Tier 2 capital of the institution’s consolidation group; and (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 175 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount, as determined on a consolidated basis, of the net book value of the institution’s consolidation group’s reserves attributable to fair value gains arising from the revaluation of the institution’s consolidation group’s holdings of land and buildings, which is not included in the Tier 2 capital of the institution’s consolidation group; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determine the institution’s consolidation group’s capital base, in accordance with Part 3, to reflect the fact that it is calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis.

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that, under the consolidated basis for the calculation of the capital adequacy ratio of an authorized institution, the institution shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risk-weighting of a relevant risk does not include the exposures of a subsidiary of the institution which is not a member of its consolidation group; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weighting of a relevant risk does not include inter-company balances with, and transactions between, members of its consolidation group.

subsection.content: An authorized institution which calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis may, insofar as its market risk is concerned, offset market risk positions between members of its consolidation group if those market risk positions are monitored and managed on a group basis.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this section, an authorized institution shall risk-weight the exposures of an overseas branch of the institution in accordance with these Rules. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 31

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution which calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis shall do so using the same approach in calculating a relevant risk as it would be required to use if it were calculating that ratio on a solo basis.

With the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, an authorized institution which calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis is not required to comply with subsection (1) if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it is not practicable for every member of its consolidation group to use the same approach to calculate the relevant risk of the group on that basis.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Exceptions to section 27

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified subsidiary calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis in accordance with the capital adequacy standards applicable in the jurisdiction in which it is incorporated, (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.continued: the institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to risk-weight the exposures of that subsidiary (which may be all those exposures or a class thereof) in accordance with those standards instead of in accordance with these Rules. (L.N. 137 of 2011; 14 of 2025 s. 179)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Monetary Authority shall determine an application under subsection (1) from an authorized institution by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to risk-weight the exposures of the subsidiary specified in the application, or those exposures specified by the Monetary Authority in the approval, in accordance with the capital adequacy standards applicable in the jurisdiction where the subsidiary is incorporated instead of in accordance with these Rules, and giving the institution a section 3C requirement to give effect to the approval; or (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval (whether in whole or in part). (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2)(b), the Monetary Authority shall refuse to grant approval to an authorized institution to risk-weight the exposures of a subsidiary which is a member of the institution’s consolidation group in accordance with the capital adequacy standards applicable in the jurisdiction in which the subsidiary is incorporated instead of in accordance with these Rules unless the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the use of those standards would not materially prejudice the calculation of the institution’s capital adequacy ratio. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

An authorized institution which calculates its capital adequacy ratio on a consolidated basis may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to calculate that ratio by excluding one or more than one member from its consolidation group.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), the Monetary Authority shall determine an application under subsection (4) from an authorized institution by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to calculate its capital adequacy ratio by excluding from its consolidation group such members of the group as the Monetary Authority specifies and giving the institution a section 3C requirement to give effect to the approval; or (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing to grant the approval.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (5)(b), the Monetary Authority shall refuse to grant approval to an authorized institution to calculate its capital adequacy ratio by excluding from its consolidation group any member of the group unless the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the inclusion of that member in the group—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: would be inappropriate or misleading; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not practicable due to regulatory, legal or taxation constraints on the transfer of information necessary to enable the institution to calculate that ratio on a consolidated basis in respect of that member.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

def.name: SpecifiedSubsidiary
def.leadIn: specified subsidiary (指明附屬公司), in relation to an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a subsidiary of the institution that is a member of the institution’s consolidation group and is incorporated in a jurisdiction other than Hong Kong; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a subsidiary of the institution that is a re-domiciled entity. (14 of 2025 s. 179)

division.name: D7A
division.heading: Attachment of Conditions to Approvals Granted under Section 6(2)(a), 8(2)(a), 10B(2)(a), 15C(2)(a) or 18(2)(a)

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Attachment of conditions to approvals granted under section 6(2)(a), 8(2)(a), 10B(2)(a), 15C(2)(a) or 18(2)(a)

subsection.content: Where the Monetary Authority grants an approval under section 6(2)(a), 8(2)(a), 10B(2)(a), 15C(2)(a) or 18(2)(a) to an authorized institution, the approval may be granted subject to any conditions that the Monetary Authority thinks proper to attach to the approval in any particular case. (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 222 of 2018; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Monetary Authority may at any time, by notice in writing served on an authorized institution in respect of which the Monetary Authority has granted an approval under section 6(2)(a), 8(2)(a), 10B(2)(a), 15C(2)(a) or 18(2)(a) (whether before, on or after 1 January 2012), attach to the institution’s approval any conditions (including attach by way of amending conditions already attached to the approval), or cancel any conditions attached to the approval, that the Monetary Authority thinks proper, with effect from— (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 222 of 2018; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the date of service of the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such later date (if any) as is specified in the notice.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Decisions to which Section 101B(1) of Ordinance Applies

section.name: s34
section.heading: Reviewable decisions

subsection.content: A decision made by the Monetary Authority under section 6(2), 8(2), 10B(2), 15C(2), 18(2) or 33A(1) or (2) is a decision to which section 101B(1) of the Ordinance applies. (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 222 of 2018; L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D1
division.heading: General

section.name: s35
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Affiliate
def.leadIn: affiliate (附屬成員), in relation to an authorized institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an entity that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has a beneficial interest in, or controls, 20% or more of the total number of ordinary shares in the institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 20% or more of the voting power in the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an entity in which the institution or an entity falling within paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has a beneficial interest in, or controls, 20% or more of the total number of ordinary shares; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 20% or more of the voting power;

def.name: BankSubsidiary
def.leadIn: bank subsidiary (銀行附屬公司), in relation to an authorized institution, means a subsidiary of the institution that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a bank or any other entity that is subject to substantially similar regulation and supervision as a bank; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to consolidation under a section 3C requirement;

def.name: CashFlowHedge
def.leadIn: cash flow hedge (現金流對沖), in relation to a hedging relationship of an authorized institution, means a hedge of an exposure of the institution to variability in cash flows that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is attributable to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a particular risk associated with an asset or liability recognized on the institution’s balance sheet; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a highly probable uncommitted but anticipated future transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: could affect the institution’s profit or loss;

section.def: commercial entity (商業實體) means any entity in the private sector, other than a financial sector entity;

def.name: ConnectedCompany
def.leadIn: connected company (有連繫公司), in relation to an authorized institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a subsidiary, or the holding company, of the institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company that falls within section 64(1)(b), (c), (d) or (e) of the Ordinance in respect of the institution;

def.name: FinancialSectorEntity
def.leadIn: financial sector entity (金融業實體) means an entity that is engaged predominantly in one or more of the following activities, whether by itself or through any of its subsidiaries—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: banking;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: insurance business;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: financial leasing;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the issuance of credit cards;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: portfolio management;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: investment advisory services;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: custodial and safekeeping services;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: central clearing services;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: activities ancillary to banking;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: activities similar to any of the activities set out in any of paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h) and (i);

def.name: IndirectHolding
def.leadIn: indirect holding (間接持有), in relation to an authorized institution, means an exposure of the institution in respect of a capital instrument issued by, or a non-capital LAC liability of, a financial sector entity in circumstances where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument or liability is not held by the institution directly; but

paragraph.name: b

def.name: InsignificantLACInvestment
def.leadIn: insignificant LAC investment (非重大LAC投資), in relation to an authorized institution, means an investment by the institution in a capital instrument issued by, or a non-capital LAC liability of, an entity that is neither of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an affiliate of the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entity of which the institution owns more than 10% of the issued ordinary share capital; (L.N. 222 of 2018)

section.def: loss-absorbing capacity (吸收虧損能力) has the meaning given by rule 2(1) of the LAC Rules; (L.N. 222 of 2018)
