paragraph.content: any material credit obligation is past due for more than 90 days;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any material credit obligation is put on non-accrued status;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: any credit obligation is sold at a material credit-related economic loss;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a distressed restructuring of any credit obligation is agreed by the institution;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the obligor has sought, or has been placed in, bankruptcy or similar protection where this would avoid or delay repayment of any of the credit obligations to the institution or any member of the consolidation group of the institution;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any other situation where the institution considers that the obligor is unlikely to pay in full its credit obligations to the institution, without recourse to actions by the institution such as realization of available collateral.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2)(a), (3)(a)(i) and (4)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if an authorized institution has provided an overdraft facility to an obligor and advised the obligor of the credit limit set for the facility, the facility becomes past due once—

subparagraph.content: the obligor has breached the credit limit; or
the institution has advised the obligor of a new credit limit that is smaller than the current outstanding balance of the facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an authorized institution has not provided any overdraft facility to an obligor, an overdraft by the obligor becomes past due on the same day that the overdraft occurs.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, failure of a counterparty to settle a transaction on the settlement date referred to in section 65L(3) or (4) is not in itself regarded as a default for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: non-accrued status (非累算狀況), in relation to an exposure of an authorized institution to an obligor, includes situations where accrued interest on the exposure is no longer recognized by the institution as income or, if recognized, an equivalent amount of provisions is made by the institution in respect of the exposure.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Exposures to credit-linked notes

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), if a credit-linked note issued by an issuer has an ECAI issue specific rating, an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to section 54E(2), determine the credit quality grade applicable to the note by mapping the ECAI issue specific rating of the note to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs or the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs, as the case requires;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: determine the risk-weight that would be attributable to the reference obligations of the note—

subparagraph.content: under that Subdivision based on the credit quality grade determined under paragraph (a) if the reference obligations would fall within one of the ECAI ratings based portfolios; or
under Subdivision 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8, as applicable, if the reference obligations would not fall within any ECAI ratings based portfolio; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: allocate to an exposure to the note the higher of the 2 risk-weights determined under paragraphs (b) and (c).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), if a credit-linked note issued by an issuer does not have an ECAI issue specific rating, an authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to an exposure to the note that is the higher of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risk-weight that would be attributable to the note as an exposure to the issuer under Subdivision 3, 4 or 7, as applicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight that would be attributable to the reference obligations of the note under Subdivision 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8, as applicable.

subsection.leadIn: If a credit-linked note (whether having an ECAI issue specific rating or not)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a first-to-default note, second-to-default note or nth-to-default note; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides credit protection proportionately to a basket of reference obligations,

subsection.continued: an authorized institution must determine the risk-weight attributable to an exposure to the note as the risk-weight attributable to the pool of reference obligations of the note determined in accordance with section 68B(1), (2), (3) or (4), as the case requires, as if the exposure to the note were a direct exposure to the credit default swap embedded in the note.

subsection.content: If an exposure to a credit-linked note is a defaulted exposure, an authorized institution must determine the risk-weight applicable to the exposure in accordance with Subdivision 8.
This section does not apply to an exposure to a credit-linked note, or any part of such an exposure, to which any provision in Subdivision 6 applies.

section.name: s68A
section.heading: Determination of risk-weight applicable to certain types of off-balance sheet exposures

subsection.content: If an off-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution (subject exposure) is an asset sale with recourse, a sale and repurchase agreement (other than a repo-style transaction) or a forward asset purchase, where the institution is exposed to the credit risk of the assets sold or to be purchased, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the risk-weight applicable to those assets.
If a subject exposure is partly paid-up shares and securities, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the risk-weight applicable to the relevant shares or securities.

If a subject exposure is a direct credit substitute arising from the selling of credit protection in the form of total return swap or credit default swap in the authorized institution’s banking book, subject to section 68B, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the risk-weight applicable to the reference obligation specified in the swap.

If a subject exposure is a default risk exposure in respect of a single-name credit default swap that falls within section 226J(1) and the amount of the default risk exposure is determined in accordance with section 226J(3), the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the attributed risk-weight of the counterparty in respect of the swap without taking into account any recognized credit risk mitigation afforded to the swap.

If a subject exposure is a commitment to extend a loan secured by a fully completed immovable property and the exposure, but for the fact that it does not satisfy any one or more of section 65(1)(b), (c) or (d), would have been a regulatory real estate exposure, the authorized institution may allocate a risk-weight in accordance with section 65B or 65C, as the case requires, to the exposure, if the institution has no reason to believe that any of section 65(1)(b), (c) or (d) will not be satisfied immediately after the loan that is the subject of the commitment is drawn down.

section.name: s68B
section.heading: Further provisions in relation to direct credit substitutes

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 68A(3) arises from a first-to-default credit derivative contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the sum of the risk-weights applicable to the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is subject to a cap of 1 250%.

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 68A(3) arises from a second-to-default credit derivative contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the sum of the risk-weights applicable to the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract but excluding the lowest of those risk-weights; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is subject to a cap of 1 250%.

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 68A(3) arises from any other nth-to-default credit derivative contract, subsection (2), with all necessary modifications, applies to that contract as it applies to a second-to-default credit derivative contract, so that the reference to “lowest” in subsection (2)(a) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “lowest and second lowest” in the case of a third-to-default credit derivative contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “lowest, second lowest and third lowest” in the case of a fourth-to-default credit derivative contract,

subsection.continued: and likewise for other nth-to-default credit derivative contracts.

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 68A(3) arises from a credit derivative contract that provides credit protection proportionately in respect of the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is calculated in accordance with Formula 1B.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Risk-weight of Off-balance Sheet Exposure Arising from Credit Derivative Contract under Section 68B(4)

subsection.leadIn:
where—
(a)RWa is the weighted average risk-weight of a basket of reference obligations;
(b)ai is the proportion of credit protection allocated to reference obligation i; and
(c)RWi is the risk-weight of reference obligation i.

section.name: s68C
section.heading: Exposures in respect of assets underlying SFTs

subsection.content: This section applies to an authorized institution’s exposure to the asset underlying a specified SFT.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if a specified SFT is booked in the institution’s banking book, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat the securities sold or lent, or the securities provided as collateral, under the specified SFT as an on-balance sheet exposure of the institution as if the institution had never entered into the specified SFT; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allocate to the exposure the risk-weight attributable to the securities.

subsection.content: If the securities referred to in subsection (2)(a) are securitization issues, the risk-weight attributable to the securities must be determined in accordance with Part 7.

To avoid doubt, if a specified SFT is booked in an authorized institution’s trading book, an exposure of the institution to the asset underlying the specified SFT is an exposure subject to the requirements of Part 8 instead of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified SFT (指明SFT), in relation to an authorized institution, means—(a)a repo-style transaction that falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of repo-style transaction in section 2(1); or(b)a repo-style transaction that falls within paragraph (d) of that definition under which the collateral provided by the institution is in the form of securities.

division.name: D3A
division.heading: CIS Exposures

section.name: s69
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 3A
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: indirect CIS exposure (間接CIS風險承擔) means an indirect CIS exposure within the meaning of section 226ZH;
Level 1 CIS (1級CIS) means a Level 1 CIS within the meaning of section 226ZH;
Level 2 CIS (2級CIS) means a Level 2 CIS within the meaning of section 226ZH;
Level n+1 CIS (n+1級CIS) means a Level n+1 CIS within the meaning of section 226ZH.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Treatment of CIS exposure held by authorized institution

subsection.content: If no amount of an authorized institution’s CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS constitutes a deductible holding, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the exposure in accordance with Part 6B.

subsection.leadIn: If any amount of an authorized institution’s CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS constitutes one or more deductible holdings, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: classify the amounts of the CIS exposure that constitute deductible holdings into one portion (portion A);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: classify the amount of the CIS exposure that does not constitute deductible holdings into another portion (portion B);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: apply the treatment set out in section 70A to each of the amounts of the CIS exposure in portion A; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of portion B (if any) in accordance with Part 6B.

section.name: s70A
section.heading: Treatment of CIS exposure constituting deductible holding

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an authorized institution’s CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS, or any part of the exposure, that constitutes a deductible holding.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: deduct any amount determined under paragraph (a) from its capital base; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of any amount determined under paragraph (b) by multiplying that amount by the applicable risk-weight determined in accordance with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allocate a risk-weight, determined in accordance with section 65G(1)(a) or (b), as the case requires, to any amount of deductible holding determined under subsection (2)(b), if the deductible holding is an insignificant LAC investment that is an equity exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: allocate a risk-weight of 150% to any amount of deductible holding determined under subsection (2)(b), if the deductible holding is—

subparagraph.content: an insignificant LAC investment that is not an equity exposure; or
a holding of non-capital LAC liabilities falling within section 48A; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: allocate a risk-weight of 250% to any amount of deductible holding determined under subsection (2)(b), if the deductible holding is a significant LAC investment in a CET1 capital instrument.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, this section also applies to cases where a CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS, or any part of the exposure, constitutes a deductible holding because regulatory deductible items are held by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Level 2 CIS to which the Level 1 CIS has a CIS exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Level n+1 CIS (where n is an integer equal to or greater than 2) to which the Level 1 CIS has an indirect CIS exposure.

section.name: s70B
section.heading: Determination of risk-weights applicable to certain types of off-balance sheet CIS exposures

subsection.content: This section applies to a CIS exposure that is an off-balance sheet exposure.

If the CIS exposure is an asset sale with recourse, a sale and repurchase agreement (other than a repo-style transaction) or a forward asset purchase, where the seller or buyer of the assets underlying the transaction is exposed to the credit risk of the assets sold or to be purchased, the risk-weight applicable to the CIS exposure is the risk-weight applicable to those assets.
If the CIS exposure is partly paid-up shares and securities, the risk-weight applicable to the CIS exposure is the risk-weight applicable to the relevant shares or securities.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Calculation of Exposure Amounts of Off-balance Sheet Exposures

section.name: s71
section.heading: Calculation of exposure amounts of off-balance sheet exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the credit equivalent amount of an off-balance sheet exposure (other than an exposure to which subsection (2) or (5) applies) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determining the CCF applicable to the exposure in accordance with Schedule 6 and, if applicable, subsection (1A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiplying the principal amount of the exposure, after deducting any specific provisions applicable to the exposure, by the CCF determined under paragraph (a). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If an off-balance sheet exposure (exposure A) is a commitment the drawdown of which would give rise to another off-balance sheet exposure (exposure B), the CCF applicable to exposure A is the lower of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the CCF applicable to the commitment determined in accordance with Schedule 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the CCF applicable to exposure B determined in accordance with Schedule 6. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has posted unsegregated collateral to a counterparty for a transaction or contract booked in its banking book or trading book; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the collateral is not posted for a derivative contract or SFT; or
the collateral is posted for a derivative contract or SFT but is not included in the calculation of default risk exposures under Division 1A, 2 or 2B of Part 6A,

subsection.continued: the institution must calculate the credit equivalent amount of its off-balance sheet exposure to the counterparty in respect of the collateral as the product of the principal amount (without deduction of any specific provisions) of the collateral and a factor of (1 + H). (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), H is the standard supervisory haircut applicable to the collateral, subject to adjustment set out in section 92. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

An authorized institution must calculate its default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs by using the approach or methods set out in Division 1A, 2 or 2B of Part 6A, as the case requires. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

division.name: D5
division.heading: Use of Recognized Collateral in Credit Risk Mitigation: General

section.name: s77
section.heading: Recognized collateral

subsection.leadIn: Collateral is recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of an exposure (collateralized exposure) of an authorized institution if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an institution that uses the simple approach in its treatment of recognized collateral—all the criteria specified in subsections (2) and (3) are met; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an institution that uses the comprehensive approach in its treatment of recognized collateral—all the criteria specified in subsections (2) and (4) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The criteria specified in this subsection are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all documentation creating the collateral and providing for the obligations of the parties with respect to each other in respect of the collateral is binding on all parties and legally enforceable in all relevant jurisdictions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the legal mechanism by which the collateral is pledged (or otherwise provided as security) ensures that the authorized institution has the right to realize, or to take legal possession of, the collateral in a timely manner in the event of a default by, or the insolvency or bankruptcy of, or any other event specified in the relevant legal documentation applicable to any of—

subparagraph.content: the obligor in respect of the collateralized exposure; or
the custodian, if any, holding the collateral;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the authorized institution has taken all steps to fulfil requirements under the law applicable to the institution’s interest in the collateral that are necessary to obtain and maintain an enforceable security interest, whether by registration or otherwise, or to exercise a right to set-off in relation to the title transfer of the collateral;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.leadIn: if the collateral is provided under a margin agreement for derivative contracts or SFTs, the authorized institution—

subparagraph.content: has devoted sufficient resources to enable the orderly operation of the agreement; and

subparagraph.leadIn: has collateral management policies in place to control, monitor and report—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: risks (including liquidity risk and concentration risk) associated with the agreement;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: reuse of collateral; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the rights ceded by the institution in respect of collateral posted; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the credit quality of the obligor in respect of the collateralized exposure does not have material positive correlation with—

subparagraph.content: the current market value of the collateral; and
the residual risks (including legal, operational, liquidity and market risks) arising from the use of the collateral for the purpose of mitigating the credit risk of the collateralized exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The criteria specified in this subsection are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collateral falls within any one of the items listed in section 79(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the collateral is pledged (or otherwise provided as security) for not less than the life of the collateralized exposure; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the collateral—

subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), is revalued not less than every 6 months from the date on which the collateral is taken in respect of the collateralized exposure; and
if the collateralized exposure is a defaulted exposure, is revalued not less than every 3 months from the date on which the collateralized exposure is classified as a defaulted exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The criteria specified in this subsection are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collateral falls within any one of the items listed in section 80(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the authorized institution has in place a written internal policy and systems and procedures—

subparagraph.content: adequate to enable the institution to manage collateral provided to it in respect of any exposure; and
to revalue collateral as necessary and take account of the minimum holding periods for collateral in the calculation of the risk-weighted amounts of its collateralized exposures.”.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Approaches to use of recognized collateral

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution may use the simple approach or the comprehensive approach in its treatment of recognized collateral for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amounts of its exposures that are not default risk exposures (non-default risk exposures). (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution may use the simple approach or the comprehensive approach to take into account the credit risk mitigation effect of recognized collateral for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of a default risk exposure only if either of the following is complied with in respect of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exposure is in respect of an SFT calculated in accordance with section 226MJ;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exposure is in respect of one or more than one derivative contract entered into by the institution with a counterparty and the conditions specified in subsection (1B) are met. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution entered into the contract or contracts with the counterparty under a general banking facility consisting of 2 or more credit lines, and, for at least one of those credit lines, if drawn (whether in full or not), the drawn portion that will result from such drawdown is, at the time of the drawdown, a non-default risk exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the credit lines are secured by the same recognized collateral;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no amount of the recognized collateral is designated solely for offsetting losses on default risk exposures incurred by the institution under the general banking facility; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the recognized collateral is not included in the calculation of the default risk exposure under Division 1A or 2 of Part 6A. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If the same recognized collateral is available to cover both default risk exposures and non-default risk exposures, an authorized institution may, under the simple approach or comprehensive approach, take into account the credit risk mitigation effect of the recognized collateral for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the non-default risk exposures only to the extent of the current market value, or the part of such value, of the collateral that is not included in the calculation of the default risk exposures under Division 1A or 2 of Part 6A. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for exposures that are not defaulted exposures, use only the simple approach or only the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for defaulted exposures, use only the simple approach to the treatment of recognized collateral. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s79
section.heading: Collateral which may be recognized under simple approach

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), only collateral of the following description may be recognized in relation to an authorized institution that uses the simple approach in its treatment of recognized collateral—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cash on deposit with the institution or held at a third-party bank;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certificates of deposit issued by the institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: instruments issued by the institution that are comparable to instruments referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: gold bullion;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: debt securities issued by a sovereign that have a long-term ECAI issue specific rating that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the debt securities being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: debt securities (other than restricted debt securities) issued by a sovereign foreign public sector entity that have a long-term ECAI issue specific rating that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the debt securities being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: debt securities issued by a multilateral development bank that would be allocated a risk-weight of 0% under section 58;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: debt securities issued by an entity (other than an entity falling within paragraph (e), (f) or (g)) that have a long-term ECAI issue specific rating where that rating—

subparagraph.content: is issued by a Type A ECAI; and

paragraph.leadIn: debt securities issued by a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI that have a long-term ECAI issue specific rating where that rating—

subparagraph.content: is issued by that Type B ECAI; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: debt securities issued by an entity (other than an entity falling within paragraph (g)) that have a short-term ECAI issue specific rating where that rating—

subparagraph.content: is issued by a Type A ECAI; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: debt securities issued by a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI that have a short-term ECAI issue specific rating where that rating—

subparagraph.content: is issued by that Type B ECAI; and

paragraph.leadIn: debt securities issued by a bank that do not have an ECAI issue specific rating where—

subparagraph.content: the debt securities are not subordinated to any other debt obligations of the bank;

the debt securities are listed on a recognized exchange and the institution is of the reasonable opinion that, having regard to current market conditions, there is sufficient liquidity in the market for the debt securities to enable the institution to dispose of the debt securities at an open market price;

subparagraph.leadIn: other debt securities issued by the bank that rank equally with the first-mentioned debt securities—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: have a long-term ECAI issue specific rating that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in those other debt securities being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: have a short-term ECAI issue specific rating that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in those other debt securities being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; and

the institution is not aware, and has no reason to be aware, of information suggesting that it is justifiable for the debt securities to have an ECAI issue specific rating that would be mapped to a credit quality grade of 5, 6 or 7 in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs or a credit quality grade of 4 in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: equities (including convertible bonds) that are included in any main indices;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: units or shares in a collective investment scheme where—

subparagraph.content: the price of the units or shares in that scheme is quoted publicly on a daily basis; and

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.leadIn: securities that are—

subparagraph.content: eligible for inclusion in the trading book; and
received by the institution under a repo-style transaction booked in the institution’s trading book. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: A reference to debt securities in subsection (1) does not include debt securities that are re-securitization exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

If a debt security issued by a sovereign has neither a long-term ECAI issue specific rating nor short-term ECAI issue specific rating, an authorized institution may, for the purposes of this section, regard the ECAI issuer rating of the sovereign, if any, as the long-term ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

section.name: s80
section.heading: Collateral that may be recognized under comprehensive approach

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), only collateral of the following description may be recognized in relation to an authorized institution that uses the comprehensive approach in its treatment of recognized collateral—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: collateral falling within any paragraph of section 79(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: equities (including convertible bonds) that are not included in a main index but are listed on a recognized exchange; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: units or shares in a collective investment scheme where—

subparagraph.content: the price of the units or shares in that scheme is quoted publicly on a daily basis; and
that scheme is restricted by its investment guidelines or objects to investing in the equities referred to in paragraph (b) and those items listed in section 79(1) (except in section 79(1)(o)).

subsection.content: Collateral referred to in subsection (1) does not include debt securities that are re-securitization exposures.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Use of Recognized Collateral in Credit Risk Mitigation: Simple Approach

section.name: s81
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of exposures taking into account credit risk mitigating effect of recognized collateral under simple approach
section.content: If an authorized institution uses the simple approach in its treatment of recognized collateral, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amounts of its on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures to which the collateral relates in accordance with this Division.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Determination of risk-weight to be allocated to recognized collateral under simple approach

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5), if an authorized institution uses the simple approach in its treatment of recognized collateral, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), must determine the risk-weight to be allocated to the collateral in accordance with Division 3, section 226ZJ or Part 7, as the case requires, as if the collateral were an on-balance sheet exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not allocate a risk-weight of less than 20% to the collateral.

subsection.leadIn: For recognized collateral—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that falls within section 79(1)(a), (b) or (c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is held at a third-party bank in a non-custodial arrangement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that is unconditionally and irrevocably pledged (or otherwise provided as security) or assigned to an authorized institution,

subsection.continued: the institution must treat the credit protection covered portion of the exposure to which the collateral relates as an exposure to the third-party bank and allocate a risk-weight to the credit protection covered portion in accordance with sections 59 and 59A, or sections 59B and 59C, as the case requires.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may allocate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a risk-weight of 0% to recognized collateral provided under a repo-style transaction entered into with a counterparty if all the criteria specified in subsection (4) are met; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a risk-weight of 10% to recognized collateral provided under a repo-style transaction entered into with a counterparty if all the criteria specified in subsection (4) (other than subsection (4)(a)) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The criteria specified in this subsection are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the counterparty is—

subparagraph.content: a sovereign;
a public sector entity;
a multilateral development bank, where exposures to which would be allocated a risk-weight of 0% under section 58;
a bank or securities firm;
a qualifying non-bank financial institution (other than a securities firm) that has an attributed risk-weight of not more than 20%;

subparagraph.leadIn: a corporate (other than a securities firm)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that is an investment company, insurance firm, finance company or other similar financial institution; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that has an attributed risk-weight of not more than 20%; or
a qualifying CCP;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the exposure to which the collateral relates and the collateral are—

subparagraph.content: cash; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the exposure and the collateral have no currency mismatch;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the exposure is only an overnight exposure; or

the exposure and the collateral are subject to daily mark-to-market, and, if the mark-to-market value of any excess collateral (margin) is below the value required under the terms of the transaction, the counterparty is required to bring the margin up to the required value on the same day (remargin);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the authorized institution reasonably expects, if the counterparty fails to remargin, the time between the day on which the exposure is marked-to-market for the last time before the counterparty’s failure to remargin and the day on which the institution realizes the collateral for its benefit to be no more than 4 business days;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the transaction is settled by means of a settlement system customarily used for repo-style transactions;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the transaction is documented using standard market documentation for repo-style transactions involving securities of the same type as those that are the subject matter of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the documentation setting out the transaction provides that—

subparagraph.leadIn: the authorized institution may terminate the transaction immediately if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the counterparty commits an event of default under the transaction; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an event of default occurs in respect of the counterparty; and

the authorized institution has, immediately on any such default, an unfettered and legally enforceable right to seize and realize the collateral for its benefit, whether or not the counterparty is insolvent or bankrupt.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may allocate a risk-weight of 0% to recognized collateral provided in respect of an exposure other than a default risk exposure where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collateral and the exposure have no currency mismatch; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the collateral is either—

subparagraph.content: cash; or

subparagraph.leadIn: debt securities—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that are issued by a sovereign, or a sovereign foreign public sector entity, and would be allocated a risk-weight of 0% under this Part; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the current market value of which has been discounted by 20%.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: cash (現金)—(a)in relation to an exposure, means money paid by an authorized institution to a counterparty under a repo-style transaction; or(b)in relation to collateral, means recognized collateral that falls within section 79(1)(a), (b) or (c), other than collateral held at a third-party bank in a non-custodial arrangement.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of on-balance sheet exposures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall calculate the risk-weighted amount of each of its on-balance sheet exposures by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: dividing the exposure amount of the exposure into— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the credit protection covered portion; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the credit protection uncovered portion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiplying the credit protection covered portion by the risk-weight attributable to the recognized collateral and multiplying the credit protection uncovered portion by the risk-weight attributable to the exposure; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: adding together the 2 products derived from the application of paragraph (b).

section.name: s84
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of off-balance sheet exposures other than default risk exposures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall calculate the risk-weighted amount of each of its off-balance sheet exposures which is not a default risk exposure by— (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: dividing the principal amount of the exposure, net of specific provisions, into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the credit protection covered portion; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the credit protection uncovered portion;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: multiplying the credit equivalent amount of the credit protection covered portion by the risk-weight attributable to the recognized collateral and multiplying the credit equivalent amount of the credit protection uncovered portion by the risk-weight attributable to the exposure; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: adding together the 2 products derived from the application of paragraph (c).

section.name: s85
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of default risk exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of its default risk exposure that is an exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(a) or (b) by— (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: dividing the exposure amount of the exposure into—

subparagraph.content: the credit protection covered portion; and
the credit protection uncovered portion; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiplying the credit protection covered portion by the risk-weight attributable to the recognized collateral and multiplying the credit protection uncovered portion by the risk-weight attributable to the exposure; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: adding together the 2 products derived from the application of paragraph (b). (L.N. 156 of 2012)

division.name: D7
division.heading: Use of Recognized Collateral in Credit Risk Mitigation: Comprehensive Approach

section.name: s86
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of exposures taking into account credit risk mitigating effect of recognized collateral under comprehensive approach
section.leadIn: If an authorized institution uses the comprehensive approach in its treatment of recognized collateral, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amounts of its on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures to which the collateral relates by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculating the net credit exposure to the obligor of each of the exposures in accordance with section 87, 88 or 89, with the applicable haircuts determined in accordance with sections 90, 91 and 92; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiplying the net credit exposure so obtained by the risk-weight attributable to the exposure.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Calculation of net credit exposure of on-balance sheet exposures
section.content: An authorized institution shall calculate its net credit exposure to an obligor in respect of an on-balance sheet exposure by the use of Formula 2.

content.b: Calculation of Net Credit Exposure to Obligor under On-balance Sheet Exposure

tr.td: haircut applicable to the authorized institution’s exposure to the obligor pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92;
current market value of the recognized collateral before adjustment required by the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral;
haircut applicable to the recognized collateral pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92; and
haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Calculation of net credit exposure of off-balance sheet exposures other than default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall calculate its net credit exposure to an obligor in respect of an off-balance sheet exposure (other than a default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts) by the use of Formula 3. (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

leadIn.b: Calculation of Net Credit Exposure to Obligor under Off-balance Sheet Exposure other than Default Risk Exposure in Respect of Derivative Contracts

subsection.leadIn: E* = max {0, [E × (1 + He) – C × (1 – Hc – Hfx)]} × CCF

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the off-balance sheet exposure is a default risk exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(a)—the amount of the default risk exposure calculated in accordance with section 226MJ;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—principal amount of the off-balance sheet exposure, net of specific provisions (if any);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless paragraph (b) applies—haircut applicable to the authorized institution’s exposure to the obligor pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the off-balance sheet exposure is a default risk exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(a)—haircut applicable to the securities provided by the institution to the obligor under the SFT concerned pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92;

tr.td: haircut applicable to the recognized collateral pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92;
haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92; and

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in any other case—CCF applicable to the off-balance sheet exposure.

subsection.content: If an off-balance sheet exposure is a default risk exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(a), the net credit exposure in respect of the exposure calculated by using Formula 3 may be further reduced by the amount of any specific provisions made by the authorized institution. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s89
section.heading: Calculation of net credit exposure of default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts
section.content: An authorized institution must calculate the net credit exposure of its default risk exposure that is an exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(b) by the use of Formula 4. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

content.b: Calculation of Net Credit Exposure to Counterparty under

section.content: E* = max {0, [E – C × (1 – Hc – Hfx)]}

tr.td: exposure amount of the default risk exposure in respect of the derivative contracts concerned;
current market value of the recognized collateral before adjustment required by the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral;
haircut applicable to the recognized collateral pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92; and
haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Haircut applicable to a basket of recognized collateral
section.leadIn: If a basket of recognized collateral is provided to an authorized institution in respect of an exposure of the institution and the recognized collateral is made up of assets that are subject to haircuts of different values, the institution must calculate the haircut applicable to the basket of recognized collateral by the use of Formula 5.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Haircut where Recognized Collateral is made up of Assets with Different Haircuts

section.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Ha is the haircut applicable to the basket of recognized collateral;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: Hi is the haircut applicable to asset i under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Minimum holding periods

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 87, 88, 89, 90, 94, 100 or 103 and subject to subsection (4), an authorized institution must, in order to determine the haircuts applicable to an exposure and the recognized collateral provided in respect of the exposure, set the minimum holding period of the transaction giving rise to the exposure as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the exposure is not a default risk exposure or is a default risk exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(a)—the minimum holding period determined in accordance with subsections (1), (2) and (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the exposure is a default risk exposure mentioned in section 78(1A)(b)—the minimum holding period or the margin period of risk of the transaction determined in accordance with Part 6A. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: Where in respect of an exposure of an authorized institution, there is— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a daily revaluation of the exposure and the recognized collateral provided in respect of the exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a requirement that the obligor in respect of the exposure has to bring the value of the recognized collateral provided in respect of the exposure up to a value required under the terms of the transaction giving rise to the exposure based on the daily mark-to-market value of the exposure and the collateral (referred to in this Division as daily remargining),

subsection.continued: the institution must determine the minimum holding period of the transaction giving rise to the exposure in accordance with Table 12 based on the type of transaction to which the transaction belongs.

subsection.content: Where the exposure referred to in subsection (1) arises from a netting set that falls within any of the descriptions in section 226M(2), (3) or (7), the minimum holding period of the netting set must be equal to the longer margin period of risk that would apply to the netting set under section 226M(2), (3) or (7), as the case requires. (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 175 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exposure is not subject to daily remargining; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exposure and the recognized collateral provided in respect of the exposure are not subject to daily revaluation,

subsection.continued: the minimum holding period of the transaction giving rise to the exposure must be calculated by using Formula 5A.

content.b: Calculation of Minimum Holding Period for Circumstances Set Out in Paragraphs (a) and (b)

td.p: actual number of days between each remargining or each revaluation; and
minimum holding period determined in accordance with subsections (1) and (2) for the transaction as if there were daily remargining or daily revaluation.

subsection.leadIn: When calculating the credit equivalent amount of an off-balance sheet exposure to a counterparty arising from unsegregated collateral posted to the counterparty for mitigating the credit risk of a contract or transaction in accordance with section 71(2), an authorized institution must, for the purpose of determining the haircut applicable to the collateral—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the minimum holding period or the margin period of risk of the contract or transaction in accordance with subsections (1), (2) and (3) or Part 6A, as the case requires; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take the minimum holding period or the margin period of risk determined under paragraph (a) to be the minimum holding period of the collateral. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

section.name: s92
section.heading: Adjustment of standard supervisory haircuts in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution is required under these Rules to use a haircut to take into account the volatility of the value of an exposure, collateral or exchange rate, if— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the minimum holding period or the margin period of risk of the transaction giving rise to the exposure determined in accordance with section 91(1), (2) and (3) or Part 6A is not 10 business days; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the minimum holding period of the collateral determined in accordance with section 91(4) is not 10 business days,

subsection.continued: the institution must determine the value of the haircut by adjusting the standard supervisory haircut concerned in accordance with section 3 of Schedule 7.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1) and the standard supervisory haircuts specified in Schedule 7, an authorized institution may, in calculating the risk-weighted amount of a default risk exposure in respect of a repo-style transaction under section 88, apply a haircut of 0% to both the exposure and the recognized collateral received under the repo-style transaction if the repo-style transaction satisfies all the criteria set out in section 82(4). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D8
division.heading: Use of Recognized Netting in Credit Risk Mitigation

section.name: s94
section.heading: On-balance sheet netting

subsection.leadIn: Where amounts owed by an obligor to an authorized institution in respect of on-balance sheet exposures (other than CIS exposures) of the institution are subject to recognized netting, the institution— (L.N. 54 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may take into account the effect of the recognized netting in calculating its exposure to the obligor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a net credit exposure for the institution is the result of so taking into account the effect of the recognized netting, shall use the net credit exposure in calculating the risk-weighted amount of the exposure.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall calculate its net credit exposure, if any, referred to in subsection (1)(b) by the use of Formula 7.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Net Credit Exposure under Recognized

subsection.leadIn: Net credit exposure = max [0, exposures – liabilities × (1 – Hfx)]

tr.td: the amounts subject to recognized netting owed by the authorized institution to the obligor; and

haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, between the currencies in which the exposures and liabilities are denominated pursuant to the standard supervisory haircuts applicable to currency mismatch set out in Schedule 7 subject to adjustment as set out in section 92.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of its net credit exposure to an obligor as the product of the net credit exposure and the risk-weight attributable, in accordance with Division 3, to the exposure. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D9
division.heading: Use of Recognized Guarantees and Recognized Credit Derivative Contracts in Credit Risk Mitigation

section.name: s98
section.heading: Recognized guarantees
section.leadIn: A guarantee given to an authorized institution is recognized for the purposes of calculating the risk-weighted amount of a specific exposure or a specific pool of exposures of the institution (guaranteed exposure) if— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guarantee is given by an eligible credit protection provider described in section 99A (guarantor); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the guarantee gives the institution a direct claim against the guarantor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the credit protection provided by the guarantee relates specifically to the guaranteed exposure; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.leadIn: the credit quality of the obligor in respect of the guaranteed exposure does not have material positive correlation with—

subparagraph.content: the credit quality of the guarantor; and

the residual risks (including legal, operational, liquidity and market risks) arising from the use of the guarantee for the purpose of mitigating the credit risk of the guaranteed exposure; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: there is no clause in the guarantee, the satisfaction of which is outside the direct control of the institution, which would allow the guarantor to cancel the guarantee unilaterally or which would increase the effective cost of the credit protection provided by the guarantee as a result of the deteriorating credit quality of the guaranteed exposure except for a clause permitting termination in the event of a failure by the institution to pay sums due from it under the terms of the guarantee;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: there is no clause in the guarantee, the satisfaction of which is outside the direct control of the institution, which could operate to prevent the guarantor from being obliged to pay out promptly in the event that the obligor in respect of the guaranteed exposure defaults in making any payments due to the institution in respect of the guaranteed exposure;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the jurisdiction in which the guarantor is located and from which the guarantor may be obliged to make payment has no existing exchange controls in place or, if there are existing exchange controls in place, approval has been obtained for the funds to be remitted freely in the event that the guarantor is called on under the terms of the guarantee to make payment to the institution; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.content: the institution has the right to receive payment from the guarantor without having to take legal action in order to pursue the obligor in respect of the guaranteed exposure for payment; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the guarantee is binding on all parties and legally enforceable in all relevant jurisdictions.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Recognized credit derivative contracts

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5), a credit derivative contract (subject contract) entered into by an authorized institution as a protection buyer may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of an exposure of the institution (protected exposure) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the subject contract is a credit default swap or total return swap (other than a restricted credit derivative contract);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the protection seller of the subject contract is an eligible credit protection provider described in section 99A;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the economic benefit derived by the institution would make good the economic loss suffered by the institution in consequence of the default of the obligor in respect of the protected exposure in a manner substantially similar to that of a recognized guarantee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the subject contract gives the institution a direct claim against the protection seller;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the credit protection provided by the subject contract relates to a specific exposure or a specific pool of exposures;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the credit quality of the reference entity of the subject contract does not have material positive correlation with—

subparagraph.content: the credit quality of the protection seller; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the undertaking of the protection seller under the subject contract to make payment in specified circumstances is clearly documented so that the extent of the credit protection provided by the subject contract is clearly defined;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: there is no clause in the subject contract, the satisfaction of which is outside the direct control of the institution, that would—

subparagraph.content: allow the protection seller to cancel the subject contract unilaterally; or

increase the effective cost of the credit protection offered by the subject contract as a result of the deteriorating credit quality of the reference entity or any of the specified obligations of the subject contract,

paragraph.content: there is no clause in the subject contract, the satisfaction of which is outside the direct control of the institution, that could operate to prevent the protection seller from being obliged to pay out promptly in the event that the reference entity defaults in making any payments due;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the jurisdiction in which the protection seller is located and from which the protection seller may be obliged to make payment has no existing exchange controls in place or, if there are existing exchange controls in place, approval has been obtained for the funds to be remitted freely in the event that the protection seller is called on under the terms of the subject contract to make payment to the institution;

paragraph.name: k

paragraph.leadIn: the subject contract obliges the protection seller to make payment to the institution in the following credit events—

subparagraph.content: any failure by the reference entity to pay amounts due under the terms of any of the specified obligations (subject to any grace period in the subject contract that is of substantially similar duration to any grace period provided for in the terms of the specified obligations);

the bankruptcy or insolvency of the reference entity, or the reference entity’s failure or inability to pay its debts as they fall due, or the reference entity’s written admission of the reference entity’s inability generally to pay its debts as they fall due, or any event with respect to the reference entity that has an analogous effect to any of the foregoing events; or

restructuring of any of the specified obligations, involving forgiveness or postponement of payment of any principal or interest or fees, that results in the holder of the specified obligation restructured making specific provision or other similar debit to its profit and loss account;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: in any case where any of the specified obligations provides a grace period within which the reference entity may make good a default in payment, the subject contract is not capable of terminating prior to the expiry of the grace period;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: in any case where the subject contract provides for settlement in cash, it provides an adequate mechanism for valuation of loss and specifies a reasonable period within which that valuation is to be arrived at following a credit event;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.leadIn: in any case where the specified obligations do not include or are different from the protected exposure—

subparagraph.content: each of the specified obligations ranks for payment or repayment equally with, or junior to, the protected exposure; and

the obligor in respect of the protected exposure is the same person as the reference entity of the subject contract and legally enforceable cross default or cross acceleration clauses are included in the terms of both the protected exposure and the specified obligations;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: in any case where, under the terms of the subject contract, it is a condition of settlement that the institution transfers the protected exposure to the protection seller, the terms of the protected exposure provide that any consent which may be required from the obligor in respect of the protected exposure must not be unreasonably withheld;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the subject contract specifies clearly the identity of the person who is empowered to determine whether a credit event has occurred, that person is not solely the protection seller and the institution is, under the terms of the subject contract, entitled to inform the protection seller of the occurrence of a credit event; and

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: the subject contract is binding on all parties and legally enforceable in all relevant jurisdictions.

subsection.leadIn: If all the criteria set out in subsection (1) are met in respect of the subject contract except that the credit events specified in the subject contract do not include the credit event described in subsection (1)(l)(iii), the subject contract may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected exposure if all of the following conditions are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the protected exposure is an exposure to a corporate;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: the legal domicile in which the protected exposure is governed has well-established legislation on insolvency, bankruptcy or liquidation that—

subparagraph.content: allows for a corporate to reorganize or restructure; and
provides for an orderly settlement of creditor claims.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the criteria set out in subsection (1) are met in respect of the subject contract except that the credit events specified in the subject contract do not include the credit event described in subsection (1)(l)(iii);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any one or more of the conditions set out in subsection (2) are not met in respect of the subject contract; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the maximum liability of the protection seller to the authorized institution under the subject contract is more than the amount of the protected exposure,

subsection.continued: the amount of the subject contract that may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected exposure must not be more than 60% of the amount of the protected exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the criteria set out in subsection (1) are met in respect of the subject contract except that the credit events specified in the subject contract do not include the credit event described in subsection (1)(l)(iii);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any one or more of the conditions set out in subsection (2) are not met in respect of the subject contract; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the maximum liability of the protection seller to the authorized institution under the subject contract is equal to or less than the amount of the protected exposure,

subsection.continued: the amount of the subject contract that may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected exposure must not be more than 60% of the maximum liability of the protection seller to the institution under the subject contract.

subsection.content: If the subject contract is a credit derivative contract embedded in a cash funded credit-linked note issued by the authorized institution, the subject contract is recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected exposure if all the criteria set out in subsection (1), excluding the criterion set out in subsection (1)(b), are met.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: restricted credit derivative contract (受限制信用衍生工具合約), in relation to an authorized institution, means—(a)a total return swap where—(i)the institution is the protection buyer under the swap; and(ii)the institution records the net payments received by it under the swap as net income but does not record, through deductions in fair value in the accounts of the institution or by an addition to reserves or provisions, the extent to which the value of the protected exposure has deteriorated; or(b)a first-to-default credit derivative contract, a second-to-default credit derivative contract or any other nth-to-default credit derivative contract;

specified obligation (指明義務), in relation to a credit derivative contract entered into by an authorized institution as a protection buyer in respect of an exposure of the institution—(a)means an obligation of a specified reference entity specified in the credit derivative contract that is—(i)a reference obligation; or(ii)an obligation used for the purpose of determining whether a credit event has occurred; and(b)may or may not include the exposure of the institution.

section.name: s99A
section.heading: Eligible credit protection providers

subsection.content: For the purposes of sections 98 and 99, an entity that provides credit protection is an eligible credit protection provider if the conditions set out in subsection (2)(a) and (b) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the entity is—

subparagraph.content: a sovereign;
a public sector entity;
a multilateral development bank;
an unspecified multilateral body;
a bank;
a qualifying CCP;
a prudentially regulated financial institution; or
an entity not listed in subparagraphs (i) to (vii) that has an ECAI issuer rating; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the attributed risk-weight of the entity is lower than the risk-weight that would be allocated to the exposure in respect of which the credit protection is provided.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prudentially regulated financial institution (受審慎監管的金融機構) means—(a)a qualifying non-bank financial institution other than a qualifying CCP;(b)an entity (other than a bank, qualifying non-bank financial institution or qualifying CCP) that is—(i)authorized by a regulator under the law of a jurisdiction to carry on financial activities in that jurisdiction; and(ii)subject to supervisory standards imposed by the regulator that are substantially consistent with international norms; or(c)an entity that is a member of a group of companies (comprised of the ultimate holding company and all of its subsidiaries) where any major entity in the group is a bank or falls within paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s99B
section.heading: Recognized internal risk transfer to trading book

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), an internal risk transfer used by an authorized institution to transfer the credit risk of one or more credit exposures (protected credit exposure) booked in the institution’s banking book to its trading book may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected credit exposure under this Part if there is an external hedge that meets all the conditions specified in subsection (2)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the external hedge in respect of the protected credit exposure—

subparagraph.content: exactly matches the internal risk transfer; and
meets the requirements set out in section 99(1)(a), (b), (c), (l), (m), (n), (o), (p), (q) and (r); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all of the following apply—

subparagraph.content: the external hedge in respect of the protected credit exposure is made up of multiple credit derivative contracts entered into by the institution with one or more third parties (aggregate external hedge) and booked in the institution’s trading book;
the aggregate external hedge exactly matches the internal risk transfer;
the internal risk transfer exactly matches the aggregate external hedge.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), if the external hedge meets the conditions specified in subsection (2)(a) or (b) except that the credit events specified in the external hedge do not include the credit event described in section 99(1)(l)(iii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in cases where the amount of the internal risk transfer is more than the amount of the protected credit exposure—the amount of the internal risk transfer that may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected credit exposure must not be more than 60% of the amount of the protected credit exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in cases where the amount of the internal risk transfer is equal to or less than the amount of the protected credit exposure—only up to 60% of the amount of the internal risk transfer may be recognized for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the protected credit exposure.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: internal risk transfer (內部風險轉移) means an internal written record of a transfer of credit risk from an authorized institution’s banking book to its trading book.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Capital treatment of recognized guarantees and recognized credit derivative contracts

subsection.leadIn: If an exposure is covered by a recognized guarantee or recognized credit derivative contract (protected exposure)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized guarantee or a recognized credit derivative contract recognized under section 99—an authorized institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the protected exposure in accordance with subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a recognized credit derivative contract in the form of an internal risk transfer recognized under section 99B—

subparagraph.content: an authorized institution is not required to calculate a risk-weighted amount under this Part for the credit protection covered portion of the protected exposure if capital charges are held by the institution for the trading book leg of the internal risk transfer and the corresponding external hedge in accordance with the requirements of Part 8; and
if there is any credit protection uncovered portion, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the unprotected amount of the protected exposure in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: If the credit protection covered portion and the credit protection uncovered portion of a protected exposure rank equally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 83, 84 and 85, with all necessary modifications, apply to the authorized institution in relation to the calculation of the risk-weighted amount of the protected exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the authorized institution must—

subparagraph.content: subject to subsections (5), (6) and (7), allocate to the protected amount of the protected exposure the risk-weight determined in accordance with Division 3 by regarding the protected amount as an exposure of the institution to the credit protection provider; and
allocate to the unprotected amount of the protected exposure the risk-weight attributable to the protected exposure under that Division.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if section 83 or 85 applies to the authorized institution—

subparagraph.content: the unprotected amount of the protected exposure is the credit protection uncovered portion of the protected exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if section 84 applies to the authorized institution—

subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (4), the protected amount of the protected exposure is the product of the credit protection covered portion of the protected exposure and the CCF applicable to the protected exposure; and
the unprotected amount of the protected exposure is the product of the credit protection uncovered portion of the protected exposure and the CCF applicable to the protected exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If, in respect of a protected exposure, there is a currency mismatch, an authorized institution, in determining the credit protection covered portion for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) or the protected amount for the purposes of subsection (2), must adjust the amount of the credit protection covered portion of the protected exposure by the use of Formula 11.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Amount of Credit Protection Covered Portion if there is a Currency Mismatch

subsection.leadIn: Ga = G × (1 – Hfx)
where—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: Hfx is the haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch in accordance with the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 56(1) or (2) applies to domestic currency exposures to a sovereign; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a protected exposure—

subparagraph.content: is funded in the local currency of that sovereign; and
is the subject of a recognized guarantee by that sovereign denominated in the local currency,

subsection.continued: an authorized institution may allocate the lower risk-weight provided for by section 56(1) or (2), as the case requires, to the protected amount of the protected exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If the credit protection covered portion of a protected exposure is such a credit protection covered portion because of a recognized guarantee (original guarantee) and is the subject of a counter-guarantee given by a sovereign, an authorized institution may, in respect of the credit protection covered portion, treat the counter-guarantee as if it were the original guarantee if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the counter-guarantee is given in such terms that it can be called if—

subparagraph.content: for any reason the obligor in respect of the protected exposure fails to make payments due in respect of the protected exposure; and
the original guarantee could be called;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the counter-guarantee meets all of the requirements for guarantees set out in section 98 (except that the counter-guarantee need not meet the requirements set out in section 98(b) and (c)); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the institution reasonably considers, and demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority, that—

subparagraph.content: the cover of the counter-guarantee is adequate and effective; and
there is no evidence to suggest that the coverage of the counter-guarantee is less effective than that of a direct and explicit guarantee by the sovereign that gives the counter-guarantee.

subsection.leadIn: If a recognized credit derivative contract is cleared by a qualifying CCP, an authorized institution may allocate to the protected amount of the protected exposure to which the contract relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a risk-weight of 2% if—

subparagraph.content: the institution is a clearing member of the qualifying CCP;
the institution is a direct client of a clearing member of the qualifying CCP and all of the conditions set out in section 226ZA(6) are met; or

the institution is an indirect client within a multi-level client structure associated with the qualifying CCP and all of the conditions set out in section 226ZA(6), with all necessary modifications, are met for arrangements among the CCP, clearing member, all clients at levels higher than the institution within the multi-level client structure, and the institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a risk-weight of 4% if—

subparagraph.content: the institution is a direct client of a clearing member of the qualifying CCP and all of the conditions set out in section 226ZA(6) (excluding the condition set out in section 226ZA(6)(a)(iii)) are met; or

the institution is an indirect client within a multi-level client structure associated with the qualifying CCP and all of the conditions set out in section 226ZA(6) (excluding the condition set out in section 226ZA(6)(a)(iii)), with all necessary modifications, are met for arrangements among the CCP, clearing member, all clients at levels higher than the institution within the multi-level client structure, and the institution.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 100

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (9) and section 99(2), (3) and (4), if the credit protection in respect of an authorized institution’s exposure consists of a recognized credit derivative contract which is a credit default swap or total return swap— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
