paragraph.content: if upon the happening of a credit event the protection seller is obliged to pay the amount specified in the contract to the institution in exchange for delivery by the institution of the deliverable obligation specified in the contract, the institution may treat the exposure as being fully covered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if upon the happening of a credit event the protection seller is obliged to pay the amount specified in the contract to the institution less the market value of the reference obligation specified in the contract, calculated by specified calculation agents at some specified point in time after the credit event has occurred, the institution may treat the exposure as being fully covered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if upon the happening of a credit event the protection seller is obliged to pay a fixed amount to the institution, the institution may only treat that amount of the exposure which is equivalent to the fixed amount as being fully covered.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution has obtained tranched credit protection for its exposure, it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decompose the exposure into a protected sub-tranche and an unprotected sub-tranche; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the risk-weighted amount of the exposure in accordance with Part 7. (L.N. 175 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (9), if the credit protection in respect of an authorized institution’s exposure takes the form of an issue of credit-linked notes by the institution, the institution— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may only treat that amount of the exposure which is equivalent to the cash funding received from the notes as being fully covered; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must treat the credit protection covered portion of the exposure as an exposure collateralized by cash deposit. (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: If the credit protection in respect of an authorized institution’s exposure consists of a recognized credit derivative contract (including such a contract embedded in credit-linked notes issued by the institution) that provides that, on the happening of a credit event, the protection seller is not obliged to make a payment in respect of any loss or to absorb any loss if the loss is below a specified amount (materiality threshold), the institution must, in calculating its capital adequacy ratio, allocate a risk-weight of 1 250% to the portion of the exposure that is below the materiality threshold. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D10
division.heading: Multiple Recognized Credit Risk Mitigation and Maturity Mismatches

section.name: s102
section.heading: Multiple recognized credit risk mitigation

subsection.content: Where in respect of a single exposure of an authorized institution to an obligor, 2 or more forms of recognized credit risk mitigation have been used by the institution, the institution shall calculate the risk-weighted amount of the exposure in accordance with this Part by dividing the exposure into the portions which respectively represent the proportions of the exposure covered by each of the forms of recognized credit risk mitigation so used. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

Where in respect of a single exposure of an authorized institution to an obligor, there is an overlap of coverage between 2 or more forms of recognized credit risk mitigation used by the institution, the institution may select, in respect of the portion of the exposure covered by the overlap, the recognized credit risk mitigation which result in the lowest risk-weighted amount of that portion of the exposure covered by the overlap.

Where an authorized institution has an exposure to an obligor in respect of which credit protection has been provided by a single credit protection provider in circumstances where the relevant credit protection has different maturities, the institution shall calculate the risk-weighted amount of the exposure in accordance with this Part by dividing the exposure into different portions reflecting the maturity of the credit protection respectively attributable to the different portions. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution has an exposure to an obligor in the form of a general banking facility consisting of 2 or more credit lines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution may, in calculating its risk-weighted amount in respect of the credit lines, allocate any credit protection taken in respect of the exposure amongst the individual exposures under each of the credit lines; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution exercises its discretion under paragraph (a), the institution shall aggregate the risk-weighted amounts of the individual exposures under each of the credit lines to determine the total risk-weighted amount of the exposure in respect of the general banking facility.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Maturity mismatches

subsection.content: Where the credit protection provided in respect of an exposure of an authorized institution (other than the netting of SFTs and derivative contracts) has a residual maturity which is shorter than the residual maturity of the exposure (referred to in this section as maturity mismatch), the institution shall adjust the value of the credit protection by the use of Formula 12. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

Formula 12Adjustment of Calculation of Value of Credit Protection
where there is Maturity MismatchPa = P × (t – 0.25) / (T – 0.25)

tr.td: value of credit protection adjusted for maturity mismatch;

value of credit protection adjusted by standard supervisory haircuts (subject to adjustment as set out in section 92) for volatility of value of collateral and currency mismatch (if applicable); (L.N. 44 of 2020)
Min (5, residual maturity of the exposure) expressed in years.

subsection.leadIn: Where there is a maturity mismatch, the institution, in calculating its risk-weighted amount of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall take into account the credit protection only if the credit protection has an original maturity of not less than one year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not take into account the credit protection once it has a residual maturity of not more than 3 months; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not take into account the credit protection if the credit protection is in the form of recognized collateral and the risk-weighted amount of the exposure is calculated by using the simple approach to the treatment of recognized collateral.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of calculating the respective maturities of an exposure of an authorized institution and any credit protection covering the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution shall, at any time before the obligor in respect of the exposure to which the credit protection relates performs the obligor’s obligations, take the effective maturity of the exposure to be the longest possible remaining time after taking into account any applicable grace period provided for in the terms of the exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the terms of the credit protection provide for an option which may reduce the term of that credit protection, the institution shall take into account the option and the earliest possible date upon which it may be exercised;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the terms of the credit protection provide that the credit protection provider may terminate the credit protection before its maturity, the institution shall take the maturity of the credit protection to be the first date upon which the credit protection provider may so terminate the credit protection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the terms of the credit protection permit the institution to terminate the credit protection before its maturity and there is a positive incentive for the institution to exercise its discretion so to do, the institution shall take the maturity of the credit protection to be the time left to run before the earliest date upon which the institution may exercise the discretion.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the original maturity and residual maturity of credit protection which is recognized collateral falling within section 79(1)(a), (d), (m) or (n) or 80(1)(b) or (c) shall be taken to be the period for which it will continue to fulfil the requirements of section 77 applicable to the credit protection. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

part.name: P5
part.heading: Calculation of Credit Risk for Non-securitization Exposures: BSC Approach

division.name: D1
division.heading: General

section.name: s104
section.heading: Application of Part 5

subsection.content: This Part applies to an authorized institution which uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures.

A reference to an authorized institution in this Part is a reference to an authorized institution which uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s105
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.leadIn: In this Part— (L.N. 167 of 2023)
section.def: attributed risk-weight (歸屬風險權重)—(a)in relation to a person (however described), subject to paragraph (b), means the risk-weight that would be attributable, in accordance with Subdivision 2 or 5 of Division 3, to an unsecured exposure to the person as an obligor on the following assumptions—(i)that the unsecured exposure is a loan granted to the person;(ii)that the residual maturity of the loan is not less than one year;(iii)that the loan is not a domestic currency exposure;(b)in sections 132, 133 and 134—(i)in relation to the credit protection provider of a credit protection afforded to an exposure (other than a real estate exposure), means the risk-weight that would be attributable, in accordance with Division 3, to the exposure as if the credit protection provider were the obligor in respect of the exposure; and(ii)in relation to the credit protection provider of a credit protection afforded to a real estate exposure, means the risk-weight that would be attributable, in accordance with that Division, to a senior and unsecured exposure to the credit protection provider; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
commitment (承諾), in relation to the determination of a CCF applicable to an off-balance sheet exposure, has the meaning given by section 2 of Schedule 6; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

corporate (法團) means—(a)a company; or(b)a partnership or any other unincorporated body,that is not a multilateral development bank, unspecified multilateral body, public sector entity or bank; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

credit equivalent amount (信貸等值數額), in relation to an off-balance sheet exposure that is not a default risk exposure, means the credit equivalent amount of the exposure calculated in accordance with section 118(1) or (2), as the case requires; (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

credit protection covered portion (信用保障涵蓋部分), in relation to an exposure of an authorized institution that is covered by recognized collateral, a recognized guarantee or a recognized credit derivative contract, means the portion of the exposure (which may be all of the exposure) that is covered by—(a)in the case of recognized collateral—the current market value of the recognized collateral;(b)in the case of a recognized guarantee or a credit derivative contract recognized under section 133(1) or (2)—the maximum liability of the credit protection provider to the institution under the recognized guarantee or recognized credit derivative contract, as the case may be; or(c)in the case of a credit derivative contract recognized under section 133(3) or (4)—the maximum liability of the credit protection provider to the institution under the recognized credit derivative contract, up to the maximum amount of the contract that may be recognized under that section; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

credit protection uncovered portion (不受信用保障涵蓋部分), in relation to an exposure of an authorized institution that is covered by recognized collateral, a recognized guarantee or a recognized credit derivative contract, means the portion of the exposure that is not the credit protection covered portion; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
debt securities (債務證券) means any securities other than shares, stocks or import or export trade bills;

exposure amount (風險承擔數額)—(a)in relation to an on-balance sheet exposure—means the principal amount of the exposure (net of specific provisions, if any);(b)in relation to an off-balance sheet exposure to a counterparty that is a default risk exposure in respect of one or more derivative contracts or in respect of a netting set that contains both derivative contracts and SFTs—means the outstanding default risk exposure in respect of the counterparty (net of specific provisions, if any);(c)in relation to an off-balance sheet exposure to a counterparty that is a default risk exposure in respect of one or more SFTs—means the amount of the exposure calculated in accordance with Division 2B of Part 6A (net of specific provisions, if any); or(d)in relation to any other off-balance sheet exposure, means—(i)the credit equivalent amount of the exposure calculated in accordance with section 118(1); or(ii)the credit equivalent amount of the exposure calculated in accordance with section 118(2); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

def.name: PrincipalAmount
def.leadIn: principal amount (本金額)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an on-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the exposure is measured at fair value, means the value of the exposure determined in accordance with section 4A; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the exposure is not measured at fair value, means the book value (including accrued interest) of the exposure; or (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an off-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), in the case of an exposure listed in Schedule 6, the contracted amount of the exposure; (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an exposure listed in Schedule 6 that arises from an undrawn facility or the undrawn portion of a partially drawn facility, the amount of the undrawn commitment; (L.N. 175 of 2017; L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (iv), in the case of an exposure in respect of a derivative contract, the notional amount of the contract; (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in the case of an exposure in respect of a derivative contract where the stated notional amount of the contract is leveraged or enhanced by the structure of the contract, the effective notional amount of the contract calculated by taking into account the effect of the leverage or enhancement, as the case requires; (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: in the case of an exposure to a person arising from the person holding collateral posted by the institution in a manner that is not bankruptcy remote from the person, the fair value of the collateral; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.def: real estate exposure (地產風險承擔) has the meaning given by section 51(1); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
recognized collateral (認可抵押品) means collateral recognized under section 124;

recognized credit derivative contract (認可信用衍生工具合約) means—(a)a credit derivative contract recognized under section 133(1), (2) or (5); or(b)a credit derivative contract to the extent that it is recognized under section 133(3) or (4); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
recognized guarantee (認可擔保) means a guarantee recognized under section 132;
regulatory residential real estate exposure (監管住宅地產風險承擔)—see section 115(1); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
specific provisions (特定準備金) has the meaning given by section 51(1); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subordinated debt (後償債項), in relation to an obligor that is a bank or corporate—(a)includes a subordinated debt or junior subordinated debt—(i)that is not an equity exposure to the obligor; and(ii)that is higher in ranking, or senior, to equity exposures to the obligor in terms of the priority of repayment; but(b)if the obligor is a financial sector entity, excludes—(i)a capital instrument issued by the obligor; and(ii)a non-capital LAC liability of the obligor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
Tier 2 country (第2級國家) means any country which is not a Tier 1 country.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Calculation of Credit Risk under BSC Approach, Exposures to be Covered in Calculation, and Classification of Exposures

section.name: s106
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of exposures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 107, an authorized institution must calculate an amount representing the degree of credit risk to which it is exposed by aggregating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risk-weighted amounts of the institution’s on-balance sheet exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weighted amounts of the institution’s off-balance sheet exposures.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risk-weighted amount of each exposure (except CIS exposure and default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs) must be calculated by multiplying the exposure amount of the exposure by the relevant risk-weight attributable to the exposure determined under Division 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weighted amount of each CIS exposure must be calculated in accordance with Division 3A; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the risk-weighted amount of each default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs is the amount specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has an IMM(CCR) approval—

subparagraph.content: the risk-weighted amount of the default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts that are not covered by the IMM(CCR) approval or that fall within section 10B(5) or (7) is the sum of the SA-CCR risk-weighted amounts calculated for the contracts; and

the risk-weighted amount of the default risk exposure in respect of SFTs that are not covered by the IMM(CCR) approval or that fall within that section is the sum of the SFT risk-weighted amounts calculated for the SFTs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not have an IMM(CCR) approval for any of its derivative contracts or SFTs—

subparagraph.leadIn: the risk-weighted amount of the default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the institution uses the current exposure method to calculate default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts—the sum of the CEM risk-weighted amounts calculated for the contracts; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the institution uses the SA-CCR approach to calculate default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts—the sum of the SA-CCR risk-weighted amounts calculated for the contracts; and
the risk-weighted amount of the default risk exposure in respect of SFTs is the sum of the SFT risk-weighted amounts calculated for the SFTs.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may reduce the risk-weighted amount of its exposure by taking into account the effect of any recognized credit risk mitigation in respect of the exposure in the manner set out in Divisions 5, 6, 7 and 8, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution has made disclosures in respect of credit risk for the immediately preceding applicable reporting periods that do not fully comply with the applicable provisions of the Disclosure Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (5) or (6) applies to the recognized credit risk mitigation concerned.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution has bought credit protection for an exposure and the credit protection is in the form of a single-name credit default swap that falls within section 226J(1), the institution must not take into account under subsection (4) the credit risk mitigating effect of the swap.

If an exposure of an authorized institution is a default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs, the institution must not take into account under subsection (4) the effect of any recognized credit risk mitigation applicable to the exposure that has already been taken into account in the calculation of the amount of the default risk exposure under Part 6A.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable provisions (適用條文), in relation to an authorized institution that uses the BSC approach to calculate the credit risk for all of its non-securitization exposures, means the provisions set out in Division 4 of Part 2A of the Disclosure Rules the application of which to the institution has not been exempted by the Monetary Authority under section 3 of those Rules;

CEM risk-weighted amount (CEM風險加權數額) means the risk-weighted amount of the default risk exposure in respect of a derivative contract calculated as the product of—(a)the exposure amount of the default risk exposure calculated by using the current exposure method; and(b)the risk-weight applicable to the default risk exposure determined under this Part;
Disclosure Rules (《披露規則》) means the Banking (Disclosure) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. M);
SFT risk-weighted amount (SFT風險加權數額) means the risk-weighted amount of the default risk exposure in respect of an SFT calculated in accordance with section 129.

section.name: s107
section.heading: On-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures to be covered

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), if an authorized institution is required under these Rules to use only the BSC approach to calculate the credit risk for all of its non-securitization exposures, the institution must, for the purpose of calculating under section 106 an amount representing the degree of credit risk to which it is exposed, take into account and risk-weight—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all of the institution’s on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures booked in its banking book;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all of the institution’s following exposures—

subparagraph.content: default risk exposures to counterparties in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs booked in its trading book;

credit exposures to counterparties in respect of transactions (other than repo-style transactions) in securities, foreign exchange or commodities booked in its trading book that remain outstanding after the settlement dates in respect of the transactions;
credit exposures to counterparties in respect of unsegregated collateral posted by it and held by the counterparties for transactions or contracts booked in its trading book; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if applicable, all of the institution’s market risk exposures that are exempted from section 17 under section 22, except for its total net open position in foreign exchange exposures as derived in accordance with section 296.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securitization exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the underlying exposures of eligible traditional securitization transactions (within the meaning of section 229) if the authorized institution opts to apply the treatment under section 230(1) to the underlying exposures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: default fund contributions made to qualifying CCPs and non-qualifying CCPs (within the meaning of section 226V(1));

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: default risk exposures to qualifying CCPs;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: exposures that are risk-weighted as if they were default risk exposures to qualifying CCPs under Division 4 of Part 6A; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any portion of an exposure (which may be all of the exposure) that is required to be deducted from any of the institution’s CET1 capital, Additional Tier 1 capital and Tier 2 capital under Division 4 of Part 3.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Classification of exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must classify its on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures into one only of the following categories—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exposures that are not CIS exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: CIS exposures.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: further classify each of the exposures falling within subsection (1)(a), according to the obligor or the nature of the exposure, into one only of the following subcategories—

subparagraph.leadIn: exposures that do not fall within subparagraph (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) or (vii)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: sovereign exposures;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: public sector entity exposures;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: multilateral development bank exposures;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: unspecified multilateral body exposures;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: bank exposures (other than eligible covered bond exposures);

subparagraph.name: F
subparagraph.content: eligible covered bond exposures;

subparagraph.name: G
subparagraph.content: exposures falling within section 113A;

subparagraph.name: H
subparagraph.content: real estate exposures;
equity exposures (other than those falling within subparagraph (iii) or (iv));
significant capital investments in commercial entities within the meaning of section 115F(2);
holdings of capital instruments issued by, and non-capital LAC liabilities of, financial sector entities;
subordinated debts issued by banks and corporates;
cash and gold;
items in the process of clearing or settlement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: classify each of the exposures falling within subsection (1)(a) that does not fall within paragraph (a) as other exposures.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: determine the risk-weight attributable to each of the exposures falling within subsection (1)(b) in accordance with Division 3A.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Determination of Risk-weights Applicable to Exposures other than CIS Exposures

section.name: s108A
section.heading: Application of Division 3
section.content: This Division applies to the determination of risk-weights applicable to on-balance sheet exposures, and off-balance sheet exposures, that are not CIS exposures.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Exposures not falling within Subdivision 3, 4 or 5

section.name: s109
section.heading: Sovereign exposures

subsection.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to a sovereign exposure in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 0% to the following exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exposure to a sovereign of a Tier 1 country that arises from a loan granted to the sovereign;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an exposure to a sovereign of a Tier 2 country that—

subparagraph.content: arises from a loan granted to the sovereign; and
is a domestic currency exposure;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an exposure to a sovereign that is a relevant international organization.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 10% to the following exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an exposure to a sovereign of a Tier 1 country that arises from—

subparagraph.content: fixed rate debt securities with a residual maturity of less than one year that are issued by the sovereign; or
floating rate debt securities of any maturity that are issued by the sovereign;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an exposure to a sovereign of a Tier 2 country that—

subparagraph.leadIn: arises from—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: fixed rate debt securities with a residual maturity of less than one year that are issued by the sovereign; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: floating rate debt securities of any maturity that are issued by the sovereign; and
is a domestic currency exposure.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 20% to the following exposures—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: an exposure to a sovereign of a Tier 2 country that—

subparagraph.content: arises from fixed rate debt securities with a residual maturity of not less than one year that are issued by the sovereign; and
is a domestic currency exposure.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 100% to an exposure to a sovereign of a Tier 2 country that does not fall within subsection (2)(b), (3)(b) or (4)(b).
To avoid doubt, for the purposes of this section, an exposure to the Government includes an exposure to the Exchange Fund.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Public sector entity exposures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 20% to an exposure to a public sector entity of a Tier 1 country; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 100% to an exposure to a public sector entity of a Tier 2 country.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Multilateral development bank exposures
section.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 0% to an exposure to a multilateral development bank.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Unspecified multilateral body exposures
section.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 50% to an exposure to an unspecified multilateral body.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Bank exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of—

subparagraph.content: an exposure to a bank that falls within paragraph (a) of the definition of bank in section 2(1);
an exposure to a bank that falls within paragraph (b) of that definition and that is incorporated in a Tier 1 country; and
an exposure, with a residual maturity of less than one year, to a bank that falls within paragraph (b) of that definition and that is incorporated in a Tier 2 country; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 100% to an exposure, with a residual maturity of not less than one year, to a bank that falls within paragraph (b) of that definition and that is incorporated in a Tier 2 country.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to an exposure to a bank that is an eligible covered bond exposure.

section.name: s113A
section.heading: Exposures arising from IPO financing

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a credit facility granted by an authorized institution to a corporate or an individual (borrower) if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the money advanced by the institution under the facility is still legally owned and held by, and under the control of, the institution until the settlement of the payment for the securities successfully subscribed.

subsection.leadIn: The institution may allocate a risk-weight of 0% to its exposure arising from the facility during the period between the time the commitment to extend the facility is made by the institution and the time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: payment for the securities successfully subscribed is made by the institution to the receiving bank of the issuer of the securities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the IPO is cancelled before the payment referred to in paragraph (a) is made, the outstanding loan amount under the facility is fully repaid.

section.name: s113B
section.heading: Eligible covered bond exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the attributed risk-weight of the issuer of an eligible covered bond; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: allocate a risk-weight to an exposure to that eligible covered bond in accordance with Table 13 based on the attributed risk-weight of the issuer determined under paragraph (a).

td.p: Risk-weight for eligible covered bond exposures

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), if the issuer of an eligible covered bond is a financial institution other than a bank, an authorized institution may determine the attributed risk-weight of the issuer in a manner as if the issuer were a bank.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Cash and gold

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 0% to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notes and coins owned by the institution that are the lawful currency of a jurisdiction and are held by the institution or in transit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s holding of certificates of indebtedness issued by the Government for the issue of legal tender notes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: gold bullion held by the institution, or gold bullion held on an allocated basis for the institution by another person, that is backed by gold bullion liabilities.

subsection.content: Gold bullion held on an unallocated basis for an authorized institution by another person that is backed by gold bullion liabilities must be allocated the attributed risk-weight of that person.
Gold bullion held by an authorized institution, or gold bullion held for the institution by another person, that is not backed by gold bullion liabilities must be allocated a risk-weight of 100%.

section.name: s114A
section.heading: Items in the process of clearing or settlement

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 0% to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unsettled clearing item of the institution that is being processed through any interbank clearing system in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any receivable from a transaction of the institution in securities, foreign exchange or commodities that is not yet due for settlement.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 20% to a cheque, draft or other item drawn on another bank—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is payable to the account of the institution immediately on presentation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is in the process of collection.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of transactions in securities, foreign exchange and commodities that are entered into by an authorized institution on a delivery-versus-payment basis, if any of those transactions is outstanding after the settlement date in respect of the transaction concerned, the institution must allocate to the positive current exposure incurred by the institution under the transaction a risk-weight of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 0% if the transaction is outstanding up to and including the 4th business day after the settlement date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 100% if the transaction remains outstanding from 5 to 15 business days (both days inclusive) after the settlement date;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 625% if the transaction remains outstanding from 16 to 30 business days (both days inclusive) after the settlement date;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 937.5% if the transaction remains outstanding from 31 to 45 business days (both days inclusive) after the settlement date; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 1 250% if the transaction remains outstanding for 46 or more business days after the settlement date.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of transactions in securities, foreign exchange and commodities that are entered into by an authorized institution on a basis other than a delivery-versus-payment basis, if any of those transactions is outstanding after the settlement date in respect of the transaction concerned, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the transaction remains outstanding up to and including the 4th business day after the settlement date, risk-weight the following items as loans to the counterparty to the transaction—

subparagraph.content: the amount of payment made, or the current market value of the thing delivered, by the institution under the transaction; and
any positive current exposure incurred by the institution under the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the transaction remains outstanding for 5 or more business days after the settlement date, allocate a risk-weight of 1 250% to—

subparagraph.content: the amount of payment made, or the current market value of the thing delivered, by the institution under the transaction; and
any positive current exposure incurred by the institution under the transaction.

subsection.content: Unless otherwise stated in Part 6A, subsections (1)(b), (3) and (4) do not apply to repo-style transactions.

section.name: s115
section.heading: What are regulatory residential real estate exposures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a real estate exposure (other than an ADC exposure) of an authorized institution to an obligor is a regulatory residential real estate exposure if all of the following criteria are met in respect of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any claim on the mortgaged property is legally enforceable in all relevant jurisdictions;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the exposure is secured by a first legal charge on the mortgaged property or, if the mortgaged property falls within subsection (2)(b), the exposure will be secured by a first legal charge on the residential property after it is fully completed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the exposure is granted for one or more of the following purposes—

subparagraph.content: financing the acquisition of the mortgaged property;
refinancing the acquisition of the mortgaged property;
cashing out the equity in the mortgaged property;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s underwriting policies with respect to the granting of real estate exposures are adequate and prudent and include—

subparagraph.content: assessment of the ability of the obligor to repay; and

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: all the information (including information on the ability of the obligor to repay and on the valuation of the mortgaged property) required at loan origination and for monitoring purposes is properly documented.

subsection.leadIn: Residential property falls within this subsection if the property is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fully-completed residential property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a residential property under construction or land on which a residential property will be constructed where—

subparagraph.content: the real estate exposure secured by which is granted to an individual or a property-holding shell company owned by an individual who is the guarantor of the exposure; and

subparagraph.leadIn: either of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: the institution is able to demonstrate, with the support of written and reasoned legal advice, that the sovereign of the jurisdiction (including Hong Kong) in which the property or land is located or any public sector entity of that jurisdiction has the legal power and ability to ensure that the property under construction or to be constructed will be finished.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may classify a real estate exposure secured by a residential property as a regulatory residential real estate exposure despite the criteria set out in subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exposure was originated before the commencement date* of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exposure was eligible for a risk-weight of 50% under subsection (1) as in force immediately before that date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there has been no material change to the loan terms and conditions since that date.

section.name: s115A
section.heading: Loan-to-value ratio

subsection.leadIn: The loan-to-value ratio (LTV ratio) of a regulatory residential real estate exposure (subject exposure) secured by one or more residential properties (subject security) must be calculated as a ratio of the amount specified in paragraph (a) to the amount specified in paragraph (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the sum of—

subparagraph.content: the principal amount of any outstanding drawn portion of the subject exposure (including accrued interest); and
the amount of any undrawn committed portion of the subject exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value at origination of the subject security, with the exceptions set out in subsections (6) and (7).

subsection.leadIn: If a pool of regulatory residential real estate exposures (collectively referred to as subject exposure) is secured by one or more residential properties (subject security), the LTV ratio of the subject exposure must be calculated as a ratio of the amount specified in paragraph (a) to the amount specified in paragraph (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the sum of—

subparagraph.content: the principal amount of any outstanding drawn portion of each of the regulatory residential real estate exposures in the pool (including accrued interest); and
the amount of any undrawn committed portion of each of the regulatory residential real estate exposures in the pool;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value at origination of the subject security, with the exceptions set out in subsections (6) and (7).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pool of real estate exposures is secured by one or more residential properties (subject security); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pool consists of both regulatory residential real estate exposures and real estate exposures that are neither regulatory residential real estate exposures nor ADC exposures,

subsection.continued: the LTV ratio applicable to the regulatory residential real estate exposures in the pool (subject exposures) must be calculated in accordance with subsection (2) where the reference to regulatory residential real estate exposures in subsection (2)(a) is taken to be a reference to all of the exposures in the pool referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The numerator of the LTV ratio calculated under subsection (1), (2) or (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be reduced by any specific provisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must not take into account the effect of any recognized credit risk mitigation (including mortgage insurance) except for cash on deposit with the authorized institution—

subparagraph.content: that is unconditionally and irrevocably pledged (or otherwise provided as security) by the obligor in respect of the subject exposure under a netting or offsetting agreement for the sole purpose of redemption of the subject exposure; and

subparagraph.leadIn: for which the security arrangement meets all of the following requirements—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the institution has a well-founded legal basis for concluding that the netting or offsetting agreement with the obligor is enforceable in each relevant jurisdiction regardless of whether the obligor is insolvent or bankrupt;

subparagraph.name: B
C
D
subparagraph.content: the institution monitors and controls its exposures to the obligor on a net basis.

subsection.content: If a regulatory residential real estate exposure of an authorized institution secured by one or more residential properties (subject security) was originated before the commencement date* of this section and the subject security was revalued at least once before that date, the institution may treat the value at the last revaluation conducted before that date as the value at origination of the subject security.

subsection.leadIn: In calculating the LTV ratio of a subject exposure under subsection (1), (2) or (3), an authorized institution must use a value lower than the value at origination of the subject security if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: downward adjustment of the value of the subject security is warranted by the prevailing local property market situations;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an extraordinary, idiosyncratic event occurs and results in a permanent reduction of the value of the subject security.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution incurs a new residential real estate exposure secured by a subject security that is also the security for at least one existing residential real estate exposure of the institution and an updated valuation of the security is obtained as part of the new loan application process in relation to the new residential real estate exposure, the institution may use the updated valuation in calculating the LTV ratio of the pool of regulatory residential real estate exposures secured by the subject security under subsection (2) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value of a subject security has been adjusted downwards under subsection (6)(a), an authorized institution may make a subsequent upward adjustment to the value of the subject security and, except in cases where the resultant adjusted value is higher than the value at origination of the subject security, use the resultant adjusted value in the LTV ratio calculation under subsection (1), (2) or (3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the value of a subject security has been adjusted downwards under subsection (6)(b), an authorized institution may, with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, make a subsequent upward adjustment to the value of the subject security and use the resultant adjusted value in the LTV ratio calculation under subsection (1), (2) or (3); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: modifications are made to a residential property included in a subject security that unequivocally increase the value of the property and there is an updated valuation that confirms the increase in value, an authorized institution may take into account that increase in the LTV ratio calculation under subsection (1), (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: value at origination (批出承擔時價值)—(a)in relation to a regulatory residential real estate exposure of an authorized institution secured by one or more residential properties, means the valuation of the property or properties obtained by the institution at the time of origination of the exposure; and(b)in relation to a pool of residential real estate exposures of an authorized institution originated at the same time and secured by one or more residential properties, means the valuation of the property or properties obtained by the institution at the time of origination of the pool.

section.name: s115B
section.heading: Risk-weights of regulatory residential real estate exposures

subsection.content: This section applies to a regulatory residential real estate exposure of an authorized institution, including a regulatory residential real estate exposure to a member of its staff (whether solely or jointly with another person).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 115C, if the exposure is an exposure that does not depend materially on cash flows generated by the residential property securing the exposure (non-IPRE exposure), the institution must allocate a risk-weight to the exposure in accordance with Table 13A based on the LTV ratio of the exposure calculated under section 115A.

leadIn.b: Risk-weights for Regulatory Residential Real Estate Exposures that are Non-IPRE Exposures

td.p: More than 70% but not more than 90%

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 115C, if the exposure is not a non-IPRE exposure, the institution must allocate a risk-weight to the exposure in accordance with Table 13B based on the LTV ratio of the exposure calculated under section 115A.

leadIn.b: Risk-weights for Regulatory Residential Real Estate Exposures that are not Non-IPRE Exposures

td.p: More than 70% but not more than 90%

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), the exposure is not a non-IPRE exposure if both the servicing of the exposure and the prospects for recovery in the event of default depend materially on the cash flows generated by the residential property securing the exposure, rather than on the income, revenue and net worth of the obligor in respect of the exposure generated from other sources;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution may treat the exposure as a non-IPRE exposure if the property is—

subparagraph.content: the primary residence of the obligor in respect of the exposure; or
if the obligor in respect of the exposure is a property-holding shell company owned by an individual who is the guarantor of the exposure—that individual’s primary residence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the exposure was originated before the commencement date* of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023, the institution may, if information necessary for assessment is not sufficient or readily available, treat the exposure as a non-IPRE exposure.

section.name: s115C
section.heading: Risk-weights of real estate exposures secured by residential property outside Hong Kong
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a real estate exposure (other than an ADC exposure) of an authorized institution is secured by a residential property outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant supervisory authority of the jurisdiction in which the residential property is situated has implemented capital adequacy standards that were formulated in accordance with the Basel Framework,

section.continued: the institution may allocate a risk-weight to the exposure provided for under the capital adequacy standards (but excluding any approach that is based on internal models) applicable to banks incorporated in that jurisdiction.

section.name: s115D
section.heading: Risk-weights of other real estate exposures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 150% to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an ADC exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other real estate exposure that is neither a regulatory residential real estate exposure nor a real estate exposure to which section 115C applies.

section.name: s115E
section.heading: Equity exposures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 115F and 115G, an authorized institution must allocate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a risk-weight of 400% to a speculative unlisted equity exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a risk-weight of 250% to an equity exposure that is not a speculative unlisted equity exposure.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: speculative unlisted equity exposure (投機性非上市股權風險承擔) means an equity investment in an unlisted company that is—(a)invested for short-term resale purposes; or(b)considered venture capital or similar investment that is—(i)subject to price volatility; and(ii)acquired in anticipation of significant future capital gains.

section.name: s115F
section.heading: Significant capital investments in commercial entities

subsection.leadIn: If the net book value of an authorized institution’s significant capital investment in a commercial entity exceeds 15% of the institution’s capital base as at the immediately preceding calendar quarter end date as reported in its capital adequacy ratio return, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: allocate a risk-weight determined in accordance with section 115E(1)(a) or (b), as the case requires, to the amount of the net book value of the investment that does not exceed that 15%.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: significant capital investment in a commercial entity (對商業實體的重大資本投資) means an authorized institution’s holdings of shares in a commercial entity if—(a)the holdings amount to more than 10% of the ordinary shares issued by the commercial entity; or(b)the commercial entity is an affiliate of the institution.

section.name: s115G
section.heading: Holdings of capital instruments issued by, and non-capital LAC liabilities of, financial sector entities

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution has an insignificant LAC investment that is a direct holding, indirect holding or synthetic holding of a capital instrument issued by, or a non-capital LAC liability of, a financial sector entity, any amount of the insignificant LAC investment that is not deducted from the institution’s capital base under sections 43(1)(o), 47(1)(c) and 48(1)(c) must be allocated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a risk-weight determined in accordance with section 115E(1)(a) or (b), as the case requires, if the insignificant LAC investment is an equity exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a risk-weight of 150% if the insignificant LAC investment is not an equity exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution has a significant LAC investment that is a direct holding, indirect holding or synthetic holding of a capital instrument issued by, or a non-capital LAC liability of, a financial sector entity, any amount of the significant LAC investment that is not deducted from the institution’s capital base under sections 43(1)(p), 47(1)(d) and 48(1)(d) must be allocated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a risk-weight of 250% if the significant LAC investment is in a CET1 capital instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.content: a risk-weight determined in accordance with section 115E(1)(a) or (b), as the case requires, if the significant LAC investment is an equity exposure; or
a risk-weight of 150% if the significant LAC investment is not an equity exposure.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution maintains any non-capital LAC debt resources and has holdings of non-capital LAC liabilities that fall within section 48A, the institution must allocate a risk-weight of 150% to any amount of the holdings that is not deducted from the institution’s capital base under section 48(1)(g)(i).

section.name: s115H
section.heading: Exposures to subordinated debts
section.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 150% to an exposure to a subordinated debt issued by a bank or corporate.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Other exposures

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if none of the sections in Subdivisions 2, 3 and 4 applies to an exposure, an authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 100% to the exposure.

The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to an authorized institution, direct the institution to allocate to an exposure, or an exposure belonging to a class of exposures, to which this section applies, a risk-weight specified in the notice, being a risk-weight greater than 100%.
An authorized institution must comply with a notice given to it under subsection (2).

If, in respect of an exposure of an authorized institution, the institution has difficulty in allocating any accrued interest under the exposure to the obligors of the institution, the institution may, with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, treat the accrued interest as an exposure to which this section applies.

section.name: s117
section.heading: Exposures to credit-linked notes

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to an exposure to a credit-linked note that is the higher of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight that would be attributable to the reference obligations of the note under Subdivision 2, 3, 4 or 5, as applicable.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if a credit-linked note—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a first-to-default note, second-to-default note or nth-to-default note; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides credit protection proportionately to a basket of reference obligations,

subsection.continued: an authorized institution must determine the risk-weight attributable to an exposure to the note as the risk-weight attributable to the pool of reference obligations of the note determined in accordance with section 117B(1), (2), (3) or (4), as the case requires, as if the exposure to the note were a direct exposure to the credit default swap embedded in the note.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to an exposure to a credit-linked note, or any part of such an exposure, to which any provision in Subdivision 4 applies.

section.name: s117A
section.heading: Determination of risk-weight applicable to certain types of off-balance sheet exposures

subsection.content: If an off-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution (subject exposure) is an asset sale with recourse, a sale and repurchase agreement (other than a repo-style transaction) or a forward asset purchase, where the institution is exposed to the credit risk of the assets sold or to be purchased, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the risk-weight applicable to those assets.
If a subject exposure is partly paid-up shares and securities, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the risk-weight applicable to the relevant shares or securities.

If a subject exposure is a direct credit substitute arising from the selling of credit protection in the form of total return swap or credit default swap in the authorized institution’s banking book, subject to section 117B, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the risk-weight applicable to the reference obligation specified in the swap.

If a subject exposure is a default risk exposure in respect of a single-name credit default swap that falls within section 226J(1) and the amount of the default risk exposure is determined in accordance with section 226J(3), the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the attributed risk-weight of the counterparty in respect of the swap without taking into account any recognized credit risk mitigation afforded to the swap.

If a subject exposure is a commitment to extend a loan secured by a fully completed residential property and the exposure, but for the fact that it does not satisfy any one or more of section 115(1)(b), (c) or (d), would have been a regulatory residential real estate exposure, the authorized institution may allocate a risk-weight in accordance with section 115B to the exposure, if the institution has no reason to believe that any of section 115(1)(b), (c) or (d) will not be satisfied immediately after the loan that is the subject of the commitment is drawn down.

section.name: s117B
section.heading: Further provisions in relation to direct credit substitutes

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 117A(3) arises from a first-to-default credit derivative contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the sum of the risk-weights applicable to the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is subject to a cap of 1 250%.

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 117A(3) arises from a second-to-default credit derivative contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is the sum of the risk-weights applicable to the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract but excluding the lowest of those risk-weights; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is subject to a cap of 1 250%.

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 117A(3) arises from any other nth-to-default credit derivative contract, subsection (2), with all necessary modifications, applies to that contract as it applies to a second-to-default credit derivative contract, so that the reference to “lowest” in subsection (2)(a) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “lowest and second lowest” in the case of a third-to-default credit derivative contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “lowest, second lowest and third lowest” in the case of a fourth-to-default credit derivative contract,

subsection.continued: and likewise for other nth-to-default credit derivative contracts.

subsection.leadIn: If a subject exposure referred to in section 117A(3) arises from a credit derivative contract that provides credit protection proportionately in respect of the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract, the risk-weight applicable to the subject exposure is calculated in accordance with Formula 13.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Risk-weight of Off-balance Sheet Exposure Arising from Credit Derivative Contract under

subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: RWi is the risk-weight of reference obligation i.

section.name: s117C
section.heading: Exposures in respect of assets underlying SFTs

subsection.content: This section applies to an authorized institution’s exposure to the asset underlying a specified SFT.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if a specified SFT is booked in the institution’s banking book, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat the securities sold or lent, or the securities provided as collateral, under the specified SFT as an on-balance sheet exposure of the institution as if the institution had never entered into the specified SFT; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allocate to the exposure the risk-weight attributable to the securities.

subsection.content: If the securities referred to in subsection (2)(a) are securitization issues, the risk-weight attributable to the securities must be determined in accordance with Part 7.

To avoid doubt, if a specified SFT is booked in an authorized institution’s trading book, an exposure of the institution to the asset underlying the specified SFT is an exposure subject to the requirements of Part 8 instead of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified SFT (指明SFT), in relation to an authorized institution, means—(a)a repo-style transaction that falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of repo-style transaction in section 2(1); or(b)a repo-style transaction that falls within paragraph (d) of that definition under which the collateral provided by the institution is in the form of securities.

division.name: D3A
division.heading: CIS Exposures

section.name: s117D
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 3A
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: indirect CIS exposure (間接CIS風險承擔) means an indirect CIS exposure within the meaning of section 226ZH;
Level 1 CIS (1級CIS) means a Level 1 CIS within the meaning of section 226ZH;
Level 2 CIS (2級CIS) means a Level 2 CIS within the meaning of section 226ZH;
Level n+1 CIS (n+1級CIS) means a Level n+1 CIS within the meaning of section 226ZH.

section.name: s117E
section.heading: Treatment of CIS exposure held by authorized institution

subsection.content: If no amount of an authorized institution’s CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS constitutes a deductible holding, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the exposure in accordance with Part 6B.

subsection.leadIn: If any amount of an authorized institution’s CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS constitutes one or more deductible holdings, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: classify the amounts of the CIS exposure that constitute deductible holdings into one portion (portion A);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: classify the amount of the CIS exposure that does not constitute deductible holdings into another portion (portion B);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: apply the treatment set out in section 117F to each of the amounts of the CIS exposure in portion A; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of portion B (if any) in accordance with Part 6B.

section.name: s117F
section.heading: Treatment of CIS exposure constituting deductible holding

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an authorized institution’s CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS, or any part of the exposure, that constitutes a deductible holding.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: deduct any amount determined under paragraph (a) from its capital base; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of any amount determined under paragraph (b) by multiplying that amount by the applicable risk-weight determined in accordance with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allocate a risk-weight, determined in accordance with section 115E(1)(a) or (b), as the case requires, to any amount of deductible holding determined under subsection (2)(b), if the deductible holding is an insignificant LAC investment that is an equity exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: allocate a risk-weight of 150% to any amount of deductible holding determined under subsection (2)(b), if the deductible holding is—

subparagraph.content: an insignificant LAC investment that is not an equity exposure; or
a holding of non-capital LAC liabilities falling within section 48A; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: allocate a risk-weight of 250% to any amount of deductible holding determined under subsection (2)(b), if the deductible holding is a significant LAC investment in a CET1 capital instrument.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, this section also applies to cases where a CIS exposure to a Level 1 CIS, or any part of the exposure, constitutes a deductible holding because regulatory deductible items are held by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Level 2 CIS to which the Level 1 CIS has a CIS exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Level n+1 CIS (where n is an integer equal to or greater than 2) to which the Level 1 CIS has an indirect CIS exposure.

section.name: s117G
section.heading: Determination of risk-weights applicable to certain types of off-balance sheet CIS exposures

subsection.content: This section applies to a CIS exposure that is an off-balance sheet exposure.

If the CIS exposure is an asset sale with recourse, a sale and repurchase agreement (other than a repo-style transaction) or a forward asset purchase, where the seller or buyer of the assets underlying the transaction is exposed to the credit risk of the assets sold or to be purchased, the risk-weight applicable to the CIS exposure is the risk-weight applicable to those assets.
If the CIS exposure is partly paid-up shares and securities, the risk-weight applicable to the CIS exposure is the risk-weight applicable to the relevant shares or securities.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Calculation of Exposure Amounts of Off-balance Sheet Exposures

section.name: s118
section.heading: Calculation of exposure amounts of off-balance sheet exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the credit equivalent amount of an off-balance sheet exposure (other than an exposure to which subsection (2) or (3) applies) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determining the CCF applicable to the exposure in accordance with Schedule 6 and, if applicable, subsection (1A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiplying the principal amount of the exposure, after deducting any specific provisions applicable to the exposure, by the CCF determined under paragraph (a). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If an off-balance sheet exposure (exposure A) is a commitment the drawdown of which would give rise to another off-balance sheet exposure (exposure B), the CCF applicable to exposure A is the lower of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the CCF applicable to the commitment determined in accordance with Schedule 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the CCF applicable to exposure B determined in accordance with Schedule 6. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has posted unsegregated collateral to a counterparty for a transaction or contract booked in its banking book or trading book; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the collateral is not posted for a derivative contract or SFT; or
the collateral is posted for a derivative contract or SFT but is not included in the calculation of default risk exposure under Division 1A, 2, 2A or 2B of Part 6A,

subsection.continued: the institution must treat the principal amount of the collateral, net of specific provisions, as the credit equivalent amount of its off-balance sheet exposure to the counterparty in respect of the collateral. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate its default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs by using the approach or methods set out in Division 1A, 2, 2A or 2B of Part 6A, as the case requires. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

division.name: D5
division.heading: Use of Recognized Collateral in Credit Risk Mitigation

section.name: s124
section.heading: Recognized collateral
section.leadIn: Collateral is recognized for the purposes of calculating the risk-weighted amount of an exposure of an authorized institution where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the legal mechanism by which the collateral is pledged (or otherwise provided as security) ensures that the institution has the right to realize, or to take legal possession of, the collateral in a timely manner in the event of a default by, or the insolvency or bankruptcy of, or any other event specified in the relevant legal documentation applicable to any of— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the obligor in respect of the exposure; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the custodian, if any, holding the collateral;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution has clear and adequate procedures for the timely realization of collateral in respect of an event referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution has taken all steps to fulfil requirements under the law applicable to the institution’s interest in the collateral which are necessary to obtain and maintain an enforceable security interest, whether by registration or otherwise, or to exercise a right to set-off in relation to the title transfer of the collateral; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: e
ea
paragraph.leadIn: if the collateral is provided under a margin agreement for derivative contracts or SFTs, the institution— (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has devoted sufficient resources to enable the orderly operation of the agreement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: has collateral management policies in place to control, monitor and report—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: risks (including liquidity risk and concentration risk) associated with the agreement;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: reuse of collateral; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the rights ceded by the institution in respect of collateral posted; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the credit quality of the obligor in respect of the exposure does not have material positive correlation with—

subparagraph.content: the current market value of the collateral; and
the residual risks (including legal, operational, liquidity and market risks) arising from the use of the collateral for the purpose of mitigating the credit risk of the exposure; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the collateral—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is pledged (or otherwise provided as security) for not less than the life of the exposure; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is revalued not less than every 6 months from the date upon which the collateral is taken in respect of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the collateral falls within any one of the paragraphs of section 125(1). (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s125
section.heading: Collateral which may be recognized for purposes of section 124(h)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), for the purposes of section 124(h), only collateral of the following description may be recognized in relation to an authorized institution— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cash on deposit with the institution or held at a third-party bank;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certificates of deposit issued by the institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: instruments issued by the institution which are comparable to instruments referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: gold bullion; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: debt securities issued or guaranteed by a sovereign of a Tier 1 country;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: debt securities issued or guaranteed by a relevant international organization;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: debt securities issued by a public sector entity of a Tier 1 country; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: debt securities issued by an unspecified multilateral body; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.leadIn: debt securities (other than eligible covered bonds) issued by—

subparagraph.content: a bank falling within paragraph (a) of the definition of bank in section 2(1); or
a bank falling within paragraph (b) of that definition that is incorporated in a Tier 1 country; or (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: eligible covered bonds. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: A reference to debt securities in subsection (1) does not include debt securities that are re-securitization exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s126
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of exposures taking into account credit risk mitigating effect of recognized collateral

subsection.content: An authorized institution may take into account the credit risk mitigating effect of recognized collateral in the calculation of the risk-weighted amounts of its exposures that are not default risk exposures (non-default risk exposures) only in accordance with section 127 or 128, as the case requires. (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may take into account the credit risk mitigating effect of recognized collateral in the calculation of the risk-weighted amount of a default risk exposure in accordance with section 129 only if any of the following is complied with in respect of the exposure— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exposure is in respect of a derivative contract calculated by using the current exposure method;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exposure is in respect of an SFT calculated in accordance with section 226MJ; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the following—

subparagraph.content: the exposure is in respect of one or more than one derivative contract entered into by the institution with a counterparty;
the exposure is calculated by using the SA-CCR approach or the IMM(CCR) approach; and
the conditions specified in subsection (1B) are met. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution entered into the contract or contracts with the counterparty under a general banking facility consisting of 2 or more credit lines, and, for at least one of those credit lines, if drawn (whether in full or not), the drawn portion that will result from such drawdown is, at the time of the drawdown, a non-default risk exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the credit lines are secured by the same recognized collateral;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no amount of the recognized collateral is designated solely for offsetting losses on default risk exposures incurred by the institution under the general banking facility; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the recognized collateral is not included in the calculation of the default risk exposure under Division 1A or 2 of Part 6A. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If the same recognized collateral is available to cover both default risk exposures and non-default risk exposures, an authorized institution may, under section 127 or 128, take into account the credit risk mitigating effect of the recognized collateral for the purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the non-default risk exposures only to the extent of the current market value, or the part of such value, of the collateral that is not included in the calculation of the default risk exposures under Division 1A or 2 of Part 6A. (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: However, the calculation in accordance with section 127, 128 or 129 is subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4). (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: Where the recognized collateral consists of collateral—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: which is held at a third-party bank in a non-custodial arrangement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is unconditionally and irrevocably pledged or assigned to an authorized institution,

subsection.continued: the institution shall allocate to the credit protection covered portion of the exposure the attributed risk-weight of the third-party bank.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must, if the exposure and the recognized collateral have currency mismatch, reduce the value of the collateral by 8%. (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the recognized collateral is not a securitization issue, determine the risk-weight to be allocated to the collateral in accordance with Subdivision 2 of Division 3 as if the collateral were an on-balance sheet exposure; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the recognized collateral is a securitization issue, determine the risk-weight to be allocated to the collateral in accordance with Part 7 as if the collateral were an on-balance sheet exposure. (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 175 of 2017)

section.name: s127
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of on-balance sheet exposures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall calculate the risk-weighted amount of each of its on-balance sheet exposures by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: dividing the exposure amount of the exposure into— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: i
