subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3A), if, under these Rules, an authorized institution may use more than one IRB calculation approach set out in Table 17 to calculate its credit risk for exposures which fall within an IRB class, the institution shall not, except with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use more than one such IRB calculation approach to calculate its credit risk for exposures which fall within that IRB class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discontinue using one such IRB calculation approach, and commence using another such IRB calculation approach, to calculate its credit risk for exposures which fall within that IRB class.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution used the advanced IRB approach before the commencement date* of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023 for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exposures to corporates that satisfy the requirements set out in section 143(3A)(a) or (b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exposures to corporates that are financial institutions treated as corporates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: bank exposures,

subsection.continued: the institution is not required to obtain the prior consent of the Monetary Authority under subsection (3) to commence using the foundation IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for those exposures on and after that date. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: An authorized institution must not use the advanced IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for exposures to corporates that satisfy the requirements set out in section 143(3A)(a) or (b) and corporates that are financial institutions treated as corporates. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.content: Despite section 8(4)(a), if an authorized institution used the IRB approach before the commencement date of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023 to calculate its credit risk for equity exposures (within the meaning of the pre-amended Part 6), the institution must use the STC approach on and after that date to calculate its credit risk for equity exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), only use more than one rating system for exposures which fall within an IRB class if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the rating systems concerned are necessary having regard to the characteristics and complexity of those exposures;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: document the reason for assigning an exposure to a particular rating system.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: pre-amended Part 6 (原有的第6部) means Part 6 of these Rules as in force immediately before the commencement date of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D4
division.heading: Risk-weighting Framework under IRB Approach

section.name: s148
section.heading: General requirements for estimation of probability of default, loss given default and exposure at default
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of making estimates of PD and, where relevant, LGD and EAD (collectively referred to in this Division as estimates)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: conduct periodic assessments of its risk quantification process and update the process as necessary to ensure that new data and analytical techniques and evolving industry practices are incorporated into the process;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: update the institution’s estimates produced by the institution’s risk quantification process not less than once in every 12 months;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: base the institution’s estimates on historical experience and empirical evidence and not only on subjective or judgmental considerations, take into account all relevant data and information available and use appropriate methods;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the data the institution uses in its estimates (whether internal data or external data, or both)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are representative of its long run default experience and long run loss experience (covering a period which captures a reasonable mix of high-default and low-default years of at least one economic cycle); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: are based on economic or market conditions which are relevant to current and foreseeable economic or market conditions;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: ensure that adjustments to the estimates, based on data which fall within paragraph (d)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are only made or approved by officers of the institution with the necessary experience and expertise to make or approve such adjustments and who have been authorized by the institution to make or approve such adjustments; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: form part of the institution’s risk quantification process and are based on the exercise in good faith of judgment by officers who fall within subparagraph (i) and are not biased towards reducing the institution’s regulatory capital for credit risk; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the institution has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a set of procedures to evaluate the appropriateness of the method or data used in making the estimates; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a mechanism for increasing the estimates when the evaluation referred to in subparagraph (i) indicates that the estimates fail to satisfy the institution’s internal standards on the accuracy of estimates used by the institution.

section.name: s149
section.heading: Default of obligor

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), for the purposes of this Part, a default of the obligor in respect of an exposure of an authorized institution has occurred if— (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution considers that the obligor is unlikely to pay in full the obligor’s credit obligations to the institution (or to any member of the consolidation group of the institution) without recourse by the institution to realizing any collateral held by the institution or taking any other action in respect of the exposure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (2), (3) and (8), the obligor is past due for more than 90 days in respect of the payment of any material portion of all of the obligor’s outstanding credit obligations to the institution (or to any member of the consolidation group of the institution).

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), an authorized institution may regard an obligor as being unlikely to pay in full its credit obligations to the institution if one or more of the following events have occurred in respect of the obligor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any material credit obligation is put on non-accrued status;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any credit obligation is sold at a material credit-related economic loss;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a distressed restructuring of any credit obligation is agreed by the institution;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the obligor has sought, or has been placed in, bankruptcy or similar protection where this would avoid or delay repayment of any of the credit obligations to the institution or any member of the consolidation group of the institution. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Where the obligor in respect of a retail exposure is past due for more than 90 days in respect of any payment owing by the obligor in respect of that exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), an authorized institution—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must treat the exposure as being in default; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may treat all other outstanding credit obligations of the obligor to the institution (or to any member of the consolidation group of the institution) as being in default; (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution shall disregard paragraph (a) if the obligor is also past due for more than 90 days in respect of any payment owing by the obligor in respect of any other exposure which is not a retail exposure.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1)(b) and (2), an overdraft provided by an authorized institution to an obligor (being a borrower under the overdraft) is past due if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the obligor has breached a maximum limit which was set by the institution, and the institution has advised the obligor of the maximum limit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has advised the obligor of a maximum limit which is less than the current outstanding balance of the overdraft; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the overdraft is not authorized by the institution.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), where an authorized institution intends to use, for a particular IRB class or IRB subclass of the institution, the default criteria (not being the prescribed default criteria) set by the relevant banking supervisory authority of the institution’s parent bank, the institution shall not use those default criteria except with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority.

The Monetary Authority shall not give an authorized institution the consent referred to in subsection (4) to use the default criteria referred to in that subsection in respect of a particular IRB class or IRB subclass of the institution unless the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the differences between those default criteria and the prescribed default criteria will not materially affect the accuracy of the estimates generated by the institution’s rating system.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5B), (5C) and (5D), an authorized institution must treat its exposures to all individual obligors in a connected group as being in default if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: a default of an obligor (defaulting obligor) in the connected group has occurred; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the defaulting obligor has been rated substantially on the basis of the economic or financial interdependence between the members in the connected group in accordance with the institution’s policy and practices referred to in section 154(d). (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5A) does not apply in respect of the authorized institution’s exposures to all obligors in the connected group if—

def.name: RelevantDefault
def.leadIn: the default referred to in paragraph (a) of that subsection (relevant default) is a default to which subsection (2)(a) applies by virtue of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fact that the relevant default is a retail exposure in respect of which the defaulting obligor is past due for more than 90 days in respect of any payment owing by the obligor to the institution in respect of that exposure; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the fact that the defaulting obligor is not also past due for more than 90 days in respect of any payment owing by the obligor to the institution in respect of any other exposure that is not a retail exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has not, following the occurrence of the relevant default, exercised its discretion under subsection (2)(a)(ii) to treat all other outstanding credit obligations of the defaulting obligor to the institution (or to any member of the consolidation group of the institution) as being in default. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.content: The authorized institution may disregard subsection (5A) in respect of the institution’s exposures to any obligor in the connected group if that obligor has not been rated on the basis referred to in paragraph (b) of that subsection. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subsection.name: 5D
subsection.leadIn: The authorized institution may disregard subsection (5A) in respect of the institution’s exposures to any obligor in the connected group if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that disregarding that subsection in respect of those exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is neither imprudent nor unreasonable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: will not materially prejudice the calculation of the institution’s regulatory capital for credit risk. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), an authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep a record of defaults in exposures of the institution using the prescribed default criteria;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use the prescribed default criteria to generate the estimates from the institution’s rating system; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: only use internal data (to the extent that such data had come into existence before 1 January 2007) or external data which are inconsistent with the prescribed default criteria if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it has made adjustments to the data such that the data are consistent with the prescribed default criteria. (L.N. 128 of 2014)

subsection.content: Subsection (6) applies to and in relation to an authorized institution which uses the default criteria referred to in subsection (4) as it applies to and in relation to an authorized institution which uses the prescribed default criteria.
An authorized institution shall not engage in the practice of re-ageing for the purposes of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: distressed restructuring (不利的重組) has the meaning given by section 67(7); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
non-accrued status (非累算狀況) has the meaning given by section 67(7); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
prescribed default criteria (訂明違責準則) means the criteria specified in subsection (1);

rated (受評級), in relation to an obligor of an authorized institution, means that the institution’s corporate, sovereign or bank exposures to the obligor have been assigned to obligor grades by using the IRB approach. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

division.name: D5
division.heading: Specific Requirements for Corporate, Sovereign and Bank Exposures

section.name: s150
section.heading: Rating dimensions

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an authorized institution shall ensure that its rating system for corporate, sovereign and bank exposures has 2 distinct and separate rating scales, comprising—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obligor grades which reflect, exclusively, the risk of default of obligors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: facility grades which reflect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: transaction-specific factors affecting loss severity in the case of default of obligors; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where relevant, the characteristics of obligors to the extent that the characteristics are predictive of LGD.

subsection.content: An authorized institution which uses the foundation IRB approach shall be regarded as complying with subsection (1)(b) if its rating system for corporate, sovereign and bank exposures has a rating scale which reflects the EL of exposures assigned to each grade.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, in respect of its corporate, sovereign and bank exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rank and assign each exposure to the obligor grades and facility grades in accordance with its rating criteria and based on all relevant information available regarding the creditworthiness of the obligor or loss severity of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assign the same obligor grade to separate exposures to the same obligor unless the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the risk of default of the obligor in respect of such exposures is different.

subsection.content: An authorized institution may use a rating system for its specialized lending under supervisory slotting criteria approach which reflects EL by incorporating considerations about the creditworthiness of obligors and loss severity in respect of such lending.

section.name: s151
section.heading: Rating structure

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall ensure that its process for assigning corporate, sovereign and bank exposures to its obligor grades or facility grades results in a consistent, logical and cogent differentiation of credit risk inherent in those exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with no excessive concentrations on particular obligor grades or facility grades;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the level of perceived and measured credit risk increasing as credit quality declines from one grade to the next; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: allowing for reasonably accurate, consistent and verifiable estimation of credit risk components for each exposure.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), an authorized institution shall ensure that its rating system for corporate, sovereign and bank exposures has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 7 obligor grades for exposures to obligors who are not in default; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than one obligor grade for exposures to obligors who are in default.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution uses the supervisory slotting criteria approach for its specialized lending, the institution shall ensure that its rating system has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 4 obligor grades for specialized lending to obligors who are not in default; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than one obligor grade for specialized lending to obligors who are in default.

section.name: s152
section.heading: Rating criteria
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its rating definitions in respect of obligor grades and facility grades; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its rating processes and criteria for assigning exposures to such grades,

section.continued: are specific, logical, sufficiently detailed and consistently applied and result in a clear differentiation of credit risk inherent in the exposures.

section.name: s153
section.heading: Rating assignment horizon
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use a time horizon of more than one year for the purposes of assigning its exposures to obligor grades;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), ensure that the obligor grade to which an exposure is assigned accurately represents the institution’s assessment of the willingness and ability of an obligor in respect of the exposure to perform the obligor’s contractual obligations, after taking into account any potentially adverse economic conditions over an economic cycle within the industry or geographic region relevant to the obligor; (L.N. 267 of 2006; L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: act prudently in assessing information relating to the willingness and ability of an obligor in respect of an exposure to perform the obligor’s contractual obligations; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: when estimating the PD for an obligor that is highly leveraged or whose assets are predominantly traded assets, ensure such estimate reflects the performance of the obligor’s assets based on volatilities calibrated to data from periods of significant financial stress. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.name: s154
section.heading: Rating coverage
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of each exposure which falls within the IRB classes of corporate, sovereign and bank exposures, assign the exposure to an obligor grade or facility grade as part of the institution’s process for giving credit approvals; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of each obligor to whom the institution has a corporate, sovereign or bank exposure, assign the exposure to the obligor grade which accurately reflects the level of credit risk of the obligor in respect of the exposure; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (d) and (e), rate on an individual basis each legal entity to which the institution is exposed; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of paragraph (c), demonstrate, to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority, that its policy and practices regarding the assignment of exposures to obligor grades in respect of individual obligors in a connected group—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are prudent and reasonable;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: set out, at the least—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the circumstances under which the institution may or may not assign the same obligor grade in respect of exposures to separate obligors in a connected group; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the definition of a connected group for the purposes of rating assignment; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: are applied in a consistent manner; and (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: set out in policies and put into operation a process for the identification of specific wrong-way risk for each legal entity to which the institution is exposed. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.name: s155
section.heading: Integrity of rating process
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution has in place policies and procedures to ensure that the rating process for corporate, sovereign and bank exposures is independent of the institution’s staff and management responsible for originating such exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assignment of exposures to obligor grades and facility grades is reviewed and updated not less than once in every 12 months and exposures to obligors which are more likely to default are subject to more frequent review and updating;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whenever the institution becomes aware of any new material information on an exposure (including in relation to the obligor in respect of that exposure), a review is conducted, within a reasonable period after the institution becomes so aware, of whether the exposure should be assigned to a different obligor grade or facility grade, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution has in place an effective process to obtain and update relevant information on the financial conditions and on other credit risk characteristics of the obligors in respect of the institution’s exposures which affect assigned estimates of PD, LGD and EAD; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the institution has in place an effective process for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: identifying, documenting, reviewing and updating the circumstances in which it is appropriate for officers of the institution to override the inputs to, or the outputs of, the institution’s rating system; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ensuring that such circumstances are prudent; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: ensuring that all permissible overrides are approved by officers of the institution having delegated credit authority and are applied in a consistent manner; and (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: monitoring the nature and performance of such overrides following approval. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

section.name: s156
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of corporate, sovereign and bank exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the risk-weighted amount of the institution’s corporate, sovereign and bank exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to section 167(1)(c), if the institution uses the foundation IRB approach, provide its own estimate of the PD of each of its obligor grades and use supervisory estimates for the other credit risk components for inclusion into the risk-weight function to be used in that calculation; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution uses the advanced IRB approach, provide its own estimate of the PD, LGD and EAD of each of its obligor grades and facility grades, as the case may be, and calculate the M of its exposures for inclusion into the risk-weight function to be used in that calculation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the institution uses the supervisory slotting criteria approach to calculate the risk-weighted amount of its specialized lending, use the relevant supervisory estimate for the risk-weight to be allocated to the specialized lending.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5A) and section 158(2), an authorized institution shall use Formula 16 to calculate the risk-weighted amount of the institution’s corporate, sovereign and bank exposures which are not in default. (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

text.b: Risk-weight Function for Corporate, Sovereign and Bank

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: PD and LGD are expressed in decimals, EAD is expressed in Hong Kong dollars and M is expressed in years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: EXP denotes exponential;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1n denotes the natural logarithm;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: N(x) denotes the cumulative distribution function for a standard normal random variable; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: G(z) denotes the inverse cumulative distribution function for a standard normal random variable.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall apply a zero capital charge factor (K) to a sovereign exposure of the institution if the calculation required under this section in respect of the exposure results in a negative capital charge factor (K) for the exposure.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 158(2), an authorized institution shall use the same risk-weight function set out in Formula 16 to calculate the risk-weighted amount of the institution’s corporate, sovereign and bank exposures which are in default except that the capital charge factor (K) for a defaulted corporate, sovereign or bank exposure shall be equal to the greater of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: zero; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the figure resulting from the subtraction of the institution’s best estimate of the EL of the exposure from the LGD of the exposure.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Where an exposure falls within section 140(1D), an authorized institution may calculate the risk-weighted amount of the exposure by multiplying the EAD of the exposure by the relevant risk-weight attributable to that exposure determined under Part 4. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.name: s157
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 156(2)—firm-size adjustments for small-and-medium sized corporates

subsection.content: If a corporate exposure of an authorized institution falls within the IRB subclass of small-and-medium sized corporates, the institution must make an adjustment to take into account the size of the corporate concerned (firm-size adjustment) to the calculation of the correlation (R) in the risk-weight function specified in Formula 16 by substituting the following correlation formula for that in Formula 16—

subsection.leadIn: In the correlation formula set out in subsection (1), S is expressed in terms of a million as— (L.N. 267 of 2006; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the total annual sales of the corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case where the corporate concerned is a member of a group of companies, the consolidated total annual sales of the group of companies of which the corporate is a member,

subsection.continued: of not less than $50 million to not more than $500 million.

subsection.content: Where any total annual sales referred to in subsection (2) is less than $50 million, the authorized institution concerned shall, for the purposes of that subsection, treat the total annual sales as if it were $50 million.

Where an authorized institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the total annual sales of a corporate does not accurately reflect the corporate’s scale of business, then, for the purposes of this section, the institution may, with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, substitute the corporate’s total assets for the total annual sales in calculating the firm-size adjustment.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution’s specialized lending or its exposure that falls within the IRB subclass of financial institutions treated as corporates would have been classified as a corporate exposure that falls within the IRB subclass of small-and-medium sized corporates under section 143(3) but for the operation of section 143(4A), (4B) and (4C)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution may make a firm-size adjustment referred to in subsection (1) to the calculation of the correlation (R) in the risk-weight function specified in Formula 16 in respect of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply accordingly. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s157A
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 156(2)—asset value correlation multiplier for exposures to certain financial institutions

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to an obligor that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a large regulated financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a financial institution that is not supervised by a financial regulator.

subsection.content: Where a corporate, sovereign or bank exposure of an authorized institution is to an obligor to which this subsection applies, the institution must multiply the correlation (R) in the risk-weight function specified in Formula 16 by 1.25. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: LargeRegulatedFinancialInstitution
def.leadIn: large regulated financial institution (大型受監管金融機構) means a financial institution that is supervised by a financial regulator and that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has total assets of not less than $780 billion as determined by reference to the institution’s most recent audited consolidated financial statements or (if the institution does not have any subsidiary) the institution’s most recent audited financial statements; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a member of a group of companies (comprised of the ultimate holding company and all of its subsidiaries) that has total assets of not less than $780 billion as determined by reference to the group’s most recent audited consolidated financial statements.

section.name: s158
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 156—risk-weights for specialized lending

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1A), (1B) and (1C), where an authorized institution is able to comply with— (L.N. 212 of 2015)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 159 in relation to the estimation of PD under the foundation IRB approach of any of its specialized lending; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 159, 161, 164 and 168 in relation to the estimation of PD, LGD and EAD and the calculation of M under the advanced IRB approach of any of its specialized lending,

subsection.continued: the institution shall use the risk-weight function specified in Formula 16 (if applicable, adjusted in accordance with section 157(5) in respect of specialized lending that falls within that section 157(5) or section 157A in respect of exposures to obligors that fall within any of the descriptions in section 157A(1)(a) and (b)) to derive the risk-weighted amount of such specialized lending. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If the specialized lending is an HVCRE exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of 0.24 in the correlation (R) in the risk-weight function specified in Formula 16 is to be replaced by a value of 0.3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if section 157(5) is applicable, the value of 0.24 in the correlation (R) in section 157(1) is to be replaced by a value of 0.3; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if section 157A is applicable, a reference to Formula 16 in that section is a reference to the Formula as adjusted under paragraph (a) or (b). (L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that falls within subsection (1)(b) in respect of any of its HVCRE exposures must not use the advanced IRB approach to derive the risk-weighted amount of any of such exposures if both of the following circumstances (triggering circumstances) occur—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution has material income-producing real estate exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution does not use the advanced IRB approach to derive the risk-weighted amount of all of its exposures falling within the IRB subclass of specialized lending (income-producing real estate). (L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: Despite subsection (1B), if an authorized institution started to use the advanced IRB approach to derive the risk-weighted amount of any of its HVCRE exposures at a time when it did not have any material income-producing real estate exposure, even if both of the triggering circumstances subsequently occur in respect of it, it may continue to so use the advanced IRB approach until the expiry of 6 months after the date on which it becomes aware of the occurrence of the circumstances. (L.N. 212 of 2015)

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution does not fall within subsection (1) in respect of any of its specialized lending, the institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use the supervisory slotting criteria approach to derive the risk-weighted amount of such specialized lending;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assign any internal grade to such specialized lending based on the institution’s criteria, systems and processes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: map the internal grades assigned to specialized lending referred to in paragraph (b) to one of the 5 supervisory rating grades of “strong”, “good”, “satisfactory”, “weak” and “default” set out in Table 18 or 18A, whichever is applicable, by reference to— (L.N. 212 of 2015)

subparagraph.content: the criteria specified in paragraphs CRE33.13 to CRE33.16 in Chapter CRE33 of the consolidated Basel Framework launched by the Basel Committee as amended or supplemented from time to time; or (L.N. 167 of 2023)
the credit quality grades specified in a table made by the Monetary Authority under section 4B(2); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (3) and (4), apply the risk-weight specified in Table 18 or 18A, whichever is applicable, for the relevant supervisory rating grade in calculating the risk-weighted amount of such specialized lending.

content.b: Supervisory Rating Grades for Determination of Risk-weights for Specialized Lending other than HVCRE Exposures
Supervisory Rating Grades for Determination of Risk-weights for HVCRE Exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may allocate a risk-weight of 50% to its specialized lending (other than HVCRE exposures and specified ADC exposures) which falls into the supervisory rating grade of “strong” in Table 18, and a risk-weight of 70% to its specialized lending (other than HVCRE exposures and specified ADC exposures) which falls into the supervisory rating grade of “good” in Table 18, if— (L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specialized lending has a remaining maturity of less than 2.5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the institution’s credit underwriting criteria and the ability of the obligor in respect of the specialized lending to withstand other risk characteristics are substantially stronger than the corresponding criteria for the equivalent supervisory rating grade as referred to in subsection (2)(c)(i).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may allocate a risk-weight of 70% to its HVCRE exposure that falls into the supervisory rating grade of “strong” in Table 18A, and a risk-weight of 95% to its HVCRE exposure that falls into the supervisory rating grade of “good” in Table 18A, if— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exposure has a remaining maturity of less than 2.5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the institution’s credit underwriting criteria and the ability of the obligor in respect of the exposure to withstand other risk characteristics are substantially stronger than the corresponding criteria for the equivalent supervisory rating grade as referred to in subsection (2)(c)(i). (L.N. 212 of 2015)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, an authorized institution has material income-producing real estate exposures if the average aggregate EAD of its exposures falling within the IRB subclass of specialized lending (income-producing real estate) over the past 12 months exceeds 5% of the institution’s capital base as determined under Part 3. (L.N. 212 of 2015; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedADCExposure
def.leadIn: specified ADC exposure (指明ADC風險承擔) means a specialized lending—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that finances the land acquisition, development or construction phase of commercial real estate (excluding commercial real estate of a type referred to in section 143(1)(e)(i) or (ii)) that exhibits higher loss rate volatility compared to other types of specialized lending; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which there is uncertainty of repayment within the meaning of section 143(7) but the obligor in respect of which has substantial equity at risk in the commercial real estate. (L.N. 212 of 2015)

section.name: s159
section.heading: Probability of default

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which uses the foundation IRB approach or advanced IRB approach shall estimate the PD of each of its obligor grades such that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (ab), (b) (ba) and (c), the estimate of the PD is a long run average of one-year default rates for obligors in respect of exposures which fall within the obligor grade to which the estimate relates; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the long run average PD referred to in paragraph (a) must be an observed historical average PD that is a simple average based on the number of obligors in respect of the corporate, sovereign and bank exposures; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (ba), in the case of a corporate or bank exposure of the institution that is not in default, the estimate of the PD is not less than 0.05%; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: paragraph (b) does not apply to the portion of such an exposure of the institution that is covered by a recognized guarantee issued by a sovereign; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a corporate, sovereign or bank exposure of the institution which is in default, the estimate of the PD is 100%; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the estimate of the PD is based on not less than one source of data—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is relevant to the institution’s corporate, sovereign or bank exposures;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which covers a period of not less than 5 years; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)
which includes a representative mix of good and bad years of the economic cycle relevant for the institution’s corporate, sovereign or bank exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution shall use information, sources of data and techniques which take into account the institution’s long run default experience and long run loss experience as referred to in section 148(d)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an authorized institution uses a primary technique for the estimation of PD and other techniques as a point of comparison and potential adjustment, the institution shall act prudently in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: comparing the results of the primary technique and other techniques; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: making adjustments for the respective limitations of the primary technique and other techniques.

section.name: s160
section.heading: Loss given default under foundation IRB approach

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which uses the foundation IRB approach shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), use a supervisory estimate of 45% for the LGD of its senior exposures that are financial institution treated as corporate, sovereign or bank exposures that are— (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: unsecured; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), use a supervisory estimate of 40% for the LGD of its senior exposures that are corporate exposures (other than financial institution treated as corporate exposures) that are—

subparagraph.content: unsecured; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), use a supervisory estimate of 75% for the LGD of its subordinated exposures which are corporate, sovereign or bank exposures; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), use the supervisory estimate of the LGD specified in paragraph (a), (ab) or (b), as the case requires, for its default risk exposures; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: use a supervisory estimate of 100% for the LGD of the institution’s default risk exposures in respect of single-name credit default swaps if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the swaps fall within section 226J(1); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those exposures are determined in accordance with section 226J(3); and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for transactions that fall within section 226J(4), use a supervisory estimate of 100% for the LGD of the institution’s default risk exposures in respect of the transactions if—

subparagraph.content: the institution calculates its market risk capital charge by using the STM approach or the IMA; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

the determination of the default risk exposures under that section has used existing calculations for SA-DRC (as defined by section 281) or default risk charge (as defined by section 281), as the case requires, that already contain an LGD assumption. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1)(ba) and (3), an authorized institution which uses the foundation IRB approach may, for the purposes of calculating the risk-weighted amount of a senior exposure of the institution which falls within any of its IRB classes of corporate, sovereign and bank exposures, take into account the credit risk mitigating effect of any— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: recognized financial collateral; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recognized IRB collateral.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: continue to calculate EAD without taking into account the presence of any collateral and, to avoid doubt, the terms unsecured portion of the exposure (EU) and the secured portion of the exposure (ES) are only used to calculate LGD* for the purposes of Formula 18;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of Formula 18—

subparagraph.content: use sections 90, 91 and 92(1) to determine HE and Hfx;
use sections 90, 91 and 92(1) to determine HC if the recognized collateral is a recognized financial collateral and use 40% as HC if the recognized collateral is a recognized IRB collateral;
to avoid doubt, apply a haircut of 0% to applicable repo-style transactions that are treated as collateralized loans to the counterparty in accordance with section 92(2); and

adjust the value of the recognized collateral in accordance with section 103, with all necessary modifications, if the recognized collateral in respect of an exposure of the institution has a residual maturity that is shorter than the residual maturity of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the institution has obtained more than one recognized collateral in respect of the exposure—

subparagraph.content: continue to calculate EAD without taking into account the presence of any collateral and, to avoid doubt, the terms unsecured portion of the exposure (EU) and the secured portion of the exposure (ES) are only used to calculate LGD* for the purposes of Formula 19; and

subparagraph.leadIn: for the purposes of Formula 19—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: use sections 90, 91 and 92(1) to determine HE and Hfx,i;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: use sections 90, 91 and 92(1) to determine HC,i if the recognized collateral is a recognized financial collateral and use 40% as HC,i if the recognized collateral is a recognized IRB collateral;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: to avoid doubt, apply a haircut of 0% to applicable repo-style transactions that are treated as collateralized loans to the counterparty in accordance with section 92(2); and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.leadIn: adjust the value of the recognized collateral in accordance with section 103, with all necessary modifications, if the recognized collateral in respect of an exposure of the institution has a residual maturity that is shorter than the residual maturity of the exposure.

leadIn.b: Determination of Effective LGD of Exposure Secured by Recognized Collateral

subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: LGD* is the effective LGD;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: LGDU is the supervisory estimate of the LGD specified in subsection (1)(a), (ab), (c) or (d), as the case requires, for the unsecured portion of the exposure;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: EU is E × (1 + HE) – ES;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: E is the EAD of the exposure;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: HE is the haircut applicable to the authorized institution’s exposure to the obligor under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92(1);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: LGDS is—
0% if the recognized collateral is a recognized financial collateral; or
the applicable value of LGDS specified in Table 18B in respect of the type of recognized IRB collateral concerned, if the recognized collateral is a recognized IRB collateral;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: C is the current market value of the recognized collateral before adjustment required by the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral;
HC is—
the haircut applicable to the recognized financial collateral under the standard supervisory haircuts, if the recognized collateral is a recognized financial collateral; or
40% if the recognized collateral is a recognized IRB collateral; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: Hfx is the haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92(1).

leadIn.b: LGDS Applicable to Recognized IRB Collateral

td.p: Recognized commercial real estate and recognized residential real estate

leadIn.b: Determination of Effective LGD of Exposure Secured by more than One Recognized Collateral

subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: LGD* is the effective LGD;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: LGDU is the supervisory estimate of the LGD specified in subsection (1)(a), (ab), (c) or (d), as the case requires, for the unsecured portion of the exposure;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: E is the EAD of the exposure;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: HE is the haircut applicable to the authorized institution’s exposure to the obligor under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92(1);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: LGDS,i, for each recognized collateral i is—
0% if the recognized collateral is a recognized financial collateral; or
the applicable value of LGDS specified in Table 18B in respect of the type of recognized IRB collateral concerned, if the recognized collateral is a recognized IRB collateral;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: ES,i is Ci × (1 – HC,I – Hfx,i), where the total ES,i across all collaterals, ∑i ES,i, is subject to a maximum value of E × (1 + HE);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: Ci is the current market value of each recognized collateral i before adjustment required by the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral;
HC,i, for each recognized collateral i, is—
the haircut applicable to the recognized financial collateral under the standard supervisory haircuts, if the recognized collateral is a recognized financial collateral; or
40% if the recognized collateral is a recognized IRB collateral; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: Hfx,i, for each recognized collateral i, is the haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92(1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: financial institution treated as corporate exposures (視為法團的金融機構風險承擔) means exposures to financial institutions treated as corporates; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
senior exposure (優先風險承擔), in relation to an authorized institution, means an exposure of the institution to an obligor which is not a subordinated exposure;

def.name: SubordinatedExposure
def.leadIn: subordinated exposure (後償風險承擔), in relation to an authorized institution, means an exposure of the institution to an obligor which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is lower in ranking, or junior, to other claims against the obligor in terms of the priority of repayment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: will be repaid only after all the senior claims against the obligor have been repaid.

section.name: s161
section.heading: Loss given default under advanced IRB approach

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution which uses the advanced IRB approach shall estimate the LGD of each of its facility types such that— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the estimate of the LGD reflects the effect on the severity of the loss suffered in respect of an exposure which falls within a facility type of economic downturn conditions where credit losses are expected to be substantially higher than average;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimate of the LGD is not less than the long run default-weighted average loss rate given default calculated as the average loss rate of all observed defaults within the data source used by the institution for the estimation of the LGD of a facility type;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (be) and subsection (1B), the estimate of the LGD of a corporate exposure that is unsecured or secured by a collateral that is not a recognized collateral is not less than 25%; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (be), the estimate of the LGD of a corporate exposure that is a fully secured exposure secured by—

subparagraph.content: financial receivables; or
commercial real estate or residential real estate,

paragraph.continued: is not less than 10%; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: bc
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (be), the estimate of the LGD of a corporate exposure that is a fully secured exposure secured by physical collateral (other than commercial real estate and residential real estate) is not less than 15%; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: bd
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (be) and subsections (1A) and (1B), the estimate of the LGD of a corporate exposure that is a partially secured exposure or is secured by more than one recognized collateral is not less than the effective LGD floor calculated by the use of Formula 19A; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: be
paragraph.content: paragraphs (ba), (bb), (bc) and (bd) do not apply to the portion of a corporate exposure of the institution that is covered by a recognized guarantee issued by a sovereign; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the estimate of the LGD of a facility type—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is based on historical recovery rates of exposures which fall within the facility type; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: the estimate of the LGD of a facility type is based on not less than one source of data—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is relevant to the exposures which fall within the facility type;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which covers a period of not less than 7 years; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which covers at least one economic cycle;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if the process of estimating the LGD of a facility type involves data mapping in respect of the institution’s exposures which fall within the facility type to the factors in reference data sets used by ECAIs—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in any case where the institution combines multiple sets of reference data used by ECAIs, the institution has in place a policy—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: setting out the manner in which the combination is effected; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ensuring that the institution avoids biases or inconsistencies in the mapping process.

leadIn.b: Determination of Effective LGD Floor for Partially Secured Exposure or Exposure Secured by more than One Recognized Collateral

subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: LGD# is the effective LGD floor;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: E is the EAD of the exposure;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: HE is the haircut applicable to the authorized institution’s exposure to the obligor under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92(1);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: LGDS floor,i, for each recognized collateral i, is the applicable value of LGD floor specified in Table 19A in respect of the type of recognized collateral concerned;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: ES,i is Ci × (1 – HC,i – Hfx,i), subject to a minimum value of 0 and the total ES,i across all collaterals, ∑i ES,i, is subject to a maximum value of E × (1 + HE);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Ci is the current market value of each recognized collateral i before adjustment required by the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: HC,i, for each recognized collateral i, is—
the haircut applicable to the recognized collateral under the standard supervisory haircuts, if the recognized collateral is of the type of financial collateral; or

40% if the recognized collateral is of the types of financial receivables, commercial real estate, residential real estate or physical collateral (other than commercial real estate and residential real estate); and

Hfx,i, for each recognized collateral i, is the haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, under the standard supervisory haircuts subject to adjustment as set out in section 92(1).

leadIn.b: LGD Floors by Type of Recognized Collateral

td.p: Commercial real estate or residential real estate
Physical collateral (other than commercial real estate and residential real estate)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Formula 19A, an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use sections 90, 91 and 92(1) to determine HE and Hfx,i;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use sections 90, 91 and 92(1) to determine HC,i if the recognized collateral is a financial collateral and use 40% as HC,i if the recognized collateral is not a financial collateral;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to avoid doubt, apply a haircut of 0% to applicable repo-style transactions that are treated as collateralized loans to the counterparty in accordance with section 92(2); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: adjust the value of the recognized collateral in accordance with section 103, with all necessary modifications, if the recognized collateral in respect of an exposure of the institution has a residual maturity that is shorter than the residual maturity of the exposure. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution is unable to estimate an LGD for an exposure that is secured by one or more recognized financial collaterals or recognized IRB collaterals as a result of lack of sufficient data to model the effect of the recognized collateral on recoveries, the institution may determine the LGD of the exposure in accordance with section 160(3) under Formula 18 or 19, as the case requires, with the value of LGDU being replaced by the higher of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the LGD estimated by the institution for unsecured exposure without taking into account the presence of any collateral; or

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have in place an effective and well-documented process for assessing the effects, if any, of economic downturn conditions on debt recovery rates in respect of different facility types and for producing estimates of LGD which reflect those conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take into account all major factors relevant to measuring loss, including the time value of money, the risk premium, and any direct and indirect costs associated with collection in respect of exposures which fall within the facility type;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take into account the extent of any positive correlation between the credit risk of an obligor to whom the institution has an exposure which falls within a facility type and that of any collateral provided in respect of that exposure or that of the provider of such collateral and address the effect of such correlation, if any, in a prudent manner; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: address any currency mismatch and maturity mismatch in a prudent manner.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that uses the advanced IRB approach must comply with section 160(1)(c) or (d), as the case requires, in estimating the LGD of a facility type that comprises default risk exposures in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: single-name credit default swaps that fall within the description in section 160(1)(c)(i) and (ii); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: transactions that fall within the description in section 160(1)(d)(i) and (ii),

subsection.continued: as if the institution were an authorized institution that uses the foundation IRB approach. (L.N. 156 of 2012)

section.name: s163
section.heading: Exposure at default under foundation IRB approach—on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures other than default risk exposures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which uses the foundation IRB approach shall, in relation to an on-balance sheet exposure of the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: use the current drawn amount of the exposure, after taking into account the credit risk mitigating effect of any recognized netting as specified in section 209, as an estimate of the EAD of the exposure such that the EAD of the exposure is not less than the sum of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount by which the institution’s CET1 capital would be reduced if the exposure were fully written-off; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any specific provisions and partial write-offs in respect of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not take into account any discount in respect of the exposure in calculating the risk-weighted amount of the exposure.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2AA), an authorized institution that uses the foundation IRB approach shall, for the purposes of estimating the EAD of an off-balance sheet exposure (other than default risk exposure) of the institution specified in column 2 of Table 20, calculate the credit equivalent amount of the exposure by multiplying the principal amount of the exposure by the CCF specified in column 3 of that Table opposite the type of off-balance sheet exposure. (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

content.b: Determination of CCF for Off-balance Sheet Exposures other than Default Risk Exposures

td.p: Sale and repurchase agreements (excluding those that are repo-style transactions) (L.N. 167 of 2023)

Partly paid-up securities (being an off-balance sheet exposure to the credit risk of the securities purchased from an issuer where only a part of the issue price or nominal face value of the securities has been paid by the institution and the institution will be required to pay the unpaid amount in the future) (L.N. 175 of 2017)
Note issuance and revolving underwriting facilities (L.N. 167 of 2023)
Subject to subsection (2AA), commitments that do not fall within any of items 1, 2, 3, 4, 4A, 5, 6, 7 and 8—

tr.td: subject to paragraph (c), that may be cancelled at any time unconditionally by an authorized institution without prior notice or that provide for automatic cancellation due to a deterioration in the creditworthiness of the person to whom the commitment has been made;
subject to paragraph (c), that do not fall within paragraph (a); and
the drawdown of which will give rise to an off-balance sheet exposure falling within any of items 1, 2, 3, 4, 4A, 5, 6, 7 and 8 or any item specified in section 166 (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.content: the CCF applicable to the commitment determined under paragraph (a) or (b), as the case requires; and
the CCF applicable to the off-balance sheet exposure arising from the drawdown of the commitment concerned

subsection.name: 2AA
subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may allocate a CCF of 0% to a commitment that falls within the IRB class of corporate exposures if the commitment satisfies all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the credit quality of the obligor is closely monitored by the institution on an ongoing basis;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution receives no fees or commissions to establish or maintain the commitment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the obligor is required to apply to the institution for initial and each subsequent drawdown;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the institution’s decision on the execution of each drawdown is only made after assessing the creditworthiness of the obligor immediately prior to drawdown. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution that uses the foundation IRB approach has an off-balance sheet exposure to a counterparty arising from unsegregated collateral posted to the counterparty, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collateral is posted for a transaction or contract booked in the institution’s banking book or trading book; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the transaction or contract is not a derivative contract or SFT; or
the transaction or contract is a derivative contract or SFT but the collateral is not included in the calculation of default risk exposures under Division 1A, 2 or 2B of Part 6A,

subsection.continued: the institution must estimate the EAD of the off-balance sheet exposure as the product of the principal amount of the collateral and a factor of (1 + H). (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2A), H is the standard supervisory haircut applicable to the collateral, subject to adjustment set out in section 3 of Schedule 7 with the minimum holding period applicable to the collateral determined in the same way as set out in section 91(4). (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: In this section— (L.N. 167 of 2023)
subsection.def: commitment (承諾), in relation to the determination of a CCF applicable to an off-balance sheet exposure, has the meaning given by section 2 of Schedule 6; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

discount (折讓), in relation to an on-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution, means the amount by which the institution’s estimate of the EAD of the exposure exceeds the sum referred to in subsection (1)(a).

section.name: s164
section.heading: Exposure at default under advanced IRB approach—on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures other than default risk exposures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4B), an authorized institution that uses the advanced IRB approach must, in relation to an on-balance sheet exposure of the institution— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: estimate the EAD of the exposure such that the estimate is not less than—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the sum of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the amount by which the institution’s CET1 capital would be reduced if the exposure were fully written-off; and (L.N. 156 of 2012)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any specific provisions and partial write-offs in respect of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not take into account any discount in respect of the exposure in calculating the risk-weighted amount of the exposure.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4B) and section 163(2AA), an authorized institution that uses the advanced IRB approach must— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: estimate the EAD of an off-balance sheet exposure of the institution specified in column 2 of Table 20 in accordance with subsections (3), (3A) and (4); and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: estimate the EAD of an off-balance sheet exposure of the institution to a counterparty arising from unsegregated collateral posted to the counterparty in accordance with subsections (4) and (4A) if—

subparagraph.content: the collateral is posted for a transaction or contract booked in the institution’s banking book or trading book; and

subparagraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the transaction or contract is not a derivative contract or SFT; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the transaction or contract is a derivative contract or SFT but the collateral is not included in the calculation of default risk exposures under Division 1A, 2 or 2B of Part 6A. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in any other case—determine the EAD of the exposure in accordance with section 163(2) as if it were using the foundation IRB approach. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a), the exposure specified is an off-balance sheet exposure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is revolving in nature; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not subject to a CCF of 100% in Table 20. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall estimate the EAD of an off-balance sheet exposure of the institution such that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a facility, the estimate of the EAD of the facility reflects the possibility of additional drawings by the obligor in respect of that facility up to and after the time a default event is triggered in respect of the facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (c) and (ca), the estimate of the EAD is a prudent estimate of the long run default-weighted average EAD of exposures which fall within a facility type with allowance made for the likely margin of error and for any identified positive correlation between the frequency of defaults in respect of exposures which fall within the facility type and any increase in the estimate of the EAD of those exposures; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a facility type for which the estimate of the EAD is volatile over an economic cycle, the institution uses an estimate of the EAD of the facility type which is appropriate for an economic downturn if that estimate is more prudent than the long run default-weighted average EAD of exposures which fall within the facility type;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: if the estimate of the EAD is based on alternative measures of central tendency or only on the economic downturn data, the institution must ensure that the estimate does not fall below a conservative estimate of the long run default-weighted average EAD of exposures that fall within a facility type; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: the estimate of the EAD to be used for each facility type—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: is derived from criteria which are material drivers for the estimation of the EAD of exposures which fall within the facility type;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the estimate of the EAD of a facility type is based on not less than one source of data—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is relevant to exposures which fall within the facility type;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which covers a period of not less than 7 years; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which covers at least one economic cycle.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The EAD for an authorized institution’s off-balance sheet exposure estimated under subsection (2)(b) must not be lower than the principal amount of the collateral concerned. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4C), the EAD applicable to a corporate exposure for inclusion into the risk-weight function specified in Formula 16 must not be less than the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the EAD of the on-balance sheet exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 50% of the EAD of the off-balance sheet exposure determined in accordance with section 163(2). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.content: Subsection (4B) does not apply to the portion of a corporate exposure of an authorized institution that is covered by a recognized guarantee issued by a sovereign. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(b)—
subsection.def: discount (折讓), in relation to an on-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution, means the amount by which the institution’s estimate of the EAD of the exposure exceeds the sum referred to in subsection (1)(a)(ii).

section.name: s165
section.heading: Exposure at default under foundation IRB approach or advanced IRB approach—default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts
section.content: An authorized institution that uses the foundation IRB approach or the advanced IRB approach must determine the outstanding default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts booked in the banking book or trading book of the institution based on the default risk exposure calculated for the contracts by using the SA-CCR approach or the IMM(CCR) approach, as the case requires.

section.name: s166
section.heading: Exposure at default under foundation IRB approach or advanced IRB approach—off-balance sheet exposures not covered by sections 163, 164, 165 and 202

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an off-balance sheet exposure that is not any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an off-balance sheet exposure specified in column 2 of Table 20;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an off-balance sheet exposure the EAD of which is estimated in accordance with section 163(2A) or 164(2)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a default risk exposure mentioned in section 165 or 202.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that uses the foundation IRB approach or the advanced IRB approach must, in estimating the EAD of its off-balance sheet exposure, calculate the credit equivalent amount of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by applying—

subparagraph.content: if a CCF applicable to the exposure is specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1—that CCF; or
if no such CCF is specified—a CCF of 100%; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with section 163 or 164, as the case requires, with all necessary modifications.

section.name: s167
section.heading: Maturity under foundation IRB approach

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which uses the foundation IRB approach— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), may calculate the M of all of its corporate, sovereign and bank exposures in accordance with section 168. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: An authorized institution that uses the foundation IRB approach must give written notice to the Monetary Authority within 7 days after commencing to calculate the M of all of its corporate, sovereign and bank exposures in accordance with section 168 as if that section were applicable to those exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s168
section.heading: Maturity under advanced IRB approach

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which uses the advanced IRB approach shall calculate the M of a corporate or sovereign exposure of the institution as follows— (L.N. 44 of 2020; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (2) and (3), the M of the exposure is the greater of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the remaining effective maturity, in years, of the exposure as calculated in accordance with paragraph (b), (ba), (bb), (bc) or (c), as the case requires; (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (ba), (bb), (bc) and (c), if the exposure is subject to a predetermined cash flow schedule, the M of the exposure is calculated by the use of Formula 20; (L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: if the exposure is a default risk exposure in respect of a netting set calculated using the IMM(CCR) approach and the original maturity of the longest-dated contract contained in the netting set is greater than one year, the M of the exposure is calculated by the use of Formula 20A instead of Formula 20; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (c)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: if the exposure is a default risk exposure in respect of a netting set calculated using the IMM(CCR) approach and all the transactions in the netting set have an original maturity of not more than one year—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the effective maturity of each transaction in the netting set is calculated by the use of Formula 20; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the effective maturity of the netting set is calculated as the weighted average effective maturity of the transactions (using the notional amount of each transaction for weighting the maturity of the transactions within the netting set); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the netting set referred to in subparagraph (i) contains only one transaction, Formula 20 is used to calculate the M of the exposure; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: bc
paragraph.content: if the exposure is an exposure to which a revolving facility relates, the M of the exposure is calculated using the maximum contractual termination date of the facility, instead of using the repayment date of the facility currently drawn; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it is not practicable for the institution to comply with paragraph (b) or (bb) in respect of the exposure, the institution shall use a more prudent measure of M which is not less than the maximum remaining time, in years, that the obligor is permitted to take to fully perform the contractual obligations (including principal payments, interest payments and fees) of the obligor under the terms of the agreement governing the exposure; (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraphs (ba) and (bb), if the exposure is a default risk exposure resulting from the netting of nettable derivative contracts, the M of the exposure is the greater of the following—

subparagraph.content: 1 year. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

content.b: Calculation of Maturity for Corporate and Sovereign Exposures Subject to Predetermined Cash Flow Schedule

subsection.continued: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: CFt denotes the cash flows (including principal payments, interest payments and fees) contractually payable by the obligor in period t; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: t is expressed in years (that is, where a payment is due to be received in 18 months, t = 1.5).

content.b: Formula to be Used Instead of Formula 20 where Section 168(1)(ba) is Applicable

subsection.continued: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dfk is the risk-free discount factor for future time period tk;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: maturity = the time when the transaction that has the longest residual maturity in the netting set matures; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Δtk = tk – tk–1, which is the time interval between tk and tk–1 when EE is calculated at dates that are not equally spaced over time.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall use 5 years as the M of any exposure referred to in subsection (1) which would, but for this subsection, have an M of greater than 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution has an exposure that falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of relevant short-term exposure in subsection (5)— (L.N. 156 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(a) shall not apply to the exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the M of the exposure shall be the greater of—
