paragraph.content: the treatment set out in subsection (2) is not applicable to the underlying exposures of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (2B), (3), (4) and (5) and section 231, the originating institution may only—

subparagraph.content: if the credit risk mitigation is not in the form of tranched credit protection—calculate the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures of the transaction in accordance with subsection (2)(a) and take into account the effect of the credit risk mitigation in the calculation in accordance with Divisions 9 and 10 of Part 4 regardless of whether the calculation is made in accordance with Part 4;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the credit risk mitigation is in the form of tranched credit protection—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: decompose the underlying exposures of the transaction into a protected sub-tranche and an unprotected sub-tranche;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of the protected sub-tranche in accordance with this Part as if it were a securitization exposure and take into account the effect of the credit risk mitigation in the calculation in accordance with Divisions 9 and 10 of Part 4 instead of Division 5 of this Part; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of the unprotected sub-tranche by using the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA, as the case requires, and in accordance with sections 240, 241 and 249, as if the unprotected sub-tranche were a securitization exposure. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2A)(b)(i) and (ii)(B)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the credit protection covered portion (within the meaning of section 51(1)) or the protected sub-tranche, as the case requires, is the weighted-average risk-weight of the SPE’s assets determined under Part 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of the credit protection covered portion or the protected sub-tranche, as the case requires, must not be larger than the current market value of the SPE’s assets adjusted downwards by standard supervisory haircuts for volatility of the value of the assets and any currency mismatch subject to adjustment set out in section 92. (L.N. 44 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: The originating institution of the transaction must give notice to the Monetary Authority of its intention to apply the treatment under subsection (1), (2) or (2A) to the underlying exposures of the transaction for the purpose of calculating its capital adequacy ratio when— (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution applies the treatment for the first time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the transaction ceases to become an eligible securitization transaction after the institution has applied the treatment—the institution reapplies the treatment.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be given at least one month before the treatment is applied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the information on the particulars of the credit risk to the underlying exposures retained by the institution; and

a written confirmation that the transaction is an eligible securitization transaction, provided by a person who has sufficient seniority and authority and is independent of the persons (whether inside or outside the institution) responsible for originating the transaction or the underlying exposures.

subsection.leadIn: However, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing, require an originating institution not to apply, or to discontinue the application of, the treatment under subsection (1), (2) or (2A) to the underlying exposures of the transaction if the Monetary Authority is of the view that— (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the confirmation under subsection (4)(b)(ii) is not based on an adequate assessment of the degree of credit risk transfer against the criteria set out in section 229(1)(a) or (b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transaction contains features that render the criteria inadequate to determine whether significant credit risk transfer is achieved.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: The originating institution of a securitization transaction must comply with the requirement of a notice given to it under subsection (5). (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, an originating institution that applies the treatment under subsection (1), (2) or (2A) to the underlying exposures of a securitization transaction must— (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculate in accordance with this Part the risk-weighted amounts of the securitization exposures to the transaction retained, held or purchased by the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include the amounts in the calculation of the institution’s capital adequacy ratio.

section.name: s231
section.heading: Treatment of underlying exposures of eligible synthetic securitization transactions in case of maturity mismatch or call option

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an originating institution of an eligible synthetic securitization transaction intends to take into account, under section 230(2)(b) or (2A)(b), the effect of the credit risk mitigation used for transferring the credit risk of the underlying exposures of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the credit risk mitigation is in the form of tranched credit protection—the risk-weight assigned to the unprotected sub-tranche concerned under this Part is below 1,250%; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: there is a maturity mismatch between the underlying exposures of the transaction and the credit protection through which the credit risk is transferred under the transaction; or
the transaction incorporates a call option (other than a clean-up call) which is capable, when exercised, of terminating the transaction and the credit protection on a specified date.

subsection.leadIn: The institution may take into account the effect of the credit protection in its calculation of the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the credit protection has an original maturity of not less than 1 year and a residual maturity of more than 3 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution takes into account the effect of the maturity mismatch or the call option by adjusting the value of the credit protection by using Formula 12, with the residual maturity of the underlying exposures determined as the longest residual maturity of any of the underlying exposures of the transaction.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: In applying subsection (2)(b) for the purposes of section 230(2A)(b), P in Formula 12 must be construed to mean the amount of the credit protection covered portion or the protected sub-tranche, as the case requires, referred to in section 230(2B)(b). (L.N. 44 of 2020)

To avoid doubt, for credit risk mitigation referred to in section 230(2)(b)(ii) or (2A)(b), the institution must apply the treatment under subsection (2) instead of the treatments for maturity mismatch under Parts 4, 5 and 6.

section.name: s232
section.heading: Treatment of expected losses and provisions in respect of underlying exposures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an authorized institution if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is the originating institution of an eligible securitization transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it applies the treatments under section 230(1), (2) or (2A) to the underlying exposures of the transaction; (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the underlying exposures are still held on the balance sheet of the institution; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution would use the IRB approach to calculate the credit risk for the underlying exposures if they were not securitized.

subsection.leadIn: The institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not, in determining the institution’s total eligible provisions for the purposes of sections 42(3)(c) and 43(1)(i), include any specific provisions, partial write-offs, regulatory reserve for general banking risks and collective provisions made for, or any non-refundable purchase price discounts on, the underlying exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not, in determining the institution’s total EL amount for the purposes of those sections, include the EL amount estimated for the underlying exposures.

section.name: s233
section.heading: Treatment of underlying exposures of non-eligible securitization transactions

subsection.leadIn: An originating institution of a non-eligible traditional securitization transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures of the transaction in accordance with one or more of Parts 4, 5 and 6 and this Part, as the case requires, as if the underlying exposures were not securitized; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not, in its capital base determined in accordance with Part 3, include any gain-on-sale or any other increase in its CET1 capital arising from the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: An originating institution of a non-eligible synthetic securitization transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures of the transaction in accordance with one or more of Parts 4, 5 and 6 and this Part, as the case requires, as if the credit risk of the underlying exposures were not transferred to the other parties to the transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not, in the calculation under paragraph (a), take into account the effect of the credit risk mitigation used for transferring the credit risk of the underlying exposures to the other parties to the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: An originating institution of a non-eligible securitization transaction that has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculated the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures of the transaction in accordance with subsection (1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: included the amount in the calculation of its capital adequacy ratio,

subsection.continued: is not required to calculate risk-weighted amounts for any securitization exposures it may have to the transaction.

section.name: s234
section.heading: Measures for authorized institution providing implicit support

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution provides implicit support to a securitization transaction, it—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.leadIn: must notify the Monetary Authority, within 1 month from the date on which the support is provided, of the particulars of the following matters—

subparagraph.content: the support provided; and
the impact of the support on the institution’s capital adequacy ratio; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must disclose publicly the particulars mentioned in paragraph (c)(i) and (ii).

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution provides or has provided implicit support to more than one securitization transaction (whether at the same time or not), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the institution not to apply the treatment under section 230(1), (2) and (2A) to other securitization transactions for the period, or until the occurrence of the event, specified in the notice; or (L.N. 44 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advise the institution that the Monetary Authority is considering exercising the power under section 97F of the Ordinance to vary any capital requirement rule applicable to the institution, including by increasing all or any of its CET1 capital ratio, Tier 1 capital ratio and Total capital ratio.

subsection.content: The originating institution of a securitization transaction must comply with the requirement of a notice given to it under subsection (2)(a).

To avoid doubt, subsection (2)(b) does not operate to limit the circumstances in respect of which the Monetary Authority may exercise the power under section 97F of the Ordinance in relation to an authorized institution to which that subsection applies.

division.name: D3
division.heading: General Requirements for Risk-weighting Securitization Exposures

section.name: s235
section.heading: Determination of exposure amount of securitization exposure

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must determine the exposure amount of an on-balance sheet securitization exposure as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the exposure arises from a funded credit protection provided by the institution—the amount determined under subsection (4) or (5)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the principal amount of the exposure (net of purchase price discounts if applicable).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must determine the exposure amount of an off-balance sheet securitization exposure as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the exposure is a default risk exposure—the amount calculated by using the same approach or method the institution is required under section 10A to use to calculate its default risk exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the exposure arises from an unfunded credit protection provided by the institution—the amount determined under subsection (4) or (5)(b); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case, the amount calculated by multiplying the principal amount of the exposure by—

subparagraph.content: if the exposure arises from the undrawn portion of a qualified servicer cash advance facility provided by the institution—a factor that is the same as the CCF under the STC approach applicable to a commitment (within the meaning of section 2 of Schedule 6) that may be cancelled at any time unconditionally by the institution; or (L.N. 167 of 2023)
in any other case—a factor of 100%.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(c), a servicer cash advance facility is a qualified servicer cash advance facility if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the facility documentation clearly identifies and limits the circumstances under which the facility may be drawn;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the authorized institution providing the facility is entitled to full reimbursement of cash advanced under the facility, and the entitlement—

subparagraph.content: ranks senior to payment or repayment of other claims on cash flows from the underlying exposures of the securitization transaction concerned; and (L.N. 222 of 2018)
is not subject to any deferral or waiver by the institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: drawings under the facility are limited to the amount assessed by the institution as likely to be repaid fully from the cash flows generated by the underlying exposures or through realization of the underlying exposures or any credit enhancement available in the transaction;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the facility is not able to be drawn so as to provide credit support to cover losses already incurred in respect of the pool of underlying exposures prior to the drawing;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: there are no regular or continuous drawings under the facility to indicate that the facility is either—

subparagraph.content: used to provide permanent or regular funding to investors in the securitization issues; or
structured such that drawdown is certain; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the facility is unconditionally cancellable by the institution without prior notice to the person to whom the facility is provided.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution provides full or proportional credit protection to a securitization exposure, it must determine the exposure amount of its securitization exposure arising from the credit protection as the amount of the portion of the securitization exposure on which it has provided the credit protection.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution provides tranched credit protection to a securitization exposure or non-securitization exposure, it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decompose the exposure into a protected sub-tranche and an unprotected sub-tranche; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the exposure amount of its securitization exposure arising from the credit protection as the amount of the protected sub-tranche.

section.name: s236
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of securitization exposure

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and Division 5, an authorized institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of a securitization exposure by multiplying the exposure amount of the exposure determined in accordance with section 235 by the risk-weight of the exposure determined in accordance with Division 4, 7, 8, 9 or 10.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), if the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides full or proportional credit protection to a securitization exposure, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the credit protection as if it directly held the portion of the exposure on which it has provided the credit protection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides tranched credit protection to a securitization exposure, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the credit protection as if it had direct exposure to the sub-tranche of the securitization exposure on which it has provided the credit protection;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provides tranched credit protection to, or obtains tranched credit protection for, a non-securitization exposure, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amounts of the protected sub-tranche and the unprotected sub-tranche as if they were tranches of a securitization transaction of which the underlying exposure is the non-securitization exposure.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the exposure amount of a securitization exposure determined in accordance with section 235—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be reduced by any specific provisions or write-offs made for the securitization exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the securitization exposure is subject to a risk-weight of 1,250% and the institution is the originating institution of the securitization transaction concerned, may be further reduced by—

subparagraph.content: the amount of any specific provisions made by the institution for the underlying exposures of the transaction; and
if the underlying exposures of the transaction consist of purchased receivables—the amount of any non-refundable purchase price discounts on the receivables provided to the institution by the seller.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: collective provisions made in respect of the underlying exposures of a securitization transaction must not be included in any calculation under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if only the drawn portion of a revolving facility has been securitized—

subparagraph.content: only that portion is subject to the requirements under this Part; and
the risk-weighted amount of the undrawn portion of the facility must be calculated in accordance with Part 4, 5 or 6, as the case requires.

section.name: s237
section.heading: Treatment of refundable purchase price discount provided, and first-loss protection obtained, by authorized institution for purchased receivables

subsection.content: If an authorized institution has, as a seller of receivables, provided a refundable purchase price discount to the buyer of the receivables, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the discount in accordance with this Part as if it were a first-loss tranche of a securitization transaction.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution is a buyer of receivables and the seller of the receivables has provided a refundable purchase price discount to the institution in respect of the receivables, the institution may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat the discount as a first-loss protection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of its credit exposure to the receivables in accordance with this Part as if the credit exposure were a securitization exposure.

subsection.content: If any recognized collateral or recognized guarantee obtained by an authorized institution for its purchased receivables provides first-loss protection to the default risk or dilution risk, or both, in respect of the receivables, the institution may take into account the first-loss protection in the calculation of the risk-weighted amount of its credit exposure to the receivables in accordance with this Part as if the credit exposure were a securitization exposure.

section.name: s238
section.heading: Treatment of derivative contract for mitigating market risk in securitization transaction
section.leadIn: The risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction arising from a derivative contract used for mitigating market risk in the transaction must be inferred from—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if such a reference exposure does not exist—the next tranche in the transaction that is subordinated to the derivative contract.

section.name: s239
section.heading: Treatment of overlapping securitization exposures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has more than one securitization exposure to the same securitization transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution is able to verify that fulfilling its obligations with respect to a securitization exposure (exposure A) will preclude all or part of the institution’s losses on another securitization exposure (exposure B) under all circumstances.

subsection.content: The institution may, after determining the amount with which exposure A overlaps exposure B (overlapping portion), apply the treatments set out in subsection (3) instead of calculating the risk-weighted amount of each of the securitization exposures based on the full exposure amount of each of the securitization exposures.

subsection.leadIn: The treatments are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if both exposures are booked in the institution’s banking book—

subparagraph.content: calculating the risk-weighted amount of the overlapping portion in accordance with this Part by attributing it to exposure A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if one of the exposures is booked in the institution’s banking book (banking book exposure) and the other is booked in the trading book (trading book exposure)—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the institution is able to determine whether attributing the overlapping portion to the banking book exposure or to the trading book exposure will result in a higher regulatory capital for the overlapping portion—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: calculating the regulatory capital for the overlapping portion by attributing it to the exposure that will result in a higher regulatory capital for the overlapping portion; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: calculating the regulatory capital for the portion of each of the exposures that is not the overlapping portion in accordance with this Part or Part 8, as the case requires; or
if the institution is unable to so determine—calculating the regulatory capital for the exposures in accordance with both this Part and Part 8 as if there were no overlapping portion.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, subsection (3)(b) does not operate to exclude the following amounts from the calculation of market risk capital charge under Part 8— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the regulatory capital calculated under subsection (3)(b)(i)(A) for the overlapping portion that has been attributed to the trading book exposure of the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the regulatory capital calculated under subsection (3)(b)(i)(B) for that portion of the trading book exposure of the institution that is not the overlapping portion.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: regulatory capital (監管資本), in relation to a securitization exposure booked in the trading book or an overlapping portion that has been attributed to the exposure, means—(a)the SBM capital charge, RRAO and SA-DRC in relation to securitization exposures calculated by using the STM approach; or(b)the market risk capital charge for specific risk in relation to securitization exposures calculated by using the SSTM approach. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D4
division.heading: Floors and Caps on Capital Requirements for Securitization Exposures

section.name: s240
section.heading: Floors on risk-weights determined by using SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), if the risk-weight of a securitization exposure (other than a re-securitization exposure) determined by using the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA, as the case requires, is lower than 15%, a risk-weight of 15% must be assigned to the exposure.
Subject to subsection (4), if the risk-weight of a re-securitization exposure determined by using the SEC-SA is lower than 100%, a risk-weight of 100% must be assigned to the exposure.

The risk-weight determined for a rated securitization exposure by using the SEC-ERBA (after applying subsection (1) if applicable) must not be lower than the risk-weight determined by using the SEC-ERBA (after applying that subsection if applicable) for a senior tranche in the same securitization transaction with the same rating and maturity.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the next more senior tranche or securitization exposure in the same securitization transaction is rated,

subsection.continued: the risk-weight determined by using the SEC-SA (after applying subsection (1) if applicable) for the unrated securitization exposure is subject to a floor which is equal to the risk-weight determined by using the SEC-ERBA (after applying that subsection if applicable) for the rated tranche or securitization exposure.

section.name: s241
section.heading: Caps on risk-weights for exposures in senior tranches determined by using SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may apply the treatment set out in subsection (2) to a securitization exposure in a senior tranche (senior exposure) of a securitization transaction only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has the information on the composition of the underlying exposures of the transaction at all times so that it is able to determine the risk-weights of the underlying exposures in accordance with these Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the senior exposure is not a re-securitization exposure.

subsection.content: If the risk-weight of the senior exposure determined by using the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA (after applying section 240 if applicable) is higher than the weighted average risk-weight of the underlying exposures (risk-weight cap) calculated in accordance with subsection (3), (4), (5) or (6) (using the exposure amounts of the underlying exposures for weighting the risk-weights), the institution may allocate to the senior exposure a risk-weight equal to the risk-weight cap (regardless of whether the risk-weight cap is lower than 15% or not). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If the senior exposure is backed by an IRB pool, the risk-weight cap is calculated by using the following risk-weights—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risk-weights of the underlying exposures in the IRB pool determined under Part 6; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the expected loss (within the meaning of section 139(1)) of the underlying exposures in the IRB pool derived by multiplying the expected loss by 12.5.

subsection.content: If the senior exposure is backed by an SA pool, the risk-weight cap is calculated by using the risk-weights of the underlying exposures in the SA pool determined under Part 4.

subsection.leadIn: If the senior exposure is backed by a mixed pool and the institution is required under section 15 to use the SEC-IRBA to determine the risk-weight of the senior exposure, the risk-weight cap is calculated by using the following risk-weights—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the portion of the underlying exposures in the mixed pool for which the institution is able to calculate a KIRB in accordance with section 254(1)—the risk-weights of the underlying exposures calculated under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the portion of the underlying exposures in the mixed pool for which the institution is unable to calculate a KIRB in accordance with section 254(1)—the risk-weights of the underlying exposures determined under Part 4.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the senior exposure is backed by a mixed pool; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution is required under section 15 to use the SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight of the senior exposure,

subsection.continued: the risk-weight cap is calculated by using the risk-weights of the underlying exposures (including those that would be subject to the IRB approach if they were not securitized or if they were held by the institution) in the mixed pool determined under Part 4.

section.name: s242
section.heading: Maximum capital charge for all securitization exposures to securitization transaction

subsection.leadIn: The maximum capital charge calculated in accordance with this section does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securitization exposures held by an investing institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: re-securitization exposures.

subsection.content: If the total capital charge calculated by an originating institution of a securitization transaction under the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA (after applying sections 240 and 241, if applicable) for all its securitization exposures to the transaction is higher than the maximum capital charge calculated for the transaction under subsection (3), the institution may use the maximum capital charge so calculated as the total capital charge for the exposures in the calculation of its capital adequacy ratio.

subsection.leadIn: The maximum capital charge for a securitization transaction to which an originating institution has securitization exposures is calculated as the product of—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures.

subsection.content: If the securitization exposures are backed by an IRB pool and the risk-weights for the exposures are determined by using the SEC-IRBA, Kp is the KIRB calculated for the pool in accordance with section 254(1).

If the securitization exposures are backed by an SA pool and the risk-weights for the exposures are determined by using the SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA, Kp is the KSA calculated for the pool in accordance with section 275.

subsection.leadIn: If the securitization exposures are backed by a mixed pool and the risk-weights for the exposures are determined by using the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA, Kp is the weighted average of the following 2 ratios (using the exposure amounts of the underlying exposures as the weights)— (E.R. 1 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the KIRB calculated in accordance with section 254(1) for the portion of the pool for which the institution is able to calculate the KIRB; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the KSA calculated in accordance with section 275 for the portion of the pool for which the institution is unable to calculate the KIRB in accordance with section 254(1).

subsection.leadIn: An originating institution must determine P (expressed as a percentage) as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the institution has at least one securitization exposure in a single tranche of a securitization transaction—P is equal to the total nominal amount of its securitization exposures in the tranche divided by the nominal amount of the tranche; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution has securitization exposures in different tranches of a securitization transaction—the institution must calculate a P for each tranche in accordance with paragraph (a) and take the one with the largest value as the P for the purpose of calculating the maximum capital charge under subsection (3).

subsection.content: Despite the application of the maximum capital charge calculated under this section by an originating institution of a securitization transaction to its securitization exposures to the transaction, the entire amount of any gain-on-sale and other increase in the CET1 capital, and the entire amount of any credit-enhancing interest-only strips, arising from the transaction are subject to the deduction required under section 43.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Use of Credit Risk Mitigation for Securitization Exposures

section.name: s243
section.heading: Credit risk mitigation recognized for purpose of calculating the risk-weighted amounts of securitization exposures

subsection.content: An authorized institution may only take into account the credit risk mitigations specified in subsection (2) in calculating the risk-weighted amount of its securitization exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The credit risk mitigations are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the risk-weight of the securitization exposure is determined by using the SEC-IRBA—collateral, including collateral pledged by SPEs, that is recognized financial collateral or recognized IRB collateral as defined by section 139(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the risk-weight of the securitization exposure is determined by using the SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA—collateral, including collateral pledged by SPEs, that is recognized collateral as defined by section 51(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a guarantee provided by a person (other than an SPE) falling within section 99A(2)(a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) or (vii), or an entity (other than an SPE) specified in subsection (3), that meets the requirements set out in section 98(b), (c), (ca), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i) and (j); and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a credit derivative contract provided by a person (other than an SPE) falling within section 99A(2)(a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) or (vii), or an entity (other than an SPE) specified in subsection (3), that meets the requirements set out in section 99(1)(a) and (c) to (r) and, if applicable, section 99(2), (3) or (4). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: The entity is one that does not fall within any of section 99A(2)(a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) and (vii) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if it is not a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of any of the Type B ECAIs—

subparagraph.content: has an ECAI issuer rating that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the entity being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; and

had an ECAI issuer rating at the time the credit protection was given that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the entity being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if it is a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI (relevant Type B ECAI)—

subparagraph.content: has an ECAI issuer rating assigned by a Type A ECAI or the relevant Type B ECAI that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs or the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs, as the case requires, would result in the corporate being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; and

had an ECAI issuer rating assigned by a Type A ECAI or the relevant Type B ECAI at the time the credit protection was given that, if mapped to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs or the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs, as the case requires, would result in the corporate being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s244
section.heading: Treatment of Part 7 credit risk mitigation—full or proportional credit protection

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution obtains a Part 7 credit risk mitigation for its securitization exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the credit risk mitigation provides full or proportional credit protection against the exposure.

subsection.content: The institution may take into account the credit risk mitigation effect of the credit protection in calculating the risk-weighted amount of the exposure only if the effect is taken into account in accordance with subsection (3), (4), (5) or (6).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for all or part of its non-securitization exposures; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight of the securitization exposure is determined by using the SEC-IRBA,

subsection.continued: the credit risk mitigation effect of the credit protection must be taken into account by applying the treatments under the foundation IRB approach set out in Division 10 of Part 6.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for all or part of its non-securitization exposures; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight of the securitization exposure is determined by using the SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA,

subsection.continued: the credit risk mitigation effect of the credit protection must be taken into account by applying the treatments set out in Divisions 7, 9 and 10 of Part 4.

subsection.content: If the institution uses the STC approach to calculate its credit risk for all of its non-securitization exposures, the credit risk mitigation effect of the credit protection must be taken into account by using the same approaches that it uses for recognized credit risk mitigation obtained for non-securitization exposures under Part 4. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures, the credit risk mitigation effect of the credit protection must be taken into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for recognized collateral—by using the simple approach (within the meaning of section 51(1));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—in accordance with Part 4.

subsection.leadIn: In applying the treatment under subsection (3) in respect of any recognized collateral, the institution must, instead of taking into account the credit risk mitigating effect of the collateral through the determination of the LGD of the securitization exposure, take into account the effect by applying one of the 2 formulas set out in section 160(3) for calculating the unsecured portion of an exposure (EU), as applicable, with the following modifications—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the component E of that formula is to be taken to be a reference to the exposure amount of the securitization exposure determined in accordance with section 235 (after the adjustments set out in section 236(3) if applicable); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the EU calculated for the securitization exposure under that formula is to be taken as the exposure amount of the securitization exposure for the purposes of section 236(1). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s245
section.heading: Treatment of Part 7 credit risk mitigation—tranched credit protection

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution obtains a Part 7 credit risk mitigation for its securitization exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the credit risk mitigation provides tranched credit protection against the exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decompose the exposure into a protected sub-tranche and an unprotected sub-tranche; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the risk-weighted amount of each sub-tranche in accordance with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the risk-weighted amount of the protected sub-tranche by taking into account the credit risk mitigation effect of the tranched credit protection in accordance with section 244; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the risk-weighted amount of the unprotected sub-tranche by using the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA, as the case requires, and in accordance with sections 240, 241 and 249.

section.name: s246
section.heading: Treatment of maturity mismatch between securitization exposures and credit protection
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 244 and 245, if there is a maturity mismatch between the credit protection and the securitization exposure, section 231(2) applies to the exposure and the credit protection as it applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying exposures of a synthetic securitization transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the credit protection through which the credit risk of the underlying exposures is transferred under the transaction.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Determination of Certain Inputs Used in Risk-weighting Approach

section.name: s247
section.heading: Value of attachment point and value of detachment point of tranche in securitization transaction

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the value of the attachment point (AP) of a tranche in a securitization transaction (relevant tranche) is the greater of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the ratio (expressed in decimals) of the amount specified in subparagraph (i) to the amount specified in subparagraph (ii)—

subparagraph.content: the total outstanding amount of all the underlying exposures of the transaction minus the total outstanding amount of the relevant tranche and all other tranches in the transaction that are senior to, or rank equally with, the relevant tranche;
the total outstanding amount of all the underlying exposures of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: zero.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the value of the detachment point (DP) of a relevant tranche is the greater of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the ratio (expressed in decimals) of the amount specified in subparagraph (i) to the amount specified in subparagraph (ii)—

subparagraph.content: the total outstanding amount of all the underlying exposures of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: zero.

subsection.leadIn: In determining the AP or DP of a tranche in a securitization transaction—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the assets forming the loss-absorbing part of the funded reserve accounts must be included as underlying exposures of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any unfunded reserve accounts (including those to be funded by future receipts from underlying exposures) and any facilities, derivative contracts or assets that do not provide credit enhancement must not be included in the calculations of the AP and DP.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3), an authorized institution must take into account the economic substance of the securitization transaction so as to determine conservatively whether there are anything falling within the items that must or must not be included under subsection (3)(a), (b) or (c) in light of the structure of the transaction.

section.name: s248
section.heading: Tranche maturity of tranche in securitization transaction

subsection.content:
Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5), an authorized institution must calculate the tranche maturity of a tranche in a securitization transaction by using Formula 24 or 25.Formula 24Tranche Maturity Based on Contractual Cash Flows
where—
(a)MT is the tranche maturity of the tranche; and
(b)CFt is the cash flows (including principal, interest payments and fees) contractually payable under the tranche by the issuer in the securitization transaction in period t.

content.crossHeading: Tranche Maturity Based on Final Legal Maturity

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: MT is the tranche maturity of the tranche; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ML is the final legal maturity of the tranche.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must use Formula 25 to calculate the tranche maturity of a tranche in a securitization transaction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the contractual payments under the tranche—

subparagraph.content: are not unconditional; or
depend on the actual performance of the underlying exposures of the transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the dates on which the contractual payments under the tranche will be paid are unknown or uncertain.

subsection.content: However, if the securitization exposure to the transaction is an off-balance sheet exposure or the securitization exposure arises from an instrument where the risk of the securitization exposure is not limited to the losses realized until the maturity of the instrument, the tranche maturity of the securitization exposure is the maximum period of time (which may be longer than the contractual maturity of the exposure) the institution is exposed to the potential losses from the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: If the exposure mentioned in subsection (3) arises from a commitment provided by the institution to the transaction, the tranche maturity of the exposure must be calculated as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contractual maturity of the commitment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either of the following—

subparagraph.content: for underlying exposures in the pool that are not revolving in nature—the longest maturity of the underlying exposures in the pool to which the institution would be exposed after a draw of the commitment has occurred;

for underlying exposures in the pool that are revolving in nature—the longest contractually possible remaining maturity of assets that might be added to the pool in future during the revolving period of the securitization transaction.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a securitization exposure of an authorized institution arises from—

subparagraph.content: a credit protection provided by the institution to a securitization exposure or securitization transaction; or
a tranched credit protection provided by the institution to a non-securitization exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution is only exposed to losses that occur up to the maturity of the credit protection,

subsection.continued: the institution may use the contractual maturity of the credit protection as the tranche maturity of the exposure and does not need to comply with subsections (3) and (4).

subsection.content: The tranche maturity is measured in years and subject to a floor of 1 year and a cap of 5 years.

section.name: s249
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to sections 236 and 245 in relation to tranched credit protection

subsection.content: This section applies to an authorized institution that uses the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA or SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight of the protected sub-tranche or unprotected sub-tranche of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction (original exposure) covered by tranched credit protection obtained or provided by the institution.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the SEC-IRBA or SEC-SA to determine the risk-weights of the sub-tranches, it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculate the AP and DP separately for each sub-tranche as if the sub-tranche were directly issued as a separate tranche under the transaction at its inception; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculate the KIRB in accordance with section 254 (in the case of the SEC-IRBA) or the KSA in accordance with section 275 (in the case of the SEC-SA), based on the entire pool of the underlying exposures of the transaction for the purpose of determining the risk-weights of the sub-tranches.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the SEC-ERBA to determine the risk-weights of the sub-tranches, it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allocate the risk-weight of the original exposure determined by using the SEC-ERBA to the sub-tranche that has the highest priority of repayment among the sub-tranches; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a sub-tranche of lower priority of repayment—

subparagraph.leadIn: determine the risk-weight of the sub-tranche by using the SEC-ERBA by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: regarding the ECAI issue specific rating, the inferred rating or the internal credit rating of a tranche in the same securitization transaction that is subordinated to the tranche within which the original exposure falls as if the rating were that of the sub-tranche; and (L.N. 222 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: using the tranche thickness for the sub-tranche calculated by subtracting AP of the sub-tranche from the DP of the sub-tranche, where the AP and the DP are calculated separately for the sub-tranche as if the sub-tranche were directly issued as a separate tranche under the transaction at its inception; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if there is no rated subordinated tranche available for applying the treatment set out in subparagraph (i), determine the risk-weight of the sub-tranche as the greater of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the risk-weight of the sub-tranche determined by using the SEC-SA, based on the AP and DP calculated separately for the sub-tranche as if the sub-tranche were directly issued as a separate tranche under the transaction at its inception; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the risk-weight of the original exposure determined by using the SEC-ERBA without taking into account any credit protection afforded to the original exposure.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), a sub-tranche of lower priority of repayment must be treated as a non-senior tranche regardless of whether the original exposure, prior to any credit protection, is an exposure in a senior tranche or not.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Risk-weighting Requirements under SEC-IRBA

section.name: s250
section.heading: Application of Division 7
section.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that is required to use the SEC-IRBA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction under section 15.

section.name: s251
section.heading: Determination of risk-weights of securitization exposures

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), an authorized institution must determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure in a tranche of a securitization transaction (relevant tranche) in accordance with subsection (2), (3) or (4).

If the DP of the relevant tranche is less than or equal to the KIRB calculated in accordance with section 254 for the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction (relevant KIRB value), the institution must allocate a risk-weight of 1,250% to the exposure. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the AP of the relevant tranche is less than the relevant KIRB value; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the DP of the relevant tranche is greater than the relevant KIRB value,

subsection.continued: the institution must determine the risk-weight (expressed in decimals) of the exposure by using Formula 26.

subsection.crossHeading: Risk-weight Formula when DP > KIRB > AP

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: RW is the risk-weight of the exposure;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: KIRB is the relevant KIRB value; and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: KSSFA(KIRB) is the capital charge per unit of securitization exposure calculated in accordance with section 253 for the relevant tranche.

subsection.content: If the AP of the relevant tranche is greater than or equal to the relevant KIRB value, the institution must determine the risk-weight (expressed in decimals) of the exposure by using Formula 27.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: RW is the risk-weight of the exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: KSSFA(KIRB) is the capital charge per unit of securitization exposure calculated in accordance with section 253 for the relevant tranche.

subsection.content: If the underlying exposures of the transaction consist of purchased receivables, the dilution risk in respect of the receivables must be taken into account in accordance with section 252 in the determination of the risk-weight of the securitization exposure unless the institution has assessed prudently that the dilution risk faced by it in respect of the receivables is immaterial.

section.name: s252
section.heading: Treatment of dilution risk of underlying exposures for purposes of section 251

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 251, if the underlying exposures of a securitization transaction consist of purchased receivables—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a separate KIRB must be calculated for the dilution risk (KIRB(dilution)) of the receivables in accordance with section 254(1) and Divisions 9 and 10 of Part 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a separate KIRB must be calculated for the default risk (KIRB(default)) of the receivables in accordance with section 254(1) and Divisions 9 and 10 of Part 6.

subsection.content: If the default risk and dilution risk of the purchased receivables are treated in an aggregate manner within the transaction such that losses from both risks are covered by the same credit enhancement or credit protection, the authorized institution concerned must calculate the KIRB of the purchased receivables covering both risks by adding together the 2 figures obtained under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If the credit enhancement or credit protection within the transaction is only available to cover losses from either the default risk or the dilution risk of the purchased receivables but not both, the authorized institution concerned must, for the purposes of determining the AP, DP and tranche maturity of the tranche in respect of each of the 2 risks and whether a KIRB(dilution) or KIRB(default) or both is to be used in calculating the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to the transaction—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: make conservative assumptions about the extent to which the securitization exposure would benefit from the credit enhancement or credit protection.

section.name: s253
section.heading: Capital charge per unit of securitization exposure under SEC-IRBA
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the capital charge per unit of securitization exposure for a tranche of a securitization transaction (relevant tranche) by using Formula 27A.
section.crossHeading: Capital Charge per Unit of Securitization Exposure under SEC-IRBA

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: u = DP – KIRB;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: l = max (AP – KIRB; 0);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: e is a constant that is the base of the natural logarithm; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: KIRB is the KIRB calculated in accordance with section 254 (and section 252 if applicable) for the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction.

section.name: s254
section.heading: Calculation of KIRB for underlying exposures

subsection.leadIn: If the pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction (including assets or exposures that are treated as the underlying exposures of the transaction under section 256 or 257) is an IRB pool, the KIRB (expressed in decimals) of the pool is the ratio of the amount specified in paragraph (a) to the amount specified in paragraph (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the IRB capital charge calculated for the underlying exposures in the pool in accordance with section 255;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in the pool.

subsection.content: If the pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction (including assets or exposures that are treated as the underlying exposures of the transaction under section 256 or 257) is a mixed pool, the KIRB of the pool must be calculated by using Formula 27B.

content.crossHeading: Calculation of KIRB of Mixed Pool

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: d is the percentage of the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in the pool for which the authorized institution concerned is able to calculate a KIRB in accordance with subsection (1) over the total exposure amount of all the underlying exposures in the pool;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
K IRB (subpool 1)
is the KIRB calculated in accordance with subsection (1) for those underlying exposures in the pool for which the institution is able to so calculate a KIRB; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content:
K SA (subpool 2)
is the KSA calculated in accordance with section 275 for those underlying exposures in the pool for which the institution is unable to calculate a KIRB in accordance with subsection (1).

section.name: s255
section.heading: Calculation of IRB capital charge for underlying exposures in IRB pool

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and sections 256, 257, 258 and 259, the IRB capital charge for the underlying exposures (including defaulted underlying exposures) in an IRB pool is calculated as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the product of—

subparagraph.content: the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures calculated in accordance with Part 6 (as if the underlying exposures were held directly by the authorized institution concerned if they are not held by the institution); and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the EL amount of the underlying exposures calculated in accordance with Part 6.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution may take into account the credit risk mitigation effect of any Part 6 credit risk mitigation afforded to individual underlying exposures, or to the entire pool of the underlying exposures, in the manner set out in Part 6.

section.name: s256
section.heading: Specific requirements applicable to calculation of KIRB—SPE’s exposure

subsection.content: If a securitization transaction involves an SPE, all exposures incurred by the SPE (SPE’s exposure) in respect of the transaction (including assets in which the SPE may have invested a reserve account or cash collateral account, and claims on counterparties resulting from derivative contracts entered into by the SPE with the counterparties) must be treated as underlying exposures of the transaction in calculating the KIRB in accordance with section 254(1).

subsection.leadIn: However, the authorized institution concerned is not required to comply with subsection (1) in respect of an SPE’s exposure if the institution has assessed prudently that the risk of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is immaterial; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not have any adverse effect on the securitization exposure concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If the SPE’s exposure arises from a derivative contract other than a credit derivative contract, in calculating the IRB capital charge for the underlying exposures in the pool concerned in accordance with section 255, the risk-weighted amount of the SPE’s exposure is the product of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the current exposure of the derivative contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight of the counterparty concerned determined in accordance with Part 6.

section.name: s257
section.heading: Specific requirements applicable to calculation of KIRB—collateral for funded synthetic securitization transaction

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the calculation of the KIRB in accordance with section 254(1) for a pool of underlying exposures of a funded synthetic securitization transaction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assets are held under the transaction as collateral for the repayment of the securitization exposure concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the default risk of the collateral is subject to tranched loss allocation.

subsection.leadIn: The authorized institution concerned must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat the collateral as an underlying exposure of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include the risk-weighted amount of the collateral (calculated as the product of the exposure amount of the collateral and its risk-weight determined in accordance with Part 6 or this Part) in the calculation of the IRB capital charge for the underlying exposures in the pool under section 255.

subsection.content: However, the institution is not required to comply with subsection (2) if it has assessed prudently that the exposure amount of the collateral or the default risk of the collateral is immaterial.

section.name: s258
section.heading: Further provisions to sections 256 and 257

subsection.content: A derivative contract or collateral that has been included in the calculation of the IRB capital charge for the underlying exposures in a pool under section 256(3) or 257(2) must not be included in the calculation of the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in the pool under section 254(1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The KIRB of the pool of underlying exposures (including those exposures referred to in section 256(1) or 257(2)) must be calculated by using the exposure amounts of those underlying exposures without deducting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any specific provisions or partial write-offs made for such exposures; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any non-refundable purchase price discounts on such exposures.

section.name: s259
section.heading: Treatment of default risk of underlying exposures in calculation of KIRB

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an authorized institution may calculate the risk-weighted amount for default risk in respect of underlying exposures (regardless of whether they are purchased receivables or not) for the purposes of section 255(1)(a)(i) by using the top-down approach referred to in section 198(3) in accordance with the provisions in Divisions 9 and 10 of Part 6 that are applicable to the approach if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying exposures fall or would fall within the IRB class of retail exposures under the IRB approach;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution is unable to use internal data as the primary source of information for estimating the risk characteristics for the underlying exposures under section 177(2)(a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other requirements under Part 6 (except section 177(2)(b)) and Schedule 2 applicable to the IRB class of retail exposures are met by the institution in respect of the underlying exposures.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the top-down approach under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: references to “purchased receivables”, “retail receivables” or “receivables” in the provisions in Divisions 9 and 10 of Part 6 that are applicable to the top-down approach are to be construed as references to the underlying exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution may use external data to estimate the PD and LGD of the underlying exposures provided that the institution has verified in a prudent manner that—

subparagraph.content: there is a strong link between the institution’s process of grouping the underlying exposures into portfolios under section 200(a) and the classification process used by the external data source; and
there is a strong link between the credit risk profile of the underlying exposures and the composition of the external data.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution is regarded as having met the requirement of section 200(d) if it meets the requirement through a party to the securitization transaction concerned acting for and in the interest of the investors in the transaction in accordance with the terms of the related securitization documents; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the paragraphs referred to in section 200(d)— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: references to “a bank purchasing receivables” or “the bank” are to be construed as references to the institution, except in paragraph CRE36.118(1) where the references are to be construed as references to the securitization transaction concerned; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)
references to “purchased receivables”, “receivables” or “receivable” are to be construed as references to the underlying exposures concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any of the requirements referred to in subsection (1)(c) is not met in respect of any of the underlying exposures; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution uses external data to estimate the PD and LGD but has not verified in a prudent manner the matter mentioned in subsection (2)(b)(i) or (ii),

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may give a notice in writing specified in subsection (5) to the institution.

subsection.leadIn: The notice may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: require the institution to use the SEC-ERBA, SEC-SA or SEC-FBA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure backed by the underlying exposures.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subsection (4).

section.name: s260
section.heading: Calculation of p-parameter

subsection.content: The p-parameter for a tranche in a securitization transaction is calculated by using Formula 27C.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: p is the p-parameter for the tranche;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: N is the effective number of underlying exposures of the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction calculated in accordance with section 261 or 263;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
f
paragraph.content: A, B, C, D, and E are values determined in accordance with Part 1 or 2 of Table 24 based on whether the tranche is a senior tranche or a non-senior tranche, the type of underlying exposures and the value of N.
