subsection.leadIn: In Table 24—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: retail exposures (零售風險承擔) mean underlying exposures that would fall within the IRB class of retail exposures under the IRB approach if they were not securitized; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wholesale exposures (批發風險承擔) mean underlying exposures that are not retail exposures.

subsection.leadIn: For a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction that consists of both retail exposures and wholesale exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the pool is an IRB pool, an authorized institution must—

subparagraph.content: divide the pool into 2 sub-pools, one comprising retail exposures and the other comprising wholesale exposures;
calculate separate p-parameters for the 2 sub-pools by using Formula 27C; and
then calculate the p-parameter for the tranche concerned as the weighted average of the 2 separate p-parameters using the nominal amount of the underlying exposures in each sub-pool as the weight; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the pool is a mixed pool, an authorized institution must calculate the p-parameter for the tranche concerned based only on the underlying exposures in the pool for which the institution is able to calculate a KIRB in accordance with section 254(1).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, in calculating the p-parameter for a sub-pool by using Formula 27C under subsection (3)(a)(ii), the N, KIRB and LGDSEC in that Formula must be calculated based only on the underlying exposures in the sub-pool.

section.name: s261
section.heading: Effective number of underlying exposures
section.content:
The effective number of underlying exposures of a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction is calculated by using Formula 27D.Formula 27DEffective Number of Underlying Exposures
where—
(a)N is the effective number of underlying exposures of the pool; and
(b)EADi is the EAD associated with the ith obligor in the pool determined by regarding all the underlying exposures to the ith obligor as one single exposure.

section.name: s262
section.heading: Exposure-weighted average LGD

subsection.content: The exposure-weighted average LGD of a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction is calculated by using Formula 27E.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: LGDSEC is the exposure-weighted average LGD of the pool;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: LGDi is the average LGD associated with all the underlying exposures to the ith obligor in the pool; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: EADi is the EAD associated with the ith obligor in the pool determined by regarding all the underlying exposures to the ith obligor as one single exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying exposures of a securitization transaction to the ith obligor are purchased receivables whose default risk and dilution risk are treated in an aggregate manner as described in section 252(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the SEC-IRBA is used to determine the risk-weight of the purchased receivables covered by the first-loss protection mentioned in section 237(3), and both default risk and dilution risk of the receivables are covered by the same recognized collateral or recognized guarantee,

subsection.continued: the LGDi in Formula 27E must be calculated as the weighted average of the LGD for the default risk of the ith obligor and the 100% LGD for the dilution risk in respect of the receivables.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the LGD for default risk must be weighted by using the IRB capital charge calculated for the default risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the LGD for dilution risk must be weighted by using the IRB capital charge calculated for the dilution risk.

section.name: s263
section.heading: Simplified method for calculating N and LGDSEC

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: C1, in relation to a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction, is the ratio of the amount specified in subparagraph (i) to the amount specified in subparagraph (ii)—

subparagraph.content: the nominal amount of the largest underlying exposure in the pool;
the total nominal amount of all the underlying exposures in the pool; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Cm, in relation to a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction, is the ratio of the amount specified in subparagraph (i) to the amount specified in subparagraph (ii)—

subparagraph.content: the total nominal amount of all the underlying exposures in the pool.

subsection.leadIn: If C1 calculated for a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction is not more than 0.03, the authorized institution concerned may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: instead of using Formula 27D to calculate the effective number of underlying exposures (N) of the pool—

subsection.crossHeading: Calculation of N when C1 and Cm are Known

subparagraph.content: if only C1 is known to the institution—calculate N as 1/C1.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Risk-weighting Requirements under SEC-ERBA

section.name: s264
section.heading: Application of Division 8
section.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that is required to use the SEC-ERBA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction under section 15.

section.name: s265
section.heading: Determination of risk-weights of securitization exposures with long-term ratings

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure that has a long-term ECAI issue specific rating or a long-term inferred rating by applying the following steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: map the rating of the exposure to a credit quality grade in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for securitization exposures; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: allocate to the exposure the risk-weight determined in accordance with subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.content: If the exposure is in a senior tranche, the risk-weight of the exposure is the one determined under subsection (1)(c).
If the exposure is in a non-senior tranche, the risk-weight of the exposure is the one calculated by using Formula 27G.

subsection.leadIn: RW = (RWLT) · [1–min(T;50%)]

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: RW is the risk-weight of the exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: RWLT is the risk-weight determined under subsection (1)(c); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: T is the tranche thickness of the tranche, which is equal to the DP of the tranche minus the AP of the tranche.

subsection.content: If the exposure is in a tranche with a tranche maturity of 1 year or 5 years, the institution must determine the risk-weight in accordance with Table 25 based on the credit quality grade, tranche maturity and seniority of the exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If the exposure is in a tranche with a tranche maturity of neither 1 year nor 5 years, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the risk-weights for a tranche maturity of 1 year and a tranche maturity of 5 years that are corresponding to the credit quality grade and the seniority of the exposure in accordance with subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weight applicable to the tranche maturity of the exposure by using linear interpolation between the 2 risk-weights determined under paragraph (a).

section.name: s266
section.heading: Determination of risk-weights of securitization exposures with short-term ratings
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure that has a short-term ECAI issue specific rating or a short-term inferred rating by applying the following steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: map the rating of the exposure to a credit quality grade in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for securitization exposures; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allocate a risk-weight to the exposure in accordance with Table 26 based on the grade so mapped.

section.name: s266A
section.heading: Internal assessment approach: determination of risk-weights of eligible ABCP exposures with internal credit ratings

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution having an IAA approval must, in determining the risk-weight of an eligible ABCP exposure by using the SEC-ERBA based on the internal credit rating of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: map the internal credit rating to an equivalent long-term ECAI issue specific rating or an equivalent short-term ECAI issue specific rating, as the case requires; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: treat the long-term ECAI issue specific rating or short-term ECAI issue specific rating so obtained as that of the exposure and, on that basis, determine the risk-weight of the exposure in accordance with section 265 or 266, as the case requires.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), an internal credit rating and an ECAI issue specific rating are considered to be equivalent to each other if both of them represent broadly the same credit characteristics and creditworthiness.

section.name: s267
section.heading: Use of ECAI issue specific ratings or internal credit ratings for determination of risk-weights

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must, in using an ECAI issue specific rating issued by an ECAI for the purposes of determining the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ensure that it has nominated the ECAI for the purposes of this Part in accordance with section 4C; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if 2 or more ECAIs have different ECAI issue specific ratings applicable to the exposure—determine the rating applicable to the exposure in the manner set out in section 54E(2)(b) and (c). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If credit protection is provided to specific underlying exposures, or the entire pool of underlying exposures, of a securitization transaction and the credit protection has been reflected in the ECAI issue specific rating or the internal credit rating assigned to a securitization exposure to the transaction— (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for credit protection provided by a credit protection provider falling within section 99A(2)(a), the institution— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.content: must determine the risk-weight of the exposure by reference to that rating; and
must not include the credit risk mitigation effect of that credit protection in any other calculations under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for credit protection not provided by a credit protection provider falling within section 99A(2)(a)—the institution must treat the exposure as unrated for the purposes of this Part. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If Part 7 credit risk mitigation is provided to protect only a specific securitization exposure within a given structure or tranche of a securitization transaction and has been reflected in the ECAI issue specific rating or the internal credit rating assigned to the exposure, the institution must— (L.N. 222 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regard the exposure as unrated for the purposes of this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take into account the credit risk mitigation effect of the Part 7 credit risk mitigation in accordance with Division 5.

subsection.content: If an ECAI issue specific rating or an internal credit rating assigned to a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction is wholly or partly based on unfunded support (including a liquidity facility or credit enhancement) provided by the institution to the transaction, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of the exposure in accordance with this Part as if it were unrated. (L.N. 222 of 2018)

To avoid doubt, an authorized institution falling within subsection (4) must continue to hold regulatory capital for its other securitization exposures (including the unfunded support) to the transaction.

section.name: s268
section.heading: Inferred ratings
section.leadIn: An authorized institution may use the credit assessment rating attributed by it to a securitization exposure (principal exposure) by making reference to another securitization exposure that has an ECAI issue specific rating (reference exposure) to risk-weight the principal exposure only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the principal exposure has no applicable ECAI issue specific rating;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference exposure, in all respects, ranks equally with, or is subordinated to, the principal exposure, after taking into account credit enhancements, if any, in the assessment of the relative subordination of the principal exposure and the reference exposure;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the maturity of the reference exposure is not shorter than that of the principal exposure;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the reference exposure has not ceased to exist;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the ECAI issuing the ECAI issue specific rating of the reference exposure has been nominated for the purposes of this Part in accordance with section 4C and, if applicable, the rating is determined in compliance with section 267(1)(b); and (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the reference exposure is not required to be treated as an unrated securitization exposure under section 267(2), (3) or (4).

division.name: D9
division.heading: Risk-weighting Requirements under SEC-SA

section.name: s269
section.heading: Application of Division 9
section.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that is required to use the SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction under section 15.

section.name: s270
section.heading: Determination of risk-weights of securitization exposures

subsection.content: If, for a securitization transaction, the total nominal amount of the underlying exposures whose delinquency status is unknown to an authorized institution is equal to or less than 5% of the total nominal amount of the entire pool of underlying exposures, the institution must determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to the transaction in accordance with section 271.

If, for a securitization transaction, the total nominal amount of the underlying exposures whose delinquency status is unknown to an authorized institution exceeds 5% of the total nominal amount of the entire pool of underlying exposures, the institution must allocate a risk-weight of 1 250% to a securitization exposure to the transaction.

section.name: s271
section.heading: Risk-weights of securitization exposures falling within section 270(1)

subsection.content: The risk-weight of a securitization exposure in a tranche of a securitization transaction falling within section 270(1) (relevant tranche) must be determined in accordance with this section.

If the DP of the relevant tranche is less than or equal to the KA calculated in accordance with section 273 for the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction (relevant KA value), the institution must assign a risk-weight of 1,250% to the exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the AP of the relevant tranche is less than the relevant KA value; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the DP of the relevant tranche is greater than the relevant KA value,

subsection.continued: the institution must determine the risk-weight (expressed in decimals) of the exposure by using Formula 27H.

section.name: s272
section.heading: Capital charge per unit of securitization exposure under SEC-SA
section.content: An authorized institution must calculate the capital charge per unit of securitization exposure for a tranche of a securitization transaction (relevant tranche) by using Formula 27J.

paragraph.leadIn: a = –(1/(p · KA)), where p is equal to—

subparagraph.content: 1 if the securitization exposures in the tranche are not re-securitization exposures; or
1.5 if the securitization exposures in the tranche are re-securitization exposures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: u = DP – KA;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: l = max (AP – KA; 0);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: e is a constant that is the base of the natural logarithm; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: KA is the capital charge factor for the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction calculated in accordance with section 273.

section.name: s273
section.heading: Calculation of capital charge factor for underlying exposures

subsection.content: If an authorized institution knows the delinquency status for the entire pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction, the institution must calculate the capital charge factor for the pool by using Formula 27K.

content.crossHeading: KA when Delinquency Status for all of Total Nominal Amount of Pool of Underlying Exposures is Known

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: KA is the capital charge factor for the pool;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: W is the delinquency ratio of the pool.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution does not know the delinquency status for the entire pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction, but the total nominal amount of the underlying exposures whose delinquency status is unknown to the institution is equal to or less than 5% of the total nominal amount of the pool, the institution must determine the capital charge factor for the pool by applying the following steps— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: divide the entire pool into 2 subpools so that—

subparagraph.content: subpool 1 comprises underlying exposures of which the delinquency status is known; and
subpool 2 comprises underlying exposures of which the delinquency status is unknown; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculate the capital charge factor for the entire pool by using Formula 27L.

subsection.crossHeading: KA when 5% or less (but not 0%) of Total Nominal Amount of Pool of Underlying Exposures whose Delinquency Status is Unknown

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: KA is the capital charge factor for the pool;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: EADSubpool 1 is the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in subpool 1;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: EADSubpool 2 is the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in subpool 2;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content:
K A Subpool 1
is the capital charge factor calculated in accordance with subsection (1) for subpool 1.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: delinquency ratio (拖欠比率)—(a)in relation to a pool of underlying exposures that are non-securitization exposures, means the ratio of the amount specified in subparagraph (i) to the amount specified in subparagraph (ii)—(i)the total nominal amount of delinquent underlying exposures in the pool;(ii)the total nominal amount of all the underlying exposures in the pool; or(b)in relation to a pool of underlying exposures that are securitization exposures, is zero;

delinquent underlying exposure (拖欠組成項目) means an underlying exposure that is—(a)90 days or more past due;(b)subject to bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings;(c)in the process of foreclosure;(d)held as real estate owned; or(e)in default as defined in the documents of the securitization transaction concerned.

section.name: s274
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 273
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 273, if the underlying exposures of a securitization transaction consist of both non-securitization exposures and securitization exposures, an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: determine the capital charge factor for each of the subsets in accordance with section 273, using the delinquency ratio (within the meaning of section 273(3)) determined for the underlying exposures in each subset; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determine the capital charge factor for the entire pool of the underlying exposures as the weighted-average of the 2 capital charge factors calculated under paragraph (b), using the nominal amount of the underlying exposures in each subset as the weight.

section.name: s275
section.heading: Calculation of KSA for underlying exposures
section.leadIn: The KSA (expressed in decimals) of a pool of underlying exposures of a securitization transaction (including assets or exposures that are treated as the underlying exposures of the transaction under section 277 or 278) is the ratio of the amount specified in paragraph (a) to the amount specified in paragraph (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the SA capital charge calculated for the underlying exposures in the pool in accordance with section 276;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in the pool.

section.name: s276
section.heading: Calculation of SA capital charge for underlying exposures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 277, 278 and 279, the SA capital charge for the underlying exposures in a pool is calculated as the product of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the risk-weighted amount of the underlying exposures calculated—

subparagraph.content: in accordance with Part 4 (for underlying exposures that are non-securitization exposures); or
in accordance with this Part (for underlying exposures that are securitization exposures),

paragraph.continued: as if the underlying exposures were held directly by the authorized institution concerned if they are not held by the institution; and

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution may take into account the credit risk mitigation effect of any Part 4 credit risk mitigation or Part 7 credit risk mitigation afforded to individual underlying exposures, or to the entire pool of the underlying exposures, in the manner set out in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part 4 (for Part 4 credit risk mitigation afforded to underlying exposures that are non-securitization exposures); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this Part (for Part 7 credit risk mitigation afforded to underlying exposures that are securitization exposures).

section.name: s277
section.heading: Specific requirements applicable to calculation of KSA—SPE’s exposure

subsection.content: If a securitization transaction involves an SPE, all exposures incurred by the SPE (SPE’s exposure) in respect of the transaction (including assets in which the SPE may have invested a reserve account or cash collateral account, and claims on counterparties resulting from derivative contracts entered into by the SPE with the counterparties) must be treated as underlying exposures of the transaction in calculating the KSA in accordance with section 275.

subsection.leadIn: However, the authorized institution concerned is not required to comply with subsection (1) in respect of an SPE’s exposure if the institution has assessed prudently that the risk of the exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is immaterial; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not have any adverse effect on the securitization exposure concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If the SPE’s exposure arises from a derivative contract other than a credit derivative contract, in calculating the SA capital charge for the underlying exposures in the pool concerned in accordance with section 276, the risk-weighted amount of the SPE’s exposure is the product of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the current exposure of the derivative contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight of the counterparty concerned determined in accordance with Part 4.

section.name: s278
section.heading: Specific requirements applicable to calculation of KSA—collateral for funded synthetic securitization transaction

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the calculation of the KSA in accordance with section 275 for a pool of underlying exposures of a funded synthetic securitization transaction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assets are held under the transaction as collateral for the repayment of the securitization exposure concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the default risk of the collateral is subject to tranched loss allocation.

subsection.leadIn: The authorized institution concerned must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat the collateral as an underlying exposure of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include the risk-weighted amount of the collateral (calculated as the product of the exposure amount of the collateral and its risk-weight determined in accordance with Part 4 or this Part) in the calculation of the SA capital charge for the underlying exposures in the pool under section 276.

subsection.content: However, the institution is not required to comply with subsection (2) if it has assessed prudently that the exposure amount of the collateral or the default risk of the collateral is immaterial.

section.name: s279
section.heading: Further provisions to sections 277 and 278

subsection.content: A derivative contract or collateral that has been included in the calculation of the SA capital charge for the underlying exposures in a pool under section 277(3) or 278(2) must not be included in the calculation of the total exposure amount of the underlying exposures in the pool under section 275(b).

subsection.leadIn: The KSA of the pool of underlying exposures (including those exposures referred to in section 277(1) or 278(2)) must be calculated by using the exposure amounts of those underlying exposures without deducting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any specific provisions or partial write-offs made for the exposures; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any non-refundable purchase price discounts on the exposures.

division.name: D10
division.heading: Risk-weighting Requirements under SEC-FBA

section.name: s280
section.heading: Application of Division 10
section.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that is required to use the SEC-FBA to determine the risk-weight of a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction under section 15.

section.name: s280A
section.heading: Risk-weights of securitization exposures
section.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight of 1,250% to a securitization exposure to a securitization transaction.

division.name: D11
division.heading: Non-performing Loan Securitization Transactions

section.name: s280B
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 11

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: non-performing loan securitization transaction (不履約貸款證券化交易)—(a)means a traditional securitization transaction where its pool of underlying exposures—(i)has a delinquency ratio (within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of delinquency ratio in section 273(3)) equal to or higher than 90%—(A)at the origination cut-off date; and(B)at any subsequent date on which assets are added to or removed from the pool due to replenishment, restructuring or any other relevant reason;(ii)only comprises—(A)loans;(B)loan-equivalent financial instruments, such as bonds not listed on a trading venue; or(C)tradable instruments used for the sole purpose of loan sub-participation in relation to securitization of assets; and(iii)does not contain any securitization exposures; and(b)does not include a transaction specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2);
NPL securitization exposure (NPL證券化類別風險承擔) means a securitization exposure to an NPL securitization transaction;
NPL securitization transaction (NPL證券化交易) means a non-performing loan securitization transaction.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to a locally incorporated authorized institution, specify that a securitization transaction originated by the institution is not an NPL securitization transaction, if the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the transaction was executed with the sole or main purpose of regulatory capital arbitrage (within the meaning of section 4).
An authorized institution must comply with a notice given to it under subsection (2).

section.name: s280C
section.heading: Capital treatment of NPL securitization exposures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: calculate the risk-weighted amount of the NPL securitization exposure in accordance with Divisions 1 to 10, subject to the requirements set out in sections 280D and 280E.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution would use the foundation IRB approach to calculate the capital charge of the underlying exposures of the NPL securitization transaction concerned if the underlying exposures were held by the institution directly, the institution must not use the SEC-IRBA to determine the risk-weight of the NPL securitization exposure.

section.name: s280D
section.heading: Risk-weights of NPL securitization exposures under SEC-IRBA and SEC-SA

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), if according to section 280C an authorized institution must use the SEC-IRBA or the SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight of an NPL securitization exposure, the institution must allocate to the NPL securitization exposure a risk-weight that is the higher of the following—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk-weight applicable to the NPL securitization exposure determined under the SEC-IRBA, the SEC-SA or section 241, as the case requires.

subsection.leadIn: Where according to section 280C an authorized institution must use the SEC-IRBA or the SEC-SA to determine the risk-weight of an NPL securitization exposure to an NPL securitization transaction, the institution may allocate a risk-weight of 100% to the senior tranche of the transaction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transaction is a traditional securitization transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sum of the non-refundable purchase price discounts is equal to or higher than 50% of the outstanding balance of the pool of underlying exposures of the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), non-refundable purchase price discount (NRPPD), in relation to an NPL securitization transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), is the amount arrived at by subtracting the amount referred to in subparagraph (ii) from the amount referred to in subparagraph (i)—

subparagraph.content: the price at which those exposures were sold by the originator to the SPE; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include any amount that is refundable to either the originator or the original lender.

subsection.leadIn: If an originator underwrites tranches of an NPL securitization transaction for subsequent sale, the NRPPD may include the differences between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nominal amount of the tranches; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the price at which the tranches are first sold by the originator to unrelated third parties.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, in the determination of NRPPD, for any given piece of a securitization tranche—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: only its initial sale from the originator to investors is taken into account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purchase prices of subsequent resales are not considered.

section.name: s280E
section.heading: Caps on capital requirements for NPL securitization exposures
section.content: If an authorized institution is the originator of an NPL securitization transaction, the institution may apply the cap specified in section 242 to the aggregated capital requirement for its NPL securitization exposures to the NPL securitization transaction.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge

division.name: D1
division.heading: General

section.name: s281
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 8 and Schedule 3
section.leadIn: In this Part and Schedule 3— (L.N. 167 of 2023)
section.def: commodity-related derivative contract (商品關聯衍生工具合約) means a futures contract, forward contract, swap contract, option contract or similar derivative contract the value of which is determined by reference to the value of, or any fluctuation in the value of, an underlying commodity or an underlying commodity index (being an index calculated by reference to a basket of commodities);
conversion factor (換算因數) means a number published by a futures exchange for determining the price for each debt security deliverable against a bond futures contract;

def.name: CorrelationTradingPortfolio
def.leadIn: correlation trading portfolio (相關交易組合), in relation to an authorized institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a portfolio of securitization exposures or nth-to-default credit derivative contracts, or both—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: that are not—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: re-securitization exposures; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: derivatives of securitization exposures that do not provide a pro-rata share in the proceeds of a securitization tranche;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where the underlying exposures of the securitization exposures, or the reference obligations of the nth-to-default credit derivative contracts, are not—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a regulatory retail exposure within the meaning of section 51(1);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an exposure that is subject to the IRB approach for retail exposures under section 144;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a credit facility secured on one or more than one residential property for the purposes of financing or re-financing the purchase of the property or properties concerned; or

subparagraph.name: D
iii
subparagraph.content: that do not reference a claim on a special purpose entity; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: where all reference obligations, in the case of the nth-to-default credit derivative contracts, are single-name products (including single-name credit derivative contracts and commonly traded indices based on single-name products) for which a liquid two-way market exists; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any positions that hedge the securitization exposures or nth-to-default credit derivative contracts referred to in paragraph (a) where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the positions are not securitization exposures or nth-to-default credit derivative contracts; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a liquid two-way market exists for the positions and the underlying exposures of the positions; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

section.def: covered bond (資產覆蓋債券) has the meaning given by rule 17 of the Banking (Liquidity) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. Q); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

credit migration risk (信用遷移風險), in relation to an exposure of an authorized institution, means the potential for direct and indirect losses to the institution if there were an internal or external rating downgrade or upgrade; (L.N. 137 of 2011)
CTP means a correlation trading portfolio; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

current ES (現行ES), in relation to a portfolio of exposures held by an authorized institution, means an ES calculated by the institution under the IMA with model inputs calibrated to historical data from the most recent 12-month period; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

debt-related derivative contract (債務關聯衍生工具合約) means a futures contract, forward contract, swap contract, option contract or similar derivative contract the value of which is determined by reference to the value of, or any fluctuation in the value of, an underlying debt security or an underlying debt security index (being an index calculated by reference to a basket of debt securities);

def.name: DebtSecurity
def.leadIn: debt security (債務證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fixed or floating rate bond;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a negotiable certificate of deposit;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a non-convertible preference share; or

paragraph.name: d

section.def: default risk (違責風險), in relation to an exposure of an authorized institution, means the potential for direct and indirect losses to the institution if the obligor were to default or a default event were to occur; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

default risk charge (違責風險資本要求), in relation to the IMA, means the greater of the following—(a)the most recent market risk capital charge calculated by an authorized institution’s internal models to capture the risk of direct loss due to a default event as well as the potential for indirect loss that may arise from a default event in respect of its trading book positions in credit instruments and equity instruments;(b)the average of all such market risk capital charges calculated by the institution’s internal models over the previous 12-week period; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

delta (得爾塔), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for an option contract under the SSTM approach, means a measure of the rate of change in the value of the option contract to changes in the value of the underlying exposure of the option contract; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

delta-plus approach (得爾塔附加計算法), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for its option exposures to debt securities, interest rates, equities, foreign exchange (including gold) and commodities, means the approach set out in Division 9;

eligible internal risk transfer (合資格內部風險轉移), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge, means an internal risk transfer that is recognized under section 281D; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

def.name: Equity
def.leadIn: equity (股權) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an ordinary share (whether voting or non-voting); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a convertible bond, preference share, or any other instrument, which trades like a share falling within paragraph (a);

section.def: equity-related derivative contract (股權關聯衍生工具合約) means a futures contract, forward contract, swap contract, option contract or similar derivative contract the value of which is determined by reference to the value of, or any fluctuation in the value of, an underlying equity or an underlying equity index (being an index calculated by reference to a basket of equities);
ES means expected shortfall; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

exchange rate-related derivative contract (匯率關聯衍生工具合約) means a futures contract, forward contract, swap contract, option contract or similar derivative contract the value of which is determined by reference to the value of, or any fluctuation in the value of, an underlying currency (including gold) or an underlying currency index (being an index calculated by reference to a basket of currencies);
expected shortfall (預期損失值), in relation to a portfolio of exposures, means the average of all potential losses exceeding the VaR over a period of time at a given confidence level; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

gamma (伽馬), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for an option contract under the SSTM approach, means a measure of the rate of change in delta of the option contract to changes in the value of the underlying exposure of the option contract; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

def.name: GeneralMarketRisk
def.leadIn: general market risk (一般市場風險), in relation to an authorized institution, means the risk of loss, arising from changes in interest rates, exchange rates, equity prices or commodity prices, in the value of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s trading book positions held in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: debt securities;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: debt-related derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: interest rate derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: equities; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: equity-related derivative contracts; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s positions held in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: foreign exchange (including gold);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: exchange rate-related derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: commodities; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: commodity-related derivative contracts;

section.def: GIRR means general interest rate risk; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
gross jump-to-default risk amount (突發違責風險總額), in relation to the SA-DRC, means the estimated loss or gain on an individual exposure as a result of the default of an obligor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

idiosyncratic credit spread NMRF (獨特信用利差NMRF), in relation to the IMA, means a credit spread NMRF that is associated with a particular issuance, including default provisions, maturity and seniority; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
idiosyncratic equity NMRF (獨特股權NMRF), in relation to the IMA, means an equity NMRF that is associated with a particular equity; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

def.name: InterestRateDerivativeContract
def.leadIn: interest rate derivative contract (利率衍生工具合約) means a futures contract, forward contract, swap contract, option contract or similar derivative contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of which changes in response to changes in interest rates; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the underlying exposure of which is neither a debt security nor an index calculated by reference to a basket of debt securities;

section.def: internal risk transfer (內部風險轉移), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge, means a transfer of risk, confirmed by an internal written record—(a)within the institution’s banking book;(b)between the institution’s banking book and trading book; or(c)between different desks within the institution’s trading book; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

investment grade (投資等級) means—(a)a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4 derived from mapping the ECAI issuer rating assigned to an issuer, being a sovereign, of any debt security to a credit quality grade in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs;(b)a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4 derived from mapping the ECAI issue specific rating assigned to any debt security issued by a bank or securities firm to a credit quality grade in the LT ECAI rating mapping table, or ST ECAI rating mapping table, for Type A ECAIs;(c)a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4 derived from mapping the ECAI issue specific rating assigned to any debt security issued by a corporate (within the meaning of section 51(1) or 139(1), as the case requires) to a credit quality grade in the LT ECAI rating mapping table, or ST ECAI rating mapping table, for Type A ECAIs; or(d)a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4 derived from mapping the ECAI issue specific rating assigned to any debt security issued by a corporate (within the meaning of section 51(1) or 139(1), as the case requires) incorporated in India to a credit quality grade in the LT ECAI rating mapping table, or ST ECAI rating mapping table, for Type B ECAIs; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

look-through approach (透視計算法) means the decomposition of an instrument into its underlying exposures or its individual components that, in the case of a collective investment scheme, is based on sufficient and frequent information verified by an independent third party; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

market risk capital charge factor (市場風險資本要求因數), in relation to an authorized institution, means a percentage specified in this Part for the calculation of the institution’s market risk capital charge;

maturity method (到期方法), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for general market risk for its interest rate exposures, means the approach set out in section 288;
modellable risk factor (可模式化風險因素), in relation to the IMA, means a risk factor that passes the risk factor eligibility test under an authorized institution’s internal models; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

net jump-to-default risk amount (突發違責風險淨額), in relation to the SA-DRC, means the estimated loss or gain for an authorized institution as a result of the default of an obligor after offsetting gross jump-to-default risk amounts with respect to that obligor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
NMRF means a non-modellable risk factor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
non-modellable risk factor (不可模式化的風險因素), in relation to the IMA, means a risk factor that is not a modellable risk factor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

def.name: NthtodefaultCreditDerivativeContract
def.leadIn: nth-to-default credit derivative contract (nth違責者信用衍生工具合約) means a credit derivative contract under which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the protection buyer obtains credit protection for a basket of exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nth default among the obligations specified in the contract for the purposes of determining whether a credit event has occurred triggers the credit protection and terminates the contract; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

section.def: position (持倉), in relation to an authorized institution, means the holding or disposal by the institution of an exposure, or a portfolio of exposures, resulting in risk being taken by the institution on market price movements in respect of the exposure, or portfolio of exposures, as the case may be;

qualifying covered bond (合資格資產覆蓋債券) means a covered bond that meets all the conditions in rule 70(3) of the Banking (Exposure Limits) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. S) at the inception of the covered bond and throughout its remaining maturity; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

real price observation (真實價格觀察), for an authorized institution in relation to a risk factor under the IMA, means—(a)a price at which the institution has conducted a transaction;(b)a verifiable price for an actual transaction between other arms-length parties;(c)a price obtained from a committed quote made by the institution itself or another party that has been collected and verified through a third-party vendor, a trading platform or an exchange; or(d)a price obtained from a third-party vendor if—(i)the transaction or committed quote has been processed through the vendor;(ii)the vendor agrees to provide evidence of the transaction or committed quote to the Monetary Authority at the request of the institution; and(iii)the price meets any of the criteria in paragraph (a), (b) or (c); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

reduced set of modellable risk factors (可模式化風險因素的簡化組合), for an authorized institution in relation to the IMA, means a set of modellable risk factors approved for the institution by the Monetary Authority under section 322D(5)(a); (L.N. 167 of 2023)

residual risk add-on (剩餘風險附加額) means a component of the STM approach under Division 1C to capture any additional risks beyond the main risk factors already captured in the SBM and the SA-DRC; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

def.name: RiskCategory
def.leadIn: risk category (風險類別), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk, means the class of the institution’s market risk exposures which are at risk from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: changes in debt security prices or interest rates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: changes in exchange rates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: changes in equity prices; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: changes in commodity prices;

section.def: risk factor (風險因素) means a variable that affects the value of an instrument; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

risk factor eligibility test (風險因素合資格測試), in relation to the IMA, means a test to check whether there are a sufficient number of real price observations that are representative of a risk factor; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
RRAO means the residual risk add-on; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SA-DRC (non-securitization) (SA-DRC(非證券化)) means the SA-DRC for the exposures set out in section 281T(1); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SA-DRC (securitization: CTP) (SA-DRC(證券化：CTP)) means the SA-DRC for the exposures to instruments set out in section 281W(1); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP) (SA-DRC(證券化：非CTP)) means the SA-DRC for the exposures set out in section 281V(1); (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SBM means the sensitivities-based method; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

SBM curvature (SBM曲率) means a sensitivity to capture the changes in the value of an authorized institution’s position due to movements in its non-volatility risk factors not captured by the SBM delta; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

SBM curvature risk (SBM曲率風險) means the risk of changes in the value of an authorized institution’s position due to movements in its non-volatility risk factors captured by SBM curvature; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SBM delta (SBM得爾塔) means a first order sensitivity to capture the changes in the value of an authorized institution’s position due to movements in its non-volatility risk factors; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SBM delta risk (SBM得爾塔風險) means the risk of changes in the value of an authorized institution’s position due to movements in its non-volatility risk factors captured by SBM delta; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SBM vega (SBM維加) means a first order sensitivity to capture the changes in the value of an authorized institution’s position due to movements in its volatility risk factors; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
SBM vega risk (SBM維加風險) means the risk of changes in the value of an authorized institution’s position due to movements in its volatility risk factors captured by SBM vega; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

sensitivities-based method (敏感度基準方法) means a component of the STM approach to capture SBM delta risks, SMB vega risks and SBM curvature risks, within a particular risk class under Division 1B; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

simplified approach (簡化計算法), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for its option exposures to debt securities, interest rates, equities, foreign exchange (including gold) and commodities, means the approach set out in Division 8;

def.name: SpecialPurposeEntity
def.leadIn: special purpose entity (特定目的實體), in relation to an authorized institution’s CTP, means a company, trust or other entity— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: organized for a specific purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the activities of which are limited to those appropriate to accomplish that purpose; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the structure of which is intended to isolate the obligations of the company, trust or other entity, as the case may be, from the credit risk of an originator or a seller of exposures; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

def.name: SpecificRisk
def.leadIn: specific risk (特定風險), in relation to an authorized institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the risk of loss, arising from changes in the price of debt-related derivative contracts owing to factors relating to the issuers of the underlying debt securities, in the value of the institution’s trading book positions held in the debt-related derivative contracts; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the risk of loss, arising from changes in the price of equity-related derivative contracts owing to factors relating to the issuers of the underlying equities, in the value of the institution’s trading book positions held in the equity-related derivative contracts;

section.def: specific risk interest rate exposures (特定風險利率風險承擔), in relation to an authorized institution, means the interest rate exposures of the institution that are subject to market risk capital charge for specific risk; (L.N. 137 of 2011)
standardized default risk charge (標準違責風險資本要求) means a component of the STM approach to capture jump-to-default risk for credit instruments and equity instruments under Division 1D; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

stress scenario capital charge (壓力情況資本要求), in relation to an authorized institution, means the market risk capital charge for an NMRF calculated by the institution under the IMA with model inputs calibrated to a relevant continuous 12-month period of significant financial stress; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

stressed ES (受壓ES), in relation to a portfolio of exposures held by an authorized institution, means an ES calculated by the institution under the IMA with model inputs calibrated to historical data from a stressed ES relevant period; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

stressed ES relevant period (受壓ES有關期間), in relation to a portfolio of exposures held by an authorized institution, means a continuous 12-month period of significant financial stress for which the portfolio experienced the largest loss since at least 2007; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
transitional period (securitization) (過渡期(證券化)) means the period from and including 1 January 2012 to and including 31 December 2013; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

def.name: TwowayMarket
def.leadIn: two-way market (雙向市場) means a market where there are independent bona fide offers to buy or sell such that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: transactions can be settled at such price within a relatively short time in accordance with trade custom; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

section.def: underlying exposure (基礎風險承擔), in relation to a derivative contract (including a credit derivative contract) for the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk, means the underlying asset, index, financial instrument, rate or thing as designated in the derivative contract;

vega (維加), in relation to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for an option contract under the SSTM approach, means a measure of the rate of change in the value of the option contract to changes in the volatility of the value of the underlying exposure of the option contract. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

section.name: s281A
section.heading: Banking book

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (4), an authorized institution must assign the following instruments to its banking book—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unlisted equities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: instruments designated for securitization warehousing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: direct holdings of real estate and derivatives on direct holdings of real estate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: retail and small or medium-sized enterprise credit;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: equity investments in a collective investment scheme;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: hedge funds;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: instruments held for the purpose of hedging a particular risk of a position in instruments of a kind referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(e) does not apply to a collective investment scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution is able to apply the look-through approach to the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution obtains daily price quotes for the scheme and has access to the information contained in the scheme’s mandate or in the relevant regulations governing the scheme.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice, require an authorized institution to provide to the Monetary Authority, within the period specified in the notice, evidence that an instrument (other than an instrument of a kind referred to in subsection (1)) assigned to the institution’s banking book is not held for a purpose referred to in section 281B(1).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution does not, within the period specified in a notice under subsection (3), provide sufficient evidence to satisfy the Monetary Authority that the instrument is not held for a purpose referred to in section 281B(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the instrument customarily belongs to the trading book,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by written notice, require the institution to assign the instrument to the institution’s trading book within the period specified in the notice.

section.name: s281B
section.heading: Trading book

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6)(a) and section 281A, an authorized institution must assign to its trading book, on the initial recognition on its books, an instrument that is held for one or more of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: short-term resale;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: profiting from short-term price movements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: locking in arbitrage profits;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hedging risks that arise from an instrument held for one or more purposes referred to in paragraphs (a), (b) and (c).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6)(a) and section 281A, and without limiting subsection (1), the following instruments are taken to be held for a purpose referred to in subsection (1) and must be assigned to the trading book—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: instruments in the institution’s CTP;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: instruments that would give rise to a net short credit or equity position in the institution’s banking book;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: instruments resulting from securities underwriting commitments relating only to securities that are expected to be actually purchased by the institution on the settlement date.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (4) and (6)(a) and section 281A, and without limiting subsection (1), the following instruments are taken to be held for a purpose referred to in subsection (1) and must be assigned to the trading book—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: instruments held as accounting trading assets or liabilities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: instruments resulting from market making activities;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: listed equities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: trading-related repo-style transactions;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: options (including embedded derivatives from instruments that the institution issued out of its banking book and that relate to credit risk or equity risk),

subsection.continued: unless the Monetary Authority gives written approval under subsection (4) for the institution to assign the instrument to its banking book.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may assign an instrument referred to in subsection (3) to its banking book if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution submits a written request to the Monetary Authority and provides evidence that the instrument is not held for a purpose referred to in subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority gives written approval to the institution to assign the instrument to its banking book.

subsection.content: The institution must keep a record of an approval under subsection (4)(b) and document all the evidence referred to in subsection (4)(a).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not assign an instrument to its trading book if there is any legal impediment to selling or fully hedging it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must fair value daily each instrument assigned to its trading book and recognize any valuation change in its profit and loss account.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice, require an authorized institution to provide to the Monetary Authority, within the period specified in the notice, evidence that an instrument (other than an instrument of a kind referred to in subsection (2)) assigned to the institution’s trading book is held for a purpose referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution does not, within the period specified in a notice under subsection (7), provide sufficient evidence to satisfy the Monetary Authority that the instrument is held for a purpose referred to in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the instrument customarily belongs to the banking book,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by written notice, require the institution to assign the instrument to the institution’s banking book within the period specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must have effective internal controls to ensure that all instruments are properly assigned initially to its trading book or banking book;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must keep comprehensive records to demonstrate its compliance with the policies and procedures referred to in paragraph (a); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must conduct by its internal auditors, at least annually, an independent review or audit of its compliance with the policies and procedures referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: embedded derivative (嵌入式衍生工具) means an instrument referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of derivative contract in section 2(1).

section.name: s281C
section.heading: Restriction on moving instruments between books

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 281A and 281B, an authorized institution must not move an instrument between its banking book and trading book after its initial assignment unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument is reclassified as an accounting trading asset or liability (in which case there is a presumption that the instrument is in the trading book, as required by section 281B(3)(a)); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority, on the application of the institution, gives written approval for the instrument to be moved.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may give approval under subsection (1)(b) only if satisfied that there are extraordinary circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution moves an instrument between its banking book and trading book in accordance with this section, it must, after the move—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine whether the total capital charge across its banking book and trading book is reduced by the move; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must have policies in place in relation to the moving of instruments between its banking book and trading book;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: must give written notice to the Monetary Authority of any changes to those policies.

section.name: s281D
section.heading: Treatment of internal risk transfers

subsection.content: An authorized institution may recognize an internal risk transfer in any of the circumstances set out in this section for the purpose of calculating its market risk capital charge.

The institution may recognize an internal risk transfer from its banking book to its trading book that aims to hedge a credit risk exposure in the banking book if it fulfils the requirements of section 99B or 213, as the case requires.

subsection.leadIn: The institution may recognize an internal risk transfer from its banking book to its trading book that aims to hedge a GIRR exposure in the banking book if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution documents the internal risk transfer with respect to the interest rate risk being hedged and the sources of the risk;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution conducts the internal risk transfer with a dedicated trading desk that obtains the approval of the Monetary Authority and—

subparagraph.content: obtains an external hedge directly from an external counterparty; or

obtains an external hedge from the market via a separate non-internal risk transfer trading desk acting as an agent and that transfer exactly matches an external hedge obtained from an external counterparty; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution calculates the market risk capital charge for the dedicated trading desk on a standalone basis.

section.name: s281E
section.heading: Positions to be used to calculate market risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution must calculate its market risk capital charge for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution’s trading book positions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the foreign exchange risk, and commodity risk, of the institution’s banking book positions.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must not include a position in the calculation of its market risk capital charge if the position is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the banking book leg of an eligible internal risk transfer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exposure that, under Division 4 of Part 3, is required to be deducted from any of the institution’s CET1 capital, Additional Tier 1 capital or Tier 2 capital; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an eligible CVA hedge obtained from an external counterparty or the CVA leg of an eligible CVA hedge obtained from its trading book internally.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may exclude a foreign exchange risk position from the calculation of its market risk capital charge for its foreign exchange risk if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the position is of a structural (that is, non-dealing) nature;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution’s risk management policy for structural foreign exchange positions is approved by the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the establishment of, and any changes to, the position follow the policy referred to in paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the exclusion is made for at least 6 months;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the institution applies the exclusion consistently, with the exclusion treatment of the hedge remaining in place for the life of the assets or other items to which the position relates; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the institution keeps comprehensive records of the position and the amount excluded from the market risk capital charge.

subsection.content: If a position of an authorized institution does not fall within subsection (1) because of subsection (2)(a) or (b), the institution must apply Part 4, 5, 6 or 7, as the case requires, to calculate the credit risk for that position.

division.name: D1A
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge under STM Approach: General

section.name: s281F
section.heading: Application of Divisions 1A to 1D

subsection.content: Divisions 1A, 1B, 1C and 1D apply to an authorized institution that uses the STM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge.
A reference to an authorized institution in Divisions 1A, 1B, 1C and 1D is a reference to an authorized institution that uses the STM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge.

section.name: s281G
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge and risk-weighted amount for market risk

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its market risk capital charge as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ultimate SBM capital charge under section 281H(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the RRAO under section 281R; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the SA-DRC under section 281S.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate its risk-weighted amount for market risk by multiplying the market risk capital charge as calculated under subsection (1) by 12.5.

division.name: D1B
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge under STM Approach: SBM Capital Charge

section.name: s281H
section.heading: Calculation of SBM capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its SBM capital charge for each of the 3 correlation scenarios set out in section 281L as the sum of the following capital charges for each risk class—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the SBM delta risk capital charge under section 281I;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the SBM vega risk capital charge under section 281J;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the SBM curvature risk capital charge under section 281K.

subsection.content: An authorized institution’s ultimate SBM capital charge is the SBM capital charge that is the largest of the SBM capital charges calculated under subsection (1) for the 3 correlation scenarios.

An authorized institution must calculate the SBM delta risk capital charge for all instruments in the respective portfolios included in the calculation except for any position for which the value at any point in time is purely driven by an exotic underlying and that is subject to the RRAO in accordance with section 281R(1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the SBM vega risk capital charge for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any instrument with optionality; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any instrument the cashflows of which cannot be written as a linear function of the underlying notional amount,

subsection.continued: except for any position for which the value at any point in time is purely driven by an exotic underlying and that is subject to the RRAO in accordance with section 281R(1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the SBM curvature risk capital charge consistently over time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for—

subparagraph.content: any instrument with optionality; and
any instrument the cashflows of which cannot be written as a linear function of the underlying notional amount,

paragraph.continued: except for any position for which the value at any point in time is purely driven by an exotic underlying and that is subject to the RRAO in accordance with section 281R(1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for all instruments subject to SBM delta risk capital charge except for any position—

subparagraph.content: for which the value at any point in time is purely driven by an exotic underlying; and
that is subject to the RRAO in accordance with section 281R(1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: instrument with optionality (包含選擇權的工具) means an option contract or an instrument that includes an option component.

for GIRR, credit spread risk (non-securitization), credit spread risk (securitization: non-CTP), credit spread risk (securitization: CTP) and equity repo rate risk factors; or
for equity price risk, commodity risk and foreign exchange risk factors,

section.name: s281L
section.heading: Correlation scenarios
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, the correlation scenarios are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the medium scenario, in which the correlation parameters ρkl and γbc are as referred to in sections 281O(2), 281P(2) and 281Q(2);
