section.name: s281M
section.heading: SBM risk factors

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must, in respect of a risk class—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine buckets as specified by the Monetary Authority for the risk class that appropriately distinguish the risk characteristics of risk factors across different buckets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
allocate each risk-weighted sensitivity calculated under section 281I(2)(c) and 281J(2)(c) and each
CVR k +
and
CVR k –
calculated under section 281K(2)(a) to an appropriate bucket.

subsection.leadIn: Depending on the positions held, an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: define the SBM delta risk factors, at a level of granularity specified by the Monetary Authority, as—

subparagraph.content: risk-free interest rates, market-implied inflation rates and cross-currency basis for GIRR;
equity prices and equity repo rates for equity risk;
commodity prices for commodity risk; and

foreign exchange rates between the Hong Kong dollar and each foreign currency or, with the approval of the Monetary Authority, the exchange rates between a base currency other than the Hong Kong dollar and each foreign currency;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: define the SBM curvature risk factors, at a level of granularity specified by the Monetary Authority, as—

subparagraph.content: risk-free interest rates for GIRR;
equity prices for equity risk;
commodity prices for commodity risk; and

foreign exchange rates between the Hong Kong dollar and each foreign currency or, with the approval of the Monetary Authority, the exchange rates between a base currency other than the Hong Kong dollar and each foreign currency.

section.name: s281N
section.heading: Instruments with multiple constituents

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (4), (5) and (7), an authorized institution must apply the look-through approach to calculate the SBM delta risk capital charge and the SBM curvature risk capital charge for any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: index instruments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multi-underlying options; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: equity investments in a collective investment scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), an authorized institution may opt not to apply the look-through approach under subsection (1), but instead may calculate a single sensitivity for SBM delta and SBM curvature with respect to each index that an instrument references or a collective investment scheme tracks, for any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: index instrument that references a qualified index;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: index instrument referred to in paragraph (a) that is held by a collective investment scheme in respect of which the institution can apply the look-through approach; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: collective investment scheme that can be looked through and tracks a qualified index if—

subparagraph.content: the scheme has an absolute value of a tracking difference (ignoring fees and commissions) of less than 1%; and
the tracking difference is checked at least annually.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution opts to calculate a single sensitivity for a qualified index under subsection (2), the institution must assign the sensitivity to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appropriate sector-specific bucket if more than 75% of the constituents in the qualified index (taking into account their weightings in that index) would be mapped to a specific sector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an appropriate non-sector-specific index bucket otherwise.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must not break an index CTP instrument down into its constituents but must consider the index CTP a risk factor as a whole.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may opt not to apply the look-through approach under subsection (1) for an equity investment in a collective investment scheme that cannot be looked through and for which the institution has access to daily price quotes and the information contained in the mandate of the scheme or in the relevant regulations governing the scheme, but instead—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may assume that the scheme is a position in a tracked index and assign the sensitivity for the tracked index to relevant sector-specific buckets or non-sector-specific index buckets as set out in subsection (3), if—

subparagraph.content: the scheme tracks a qualified index;
the scheme has an absolute value of a tracking difference (ignoring fees and commissions) of less than 1%; and
the tracking difference is checked at least annually;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the approval of the Monetary Authority, may calculate on a standalone basis the capital charge of a hypothetical portfolio in which the scheme invests, to the maximum possible extent allowed under its mandate, in assets attracting the highest risk-weight and then progressively in other assets attracting a lower risk-weight; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to sections 281R(4) and 281S(5), may treat the scheme as an unrated equity exposure and assign it to “other sectors” under the sector classification.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must exclude any net short position in a collective investment scheme from other positions subject to the market risk capital charge and subject the net short position to a 100% capital charge if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheme cannot be looked through; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution cannot access daily price quotes and the information contained in the mandate of the scheme or in the relevant regulations governing the scheme.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution has applied the look-through approach under subsection (1) to instruments with an identical underlying, the institution must not opt to use the approach referred to in subsection (2) in relation to the instruments except with the approval of the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may determine the SBM vega risk factor for a multi-underlying option as the implied volatility of the option rather than the implied volatility of its underlying constituents and, if so, must assign the SBM vega sensitivity to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appropriate sector-specific bucket if more than 75% of the constituents (taking into account their weightings in the option) would be mapped to a specific sector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an appropriate non-sector-specific index bucket otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: qualified index (合資格指數), in relation to the calculation of the market risk capital charge for instruments with multiple constituents, means an exchange-traded and widely recognized and accepted equity or credit index where—(a)the constituents of the index and their respective weightings are known;(b)the index contains at least 20 constituents;(c)no single constituent represents more than 25% of the total index;(d)the largest 10% of the constituents represents less than 60% of the total index; and(e)the total market capitalization of all the constituents is no less than $312 billion;

tracking difference (追縱差異), in relation to a collective investment scheme, means the annualized return difference between the scheme and its tracked benchmark over the last 12 months of available data (or a shorter period in the absence of a full 12 months of data).

section.name: s281O
section.heading: SBM delta risk-weights and correlation parameters

subsection.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to each SBM delta risk factor at a level specified by the Monetary Authority that sufficiently represents stressed market conditions.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of aggregating SBM delta risk-weighted sensitivities within the same bucket, must use the correlation parameters ρkl specified by the Monetary Authority that appropriately recognize a degree of diversification benefit within the bucket; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of aggregating SBM delta risk capital charges across buckets within the same risk class, must use the correlation parameters γbc specified by the Monetary Authority that appropriately recognize a degree of diversification benefit across the buckets.

section.name: s281P
section.heading: SBM vega risk-weights and correlation parameters

subsection.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to each SBM vega risk factor at a level specified by the Monetary Authority that sufficiently represents stressed market conditions.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of aggregating SBM vega risk-weighted sensitivities within the same bucket, must use the correlation parameters ρkl specified by the Monetary Authority that appropriately recognize a degree of diversification benefit within the bucket; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of aggregating SBM vega risk capital charges across buckets within the same risk class, must use the correlation parameters γbc specified by the Monetary Authority that appropriately recognize a degree of diversification benefit across the buckets.

section.name: s281Q
section.heading: SBM curvature risk-weights and correlation parameters

subsection.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to each SBM curvature risk factor at a level specified by the Monetary Authority that sufficiently represents stressed market conditions.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of aggregating SBM curvature risk-weighted sensitivities within the same bucket, must use the correlation parameters ρkl specified by the Monetary Authority that appropriately recognize a degree of diversification benefit within the bucket; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of aggregating SBM curvature risk capital charges across buckets within the same risk class, must use the correlation parameters γbc specified by the Monetary Authority that appropriately recognize a degree of diversification benefit across the buckets.

division.name: D1C
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge under STM Approach: RRAO

section.name: s281R
section.heading: Calculation of RRAO

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution must calculate the RRAO for any instrument in its trading book—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with an exotic underlying, if the risk profile of the underlying exposure of the instrument is not captured by the SBM or SA-DRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: bearing other residual risks, if—

subparagraph.content: the instrument is subject to SBM vega risk capital charges or SBM curvature risk capital charges in the trading book and with pay-offs that cannot be written or perfectly replicated as a finite linear combination of vanilla options with a single underlying equity price, commodity price, exchange rate, bond price, credit default swap price or interest rate swap; or
the instrument is in the institution’s CTP and is not recognized as an eligible hedge of risks within the CTP.

subsection.content: The institution is not required to calculate the RRAO for an instrument that is a back-to-back transaction that exactly matches with a third-party transaction in the trading book and, in that case, both the back-to-back transaction and the third-party transaction may be excluded from the institution’s RRAO.

subsection.leadIn: The institution is not required to calculate the RRAO for an instrument that bears other residual risks as referred to in subsection (1)(b), if the instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is listed on an exchange; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for central clearing.

subsection.content: If, under section 281N(5)(c), the institution treats an equity investment in a collective investment scheme as an unrated equity exposure and assigns it to “other sectors” under the sector classification, the institution must assume that the scheme is exposed to exotic underlying exposures, and to other residual risks, to the maximum possible extent allowed under the scheme’s mandate.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate the RRAO as the sum of the gross (long plus short) notional amounts of the instruments bearing residual risks multiplied by the following risk-weights—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1.0% for instruments with an exotic underlying;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 0.1% for instruments bearing other residual risks.

division.name: D1D
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge under STM Approach: SA-DRC

section.name: s281S
section.heading: Calculation of SA-DRC generally

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the SA-DRC for instruments in its trading book as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the SA-DRC (non-securitization) under section 281T;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP) under section 281V; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the SA-DRC (securitization: CTP) under section 281W.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a long exposure is an exposure for which a default of the underlying obligor results in a loss to the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a short exposure is an exposure for which a default of the underlying obligor results in a gain to the institution.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notional amount of a long exposure is to be recorded as a positive value; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notional amount of a short exposure is to be recorded as a negative value.

subsection.content: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC, the institution must allocate a default risk-weight of 0% to any exposure of the institution to sovereigns, public sector entities and multilateral development banks that would be allocated a 0% risk-weight under the standardized (credit risk) approach set out in sections 55, 56, 57 and 58.

subsection.leadIn: If, under section 281N(5)(c), the institution treats an equity investment in a collective investment scheme as an unrated equity exposure and assigns it to “other sectors” under the sector classification—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the institution—

subparagraph.content: must treat the equity investment in the scheme as an unrated equity exposure; or

if the scheme’s mandate allows the scheme to invest primarily in names of certain credit qualities, must apply the maximum default risk-weight as referred to in section 281T(8) that is achievable under the scheme’s mandate and must not offset or aggregate, with correlation, the generated exposure with other exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution must reasonably consider whether, given the scheme’s mandate, that default risk-weight is sufficiently prudent.

section.name: s281T
section.heading: Calculation of SA-DRC (non-securitization)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution must calculate the SA-DRC (non-securitization) for any non-securitization exposure in its trading book subject to default risk that is a credit instrument or equity instrument.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must exclude from the calculation of the SA-DRC (non-securitization) any non-securitization exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that hedges a CTP instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is held for the purpose of offsetting and hedging any non-CTP securitization exposure if that non-securitization exposure together with other exposures is decomposed proportionately into the equivalent replicating tranches that span the entire tranche structure.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include any exposure referred to in subsection (2)(a) in SA-DRC (securitization: CTP); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include any exposure referred to in subsection (2)(b) in SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC (non-securitization), the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount with respect to an obligor as the product of—

subparagraph.content: the net jump-to-default risk amount calculated under paragraph (b); and
the default risk-weights referred to in subsection (8);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: allocate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount to the following buckets according to the nature of the obligor—

subparagraph.content: corporates;
sovereigns;
local governments and municipalities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: calculate the bucket level SA-DRC in accordance with subsection (9); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: calculate the SA-DRC (non-securitization) as the sum of the bucket level SA-DRC for each bucket.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must offset the gross jump-to-default risk amounts of long and short exposures with respect to the same obligor if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the short exposure has the same or lower seniority relative to the long exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following applies—

subparagraph.content: the maturity of both exposures is equal to or longer than one year;
the maturity of either or both exposures is shorter than one year.

subsection.content: If the maturity of either or both exposures referred to in subsection (5) is shorter than one year, the institution must scale down the gross jump-to-default risk amounts of those exposures in accordance with section 281U(1)(b) or (2)(b), as the case requires.

subsection.leadIn: The institution may consistently assign to cash equity positions a maturity of either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: more than one year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 281S(4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the institution must calculate the default risk-weight in accordance with the credit quality of the obligor as set out in Table 27C or, if the obligor is a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, Table 27D; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the institution uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures, the institution may map the internal rating of an obligor without an ECAI issuer rating to one of the ECAI issuer ratings based on a mapping scheme approved in writing by the Monetary Authority to determine the credit quality for the purpose of calculating the default risk-weight of the obligor under Table 27C or 27D, as the case requires.

leadIn.b: Default Risk-Weights Applicable to All Obligors

td.p: Credit quality grade 1 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs
Credit quality grade 2 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs
Credit quality grade 3 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs
Credit quality grade 4 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs
Credit quality grade 5 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs
Credit quality grade 6 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs
Credit quality grade 7 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs

leadIn.b: Default Risk-Weights Applicable to Obligors that are Corporates Incorporated in Home Jurisdiction of Type B ECAI

td.p: Credit quality grade 1 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs
Credit quality grade 2 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs
Credit quality grade 3 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs
Credit quality grade 4 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs
Credit quality grade 5 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs
Credit quality grade 6 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs
Credit quality grade 7 in the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate the bucket level SA-DRC in accordance with Formulas 27Y and 27Z.
where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: SA-DRCb is the SA-DRC for bucket b;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: i is the obligor belonging to bucket b;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: HBR is the hedge benefit ratio determined in accordance with Formula 27Z;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: net JTDi is the net jump-to-default risk amount with respect to the obligor i; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: RWi is the default risk-weight of the obligor i.

subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: HBR is the hedge benefit ratio for the purposes of Formula 27Y;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ∑ net JTDlong is the sum of all net long jump-to-default risk amounts within bucket b; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ∑|net JTDshort| is the sum of all net short jump-to-default risk amounts in absolute value within bucket b.

section.name: s281U
section.heading: Calculation of gross jump-to-default risk amount for SA-DRC (non-securitization)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), an authorized institution must calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount of a long exposure as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the exposure has a maturity that is equal to or longer than one year, the greater of zero and the sum of—

subparagraph.leadIn: the product of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (6), the notional amount of the instrument recorded as a positive value; and

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: the cumulative mark-to-market gain or loss over the face value already taken on the exposure, with a gain being recorded as a positive value and a loss being recorded as a negative value; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the exposure has a maturity that is shorter than one year, the product of—

subparagraph.content: the amount that would be calculated under paragraph (a) if the exposure had a maturity equal to or longer than one year; and
a scaling factor that is equal to the greater of 0.25 and the ratio of its maturity relative to one year.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), an authorized institution must calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount of a short exposure as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the exposure has a maturity that is equal to or longer than one year, the lesser of zero and the sum of—

subparagraph.leadIn: the product of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (6), the notional amount of the instrument recorded as a negative value; and

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: the cumulative mark-to-market gain or loss over the face value already taken on the exposure, with a gain being recorded as a positive value and a loss being recorded as a negative value; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the exposure has a maturity that is shorter than one year, the product of—

subparagraph.content: the amount that would be calculated under paragraph (a) if the exposure had a maturity equal to or longer than one year; and
a scaling factor that is equal to the greater of 0.25 and the ratio of its maturity relative to one year.

subsection.content: The institution must treat the gross jump-to-default risk amount of an instrument as zero if the instrument could be unwound with no exposure to default risk.
The institution must treat the gross jump-to-default risk amount of a cash-equity position as the market value of the position.

The institution must decompose an instrument with multiple constituents into exposures in the individual constituents to calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount of each individual constituent.
The institution must set the notional amount of an instrument as zero if the payoffs of the instrument are not related to its notional amount in the event of default.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must apply the LGD in Table 27E to calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount.

leadIn.b: LGD for Calculating Gross Jump-to-default Risk Amount

section.name: s281V
section.heading: Calculation of SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP) for any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: non-CTP securitization exposure in its trading book; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: non-securitization exposure in its trading book that is held for the purpose of offsetting and hedging any exposure referred to in paragraph (a) if that non-securitization exposure together with other exposures is decomposed proportionately into the equivalent replicating tranches that span the entire tranche structure.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP), the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount in accordance with subsection (3) for each exposure referred to in subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the net jump-to-default risk amount by offsetting the gross jump-to-default risk amounts of long and short exposures if any of the conditions referred to in section 281T(5)(b) applies and—

subparagraph.content: the long and short exposures arise from the same underlying asset pool and the same tranche; or

the exposures are perfect replications in the opposite direction of the exposures to be offset through decomposition by a collection of non-securitization positions, securitization exposures with different securitized portfolios, or both;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount as the product of—

subparagraph.content: the net jump-to-default risk amount calculated under paragraph (b); and
the default risk-weight allocated in accordance with subsection (4);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: allocate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount to buckets in accordance with subsection (6);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: calculate the bucket level SA-DRC in accordance with section 281T(9); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: calculate the SA-DRC (securitization: non-CTP) as the sum of the bucket level SA-DRC for each bucket.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 281U(3) and (4) and, for exposures with a maturity of less than one year, applying the scaling factor referred to in section 281U(1)(b)(ii) or (2)(b)(ii), the institution must calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount for each non-CTP securitization exposure as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a long exposure, the greater of zero and the sum of—

subparagraph.content: the notional amount of the instrument recorded as a positive value; and
the cumulative mark-to-market gain or loss over the principal already taken on the exposure, with a gain being recorded as a positive value and a loss being recorded as a negative value; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a short exposure, the lesser of zero and the sum of—

subparagraph.content: the notional amount of the instrument recorded as a negative value; and
the cumulative mark-to-market gain or loss over the principal already taken on the exposure, with a gain being recorded as a positive value and a loss being recorded as a negative value.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 281S(4), the institution must allocate to each non-CTP securitization tranche a default risk-weight that is equal to the product of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 8%; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicable risk-weight of the credit risk for the securitization exposure as set out in Part 7.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a maturity of one year is assumed for each securitization exposure under the SEC-IRBA, SEC-ERBA and SEC-SA; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total market risk capital charge for an individual cash securitization exposure is capped at the fair value of the exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must allocate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount to the following buckets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a unique bucket for all corporates (excluding small-and-medium sized corporates), regardless of their region; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another 44 buckets consisting of each of the 11 asset classes specified in subsection (7) in each of the 4 regions specified in subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: The asset classes are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: asset-backed commercial paper (ABCP);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: auto loans or leases;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: residential mortgage-backed securities (RMBS);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: credit cards;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: commercial mortgage-backed securities (CMBS);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: collateralized loan obligations;

paragraph.name: g

student loans;

section.name: s281W
section.heading: Calculation of SA-DRC (securitization: CTP)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the SA-DRC (securitization: CTP) for any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: CTP instrument in its trading book; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: non-securitization instrument in its trading book that hedges a CTP instrument referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC (securitization: CTP), the institution must treat an nth-to-default credit derivative contract as a tranche in a CTP securitization transaction with the value of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: detachment point calculated as n/N,

subsection.continued: where N is the total number of names in the underlying basket or pool.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the SA-DRC (securitization: CTP), the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to applying the scaling factor referred to in section 281U(1)(b)(ii) or (2)(b)(ii), for exposures with a maturity of less than one year, calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount—

subparagraph.content: for each instrument referred to in subsection (1)(a), in accordance with section 281V(3) as if it were a non-CTP securitization exposure; and
for each instrument referred to in subsection (1)(b), as its market value;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (4) and (5), calculate the net jump-to-default risk amount by offsetting the gross jump-to-default risk amounts of long and short exposures if—

subparagraph.leadIn: the long and short exposures—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the underlying is a credit index, must arise from the same index, the same series and the same tranche; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: otherwise, must arise from the same underlying basket or pool and the same tranche; and

the exposures are perfect replications in the opposite direction of the exposures to be offset through decomposition by a collection of non-securitization positions, securitization tranches or index tranches, but the decomposed exposures are not re-securitization exposures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount as the product of—

subparagraph.content: the net jump-to-default risk amount calculated under paragraph (b); and
the default risk-weight allocated in accordance with subsection (6);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: allocate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amount to buckets in accordance with subsection (7);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: calculate the bucket level SA-DRC in accordance with subsection (8); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: calculate the SA-DRC (securitization: CTP) in accordance with subsection (9).

subsection.leadIn: The institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must offset the gross jump-to-default risk amounts of long and short exposures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the maturity of any one or more of those exposures is less than one year, must apply the scaling factor referred to in section 281U(1)(b)(ii) or (2)(b)(ii) to each such exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the long and short securitization exposures are otherwise equivalent except for a residual component,

subsection.continued: the institution may offset the exposures and reflect the net jump-to-default risk amount for the residual exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must allocate a default risk-weight—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with section 281T(8) for net jump-to-default risk amounts resulting from exposures referred to in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.content: The institution must allocate the risk-weighted net jump-to-default risk amounts to buckets that correspond to a credit index or an underlying basket.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge under SSTM Approach: General

section.name: s282
section.heading: Application of Divisions 2 to 10

subsection.content: Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 apply to an authorized institution that uses the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge.

A reference to an authorized institution in Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 is a reference to an authorized institution that uses the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge.

Divisions 3, 4, 5 and 6 do not apply to an authorized institution’s option exposures in debt securities, interest rates, equities, foreign exchange (including gold) and commodities except to the extent, if any, specified in Division 7, 8 or 9.

section.name: s284
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for each risk category

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the market risk capital charge for its exposures falling into each risk category by multiplying the capital charge calculated in accordance with Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 with a scaling factor of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1.3 for interest rate exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3.5 for equity exposures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1.2 for foreign exchange exposures; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 1.9 for commodity exposures. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3) and section 306(2), an authorized institution shall use the fair value of its positions to calculate the market risk capital charge.

Where the stated notional amount of an exposure held by an authorized institution is leveraged or enhanced by the structure of the exposure, the institution shall use the effective notional amount of the exposure (being the stated notional amount of the exposure adjusted to take into account the effect of the leverage or enhancement provided by the structure of the exposure) for the purposes of this Part. (L.N. 267 of 2006)

section.name: s285
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount for market risk
section.content: An authorized institution shall calculate its risk-weighted amount for market risk by multiplying the aggregate of the market risk capital charge as calculated pursuant to section 284(1) by 12.5.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Interest Rate Exposures

section.name: s286
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for its interest rate exposures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the market risk capital charge for specific risk for each of its trading book positions (whether long or short) in debt securities and debt-related derivative contracts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in accordance with section 287 if those positions arise from non-securitization exposures that do not fall within subparagraph (iv) or a CTP;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in accordance with section 287A if those positions arise from securitization exposures that do not fall within a CTP; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in accordance with section 287 and Division 10 if those positions arise from credit derivative contracts that do not fall within subparagraph (ii) or a CTP; (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (c), calculate in accordance with section 288 the market risk capital charge for general market risk for— (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its trading book positions (whether long or short) in debt securities, debt-related derivative contracts and interest rate derivative contracts;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the interest rate exposures arising from its trading book positions (whether long or short) in equity-related derivative contracts; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the interest rate exposures arising from its positions (whether long or short) in commodity-related derivative contracts; and (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: calculate in accordance with section 288 and Division 10 the market risk capital charge for general market risk for the interest rate exposures arising from its trading book positions (whether long or short) in credit derivative contracts. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

section.name: s287
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for specific risk for interest rate exposures that fall within section 286(a)(i) or (iv)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7), (8), (9), (9A) and (10), an authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its trading book positions (whether long or short) in debt securities and debt-related derivative contracts arising from its interest rate exposures that fall within section 286(a)(i) or (iv)— (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign those positions into the classes specified in column 1 of Table 28, the credit quality grades specified in column 2 of that Table and, if applicable, the residual maturities specified in column 3 of that Table;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiply those positions by the appropriate market risk capital charge factors for specific risk specified in column 3 of Table 28; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A), calculate the total market risk capital charge for specific risk as the sum of the market risk capital charge for specific risk for each of those positions. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the total market risk capital charge for specific risk for nth-to-default credit derivative contracts that fall within section 286(a)(iv) must, during the transitional period (securitization), be calculated as the higher of—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: credit derivative contracts set out in section 309, 310 or 311.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: the issuer of any debt securities referred to in that subsection or, in the case of debt-related derivative contracts referred to in that subsection, the issuer of any underlying debt securities, has an ECAI issuer rating; or

any debt securities referred to in that subsection or, in the case of debt-related derivative contracts referred to in that subsection, any underlying debt securities, have an ECAI issue specific rating,

paragraph.continued: an authorized institution must, subject to paragraphs (b), (c) and (d), map the ECAI issuer rating or the ECAI issue specific rating, as the case may be, to a credit quality grade in the LT ECAI rating mapping table and ST ECAI rating mapping table; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), if the debt securities referred to in that subsection are issued by a sovereign or, in the case of debt-related derivative contracts referred to in that subsection, if the underlying debt securities are issued by a sovereign, an authorized institution shall determine the credit quality grade by reference to the ECAI issuer rating of that sovereign;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an authorized institution shall treat as unrated the issuer of any debt securities or, in the case of debt-related derivative contracts, the issuer of any underlying debt securities, referred to in paragraph (b) which does not have an ECAI issuer rating;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (e), if the debt securities or debt-related derivative contracts referred to in that subsection do not fall within paragraph (b), an authorized institution shall determine the credit quality grade to be used by reference to, in the case of debt securities, the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt securities or, in the case of debt-related derivative contracts, the ECAI issue specific rating of the underlying debt securities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an authorized institution shall treat as unrated any debt securities or, in the case of debt-related derivative contracts, any underlying debt securities, referred to in paragraph (d) which do not have an ECAI issue specific rating;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized institution may only assign a market risk capital charge factor of 0% to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: debt securities referred to in that subsection issued by a sovereign with a credit quality grade of 3 or 4 as determined under paragraph (b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: debt-related derivative contracts referred to in that subsection in respect of which the underlying debt securities are issued by a sovereign with a credit quality grade of 3 or 4 as determined under paragraph (b),

paragraph.continued: if, and only if, those debt securities or, in the case of those debt-related derivative contracts, those underlying debt securities, are denominated in the domestic currency of that sovereign and funded by the institution in that currency. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may only include in the qualifying class in Table 28—

paragraph.name: a
aa
paragraph.leadIn: debt securities issued by public sector entities, and debt-related derivative contracts where the underlying debt securities are issued by public sector entities, where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraphs (ii) and (iii), the debt securities or the underlying debt securities, as the case may be, are assigned a credit quality grade of 3 or 4; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of subparagraph (i), the credit quality grade is determined as one grade below that assigned to the sovereign, pursuant to subsection (3)(b) and (c), of the jurisdiction in which the public sector entity concerned is incorporated or, if there is no such lower credit quality grade, the credit quality grade assigned to that sovereign pursuant to that subsection; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the institution treats as unrated any of those debt securities, or any of those underlying debt securities, as the case may be, where—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: they do not have an ECAI issue specific rating; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the sovereign of the jurisdiction in which the public sector entity is incorporated does not have an ECAI issuer rating; (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: debt securities, not falling within paragraph (a) or (aa), that are rated investment grade and debt-related derivative contracts where the underlying debt securities, not falling within paragraph (a) or (aa), that are rated investment grade; and (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the debt securities, or the underlying debt securities, as the case may be, are assessed as equivalent to investment grade under the institution’s rating system on the basis that the debt securities, or the underlying debt securities, as the case may be, have a PD assigned by the institution’s rating system of not more than the PD implied by the long run average PD (being a period which captures a reasonable mix of high-default and low-default years of an economic cycle) of a debt security rated investment grade; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the issuer of the debt securities, or the issuer of the underlying debt securities, as the case may be—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: has any debt securities or equities listed on a recognized stock exchange; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is subject to supervisory arrangements regarding the maintenance of adequate capital to support its business activities comparable to those prescribed for authorized institutions under the Ordinance and these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include any debt securities in the non-qualifying class in Table 28 if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the debt securities are not issued by a sovereign; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the debt securities are not included in the qualifying class under subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: include any debt-related derivative contracts in the non-qualifying class in Table 28 if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the underlying debt securities are not issued by a sovereign; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the debt-related derivative contracts are not included in the qualifying class under subsection (4); (L.N. 137 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: include any debt securities issued by public sector entities, and any debt-related derivative contracts where the underlying debt securities are issued by public sector entities, in the non-qualifying class in Table 28 that assigns a credit quality grade of 6 if the application of subsection (4)(aa)(ii) to the debt securities or the underlying debt securities, as the case may be, results in the debt securities or underlying debt securities, as the case may be, being assigned a credit quality grade of 7. (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: If the issuer of any debt securities referred to in this section or, in the case of any debt-related derivative contracts referred to in this section, the issuer of any underlying debt securities, has more than one ECAI issuer rating assigned to the issuer, an authorized institution must, for the purposes of this section, apply section 54E(2), with all necessary modifications, to the ECAI issuer ratings concerned (as if the references to ECAI issue specific ratings in that subsection were references to ECAI issuer ratings) to ascertain which one of them must be used for those purposes. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

If any debt securities referred to in this section or, in the case of any debt-related derivative contracts referred to in this section, any underlying debt securities, have more than one ECAI issue specific rating assigned to them, an authorized institution must, for the purposes of this section, apply section 54E(2), with all necessary modifications, to the ECAI issue specific ratings concerned to ascertain which one of them must be used for those purposes. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority is satisfied that an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for specific risk is underestimated for any non-qualifying debt securities (being debt securities falling within subsection (5)(a)) or non-qualifying debt-related derivative contracts (being debt-related derivative contracts falling within subsection (5)(b)) which have a high yield to redemption relative to debt securities or debt-related derivative contracts falling within subsection (3)(b), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: prohibit offsetting, for the purposes of calculating the institution’s market risk capital charge for general market risk between such debt securities or debt-related derivative contracts and such other debt securities or debt-related derivative contracts as specified in the notice.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subsection (8).

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), the market risk capital charge for specific risk for an authorized institution’s positions in a credit derivative contract (other than an nth-to-default credit derivative contract) may be capped at the maximum possible loss arising from the contract calculated for each individual position as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the institution is a protection buyer, the change in the value of the contract in the event that all the reference obligations specified in the contract were to become immediately default risk-free; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the institution is a protection seller, the change in the value of the contract in the event that all the reference obligations specified in the contract were to default immediately with zero recoveries; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for each position an authorized institution has in an nth-to-default credit derivative contract or nth-to-default credit-linked note, irrespective of whether the institution is a protection buyer or a protection seller—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the market risk capital charge for specific risk for the contract or note, where n is equal to 1, is to be the lesser of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the sum of the market risk capital charge for specific risk for the individual reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract or note, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the institution’s maximum liability under the contract or the fair value of the note, as the case may be; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the market risk capital charge for specific risk for the contract or note, where n is greater than 1, is to be the lesser of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the sum of the market risk capital charge for specific risk for the individual reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the contract or note, as the case may be, but disregarding the (n-1) obligation with the lowest market risk capital charge for specific risk; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the institution’s maximum liability under the contract or the fair value of the note, as the case may be. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this section does not apply to interest rate derivative contracts.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: ECAI issue specific rating (ECAI特定債項評級), in relation to a debt security or, in the case of a debt-related derivative contract, the underlying debt security, means a short-term credit assessment rating or long-term credit assessment rating that is assigned to the debt security or underlying debt security, as the case may be, by a Type A ECAI or a Type B ECAI; (L.N. 167 of 2023)

ECAI issuer rating (ECAI發債人評級), in relation to the issuer of a debt security or, in the case of a debt-related derivative contract, the underlying debt security, means a long-term credit assessment rating that is assigned to the issuer by a Type A ECAI or a Type B ECAI; (L.N. 167 of 2023)
sovereign (官方實體) includes a sovereign foreign public sector entity.

section.name: s287A
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for specific risk for interest rate exposures that fall within section 286(a)(ii)
section.content: An authorized institution must calculate the market risk capital charge for specific risk arising from each of its net positions in securitization exposures held in the trading book that fall within section 286(a)(ii) by multiplying each of those net positions by a market risk capital charge factor that is equal to the risk-weight, determined as if the net position were held in the banking book in accordance with Part 7, divided by 12.5.

section.name: s288
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for general market risk

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for general market risk—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: multiply its long and short positions in interest rate exposures in each time band specified in column 1 of Table 30 within the maturity ladder constructed in accordance with section 289 by the appropriate risk-weight specified in column 4 of that Table;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: apply a market risk capital charge factor of 10% on the matched position (being the lesser of the absolute values of the total risk-weighted long and short positions) of each time band, whether long or short, to arrive at a market risk capital charge for each matched position (referred to in this section as vertical disallowance);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (2) and (3)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: first conduct a round of horizontal offsetting between the net risk-weighted positions for the time bands in each of the 3 zones subject to a scale of market risk capital charge factors, expressed as a percentage of the matched positions for each zone, as set out in Table 29;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: then conduct a round of horizontal offsetting between the total net risk-weighted positions for the zones across the 3 zones (being between adjacent zones and between zone 1 and zone 3) subject to a scale of market risk capital charge factors, expressed as a percentage of the matched positions between the zones, as set out in Table 29,

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: apply a market risk capital charge factor of 100% on the remaining net risk-weighted long or short position in interest rate exposures after carrying out the offsetting referred to in paragraphs (b) and (d).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an authorized institution conducting horizontal offsetting under subsection (1)(d)(i), the institution shall—

subparagraph.name: i

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: offset the positions of time bands within the same zone to create the matched position to which the market risk capital charge factor is applied under paragraph (b) and a total net risk-weighted long or short position for each zone.

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (d), in the case of opposite positions between zone 1 and zone 3, subject the matched position (being the lesser of the absolute values of the total net risk-weighted long or short position in zone 1 and the total net risk-weighted short or long position respectively in zone 3) to a market risk capital charge factor of 100%; and

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall derive the market risk capital charge for general market risk for its portfolio of interest rate exposures by aggregating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total market risk capital charge for vertical disallowance for all time bands calculated in accordance with subsection (1)(c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total market risk capital charge for horizontal disallowance for individual zones and across different zones calculated in accordance with subsection (1)(d); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the market risk capital charge for the remaining net risk-weighted long or short position calculated in accordance with subsection (1)(e).

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall calculate the market risk capital charge for general market risk for each currency separately, convert each amount so calculated into Hong Kong dollars at current market rates and then aggregate the amounts so calculated.

section.name: s289
section.heading: Construction of maturity ladder

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4), (5) and (6), for the purposes of making the calculation required by section 288(1), an authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: slot all of its long or short positions in debt securities, debt-related derivative contracts, interest rate derivative contracts and interest rate exposures arising from equity-related derivative contracts and commodity-related derivative contracts with a coupon of not less than 3% per annum into a maturity ladder comprising the 13 time bands set out in columns 1 and 2 of Table 30; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: slot all of its long or short positions in debt securities, debt-related derivative contracts, interest rate derivative contracts and interest rate exposures arising from equity-related derivative contracts and commodity-related derivative contracts with a coupon of less than 3% per annum into a maturity ladder comprising the 15 time bands set out in columns 1 and 3 of Table 30.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: slot fixed rate exposures into the time bands set out in Table 30 in accordance with their respective residual maturities;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: regard interest rate exposures arising from derivative contracts as long and short positions and slot such positions into the time bands set out in Table 30 such that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: interest rate futures contracts, interest rate forward contracts and forward rate agreements are treated as a combination of the long and short positions in a zero-coupon specific risk-free security whereby—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: a long or short position in an interest rate futures contract or interest rate forward contract is to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: a short or long position respectively with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the delivery date of the underlying interest rate contract; and

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: a long or short position respectively with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the delivery date of the underlying interest rate contract plus the contract period of the underlying interest rate contract; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: a sold or purchased forward rate agreement is to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: a short or long position respectively with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the settlement date of the agreement; and

subparagraph.name: II
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: bond futures contracts and bond forward contracts are treated as a combination of the long and short positions in a zero-coupon specific risk-free security and the underlying bond whereby a long or short position in a bond futures contract or bond forward contract is to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a short or long position respectively in a zero-coupon specific risk-free security with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the delivery date of the underlying bond; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a long or short position respectively in the underlying bond with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the delivery date of the underlying bond plus the tenor of the underlying bond;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: interest rate swap contracts under which the institution receives or pays floating rate interest and pays or receives respectively fixed rate interest are to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a short or long position respectively in a fixed rate instrument with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the maturity date of the swap contract concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a long or short position respectively in a floating rate instrument with a maturity being the remaining period up to and including the next interest fixing date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exclude from the maturity ladder long and short positions in identical instruments having the same issuer, coupon, currency and maturity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fully offset the matched positions in a futures contract or forward contract and the underlying exposure of the futures contract or forward contract, as the case may be, except that the position in a zero-coupon specific risk-free security referred to in subsection (2)(c)(ii)(A) shall be included in the calculation of the institution’s market risk capital charge for general market risk.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a futures contract or forward contract providing for a range of bonds to be delivered, may only offset positions in the contract and the underlying bond which is readily identifiable as the most profitable for the institution with a short position to deliver;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall, after offsetting the positions in the futures contract or forward contract and the underlying bond pursuant to paragraph (a), record the amount of the remaining long position of the contract, up to and including the delivery date of the contract, as the face value of the contract divided by the conversion factor applicable to the contract and multiplied by the current market price of that bond as determined in accordance with section 4A as if measured at fair value. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (6), for the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution may treat opposite positions in the same type of derivative contract (including the delta-weighted position of option contracts calculated in accordance with section 303) as matched and may fully offset them.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), positions in the same type of derivative contract are opposite only if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: in the case of swap contracts and forward rate agreements, the rates (for floating rate positions) of the contracts or agreements, as the case may be, are identical and the coupons are within 15 basis points; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of swap contracts, forward rate agreements and forward contracts, the next interest fixing date or, for fixed coupon positions or forward contracts, the residual maturity, corresponds within the following limits—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if either of the contracts or agreements, as the case may be, to be offset has an interest fixing date or residual maturity of not more than one month, the interest fixing date or residual maturity, as the case may be, is the same for both contracts or agreements, as the case may be;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if either of the contracts or agreements, as the case may be, to be offset has an interest fixing date or residual maturity of more than one month but not more than one year, the interest fixing dates or residual maturities, as the case may be, are within 7 days of each other; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if either of the contracts or agreements, as the case may be, to be offset has an interest fixing date or residual maturity of more than one year, the interest fixing dates or residual maturities, as the case may be, are within 30 days of each other.

section.name: s290
section.heading: Use of alternatives requires Monetary Authority’s prior consent
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use the methodology prescribed in this Division to calculate its positions to be included in the maturity ladder unless it has the prior consent of the Monetary Authority to use a different methodology; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use the maturity method to calculate the market risk capital charge for general market risk for its portfolio of interest rate exposures unless it has the prior consent of the Monetary Authority to use a different method.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Equity Exposures

section.name: s291
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for its trading book positions (whether long or short) in equities and equity-related derivative contracts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculate the market risk capital charge for specific risk for each of those positions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculate the market risk capital charge for general market risk for those positions.

section.name: s292
section.heading: Preliminary steps to calculating market risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 291—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), an authorized institution shall make a separate calculation for each of its positions in equities and equity-related derivative contracts for each exchange where the equities or, in the case of equity-related derivative contracts, the underlying equities concerned are listed or traded;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized institution shall convert its equity-related derivative contracts into positions in the underlying equity by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: valuing its futures contracts and forward contracts relating to an individual equity at the fair value of the underlying equity;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: valuing its futures contracts relating to equity indices as—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the current index value multiplied by the monetary value of one index point set by the futures exchange where the futures contract is traded; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the fair value of the underlying basket of equities used to compile the index;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized institution shall regard each of its equity swap contracts as long and short positions such that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an equity swap contract under which the institution—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is receiving an amount based on the change in value of a particular equity or equity index; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is paying an amount based on the change in value of a different equity or equity index,

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if equities are to be received or delivered under a forward contract, an authorized institution shall treat any interest rate exposure arising out of the contract under the maturity method; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an authorized institution shall treat any interest rate exposure arising out of an equity futures contract or an equity index futures contract under the maturity method.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 291, an authorized institution may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: offset a futures contract in a given equity against an opposite position in the same equity.

section.name: s293
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for specific risk
section.content: Subject to section 292, an authorized institution shall calculate the market risk capital charge for specific risk for the institution’s trading book positions in equities and equity-related derivative contracts as 8% of its total gross (long plus short) position.

section.name: s294
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for general market risk

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2) and section 292, an authorized institution shall calculate the market risk capital charge for general market risk for the institution’s trading book positions in equities and equity-related derivative contracts as 8% of its total net position in equities and equity-related derivative contracts (being the difference between the sum of the institution’s long positions and the sum of the institution’s short positions). (L.N. 137 of 2011)
An authorized institution shall not, for the purposes of subsection (1), offset net long and short positions on different exchanges.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Foreign Exchange (Including Gold) Exposures

section.name: s295
section.heading: Preliminary steps to calculating market risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for its positions in foreign exchange (including gold) and exchange rate-related derivative contracts— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: convert each amount determined under paragraph (a) into Hong Kong dollars at current market rates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to Division 7, in relation to those positions arising from foreign currency option contracts, apply paragraphs (a) and (b) to each currency to which the option contracts relate.

section.name: s296
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and section 295, an authorized institution shall calculate the market risk capital charge for the institution’s positions in foreign exchange (including gold) as 8% of its total net open position derived by aggregating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sum of the institution’s net long or short positions less its United States dollars position against its Hong Kong dollars position; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s net position in gold (whether long or short).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the sum of an authorized institution’s net long or short positions is the sum of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its total net long or short position in each foreign currency (including gold and, if applicable, the net delta-weighted position of option contracts in each such currency); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its Hong Kong dollars position; (L.N. 267 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the United States dollars position against the Hong Kong dollars position in respect of an authorized institution is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: zero if the institution’s net open positions in United States dollars and Hong Kong dollars are both long or both short;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the smaller of the 2 positions (expressed as the absolute value) if the institution’s net open positions in United States dollars and Hong Kong dollars are opposite positions.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Commodity Exposures

section.name: s297
section.heading: Preliminary steps to calculating market risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for its positions in commodities and commodity-related derivative contracts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: convert its gross (long plus short) position in each commodity to which those positions relate (measured in barrels, kilograms or grams or such other standard unit of measurement as is applicable to the commodity concerned) into monetary terms at the current market price of the commodity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to Division 7, treat positions arising from commodity option contracts as commodity exposures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: value a futures contract or forward contract relating to a commodity by reference to the notional amount of the standard unit of measurement of the commodity converted into monetary terms at current market price and apply the maturity method to any interest rate exposure arising out of that contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a commodity swap contract under which one leg of the swap contract relates to a position or series of positions referenced to a fixed price and the other leg of the swap contract relates to a position or series of positions referenced to the current market price of a reference commodity or commodities—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for each payment under the swap contract, value each of the positions at the notional amount of the swap contract;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: treat each such position—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as long if the institution is paying at a fixed price and receiving at a floating market price; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: as short if the institution is receiving at a fixed price and paying at a floating market price; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: treat any such leg which involves receiving or paying at a fixed or floating interest rate as an interest rate exposure to which the maturity method applies.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), may, for the purposes referred to in subsection (1), offset long and short positions in the same commodity when calculating its open positions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not so offset its positions in different types of commodities.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: current market price (現行市場價格) means the current market price as determined in accordance with section 4A as if measured at fair value. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

section.name: s298
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall calculate the market risk capital charge for its commodity exposures as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 15% of the institution’s net position in each commodity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3% of the institution’s gross (long plus short) position in each commodity.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Option Exposures: General

section.name: s299
section.heading: Approaches which authorized institution may use to calculate market risk capital charge for option exposures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for its option exposures to debt securities, interest rates, equities, foreign exchange (including gold) and commodities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c) and section 300, use the simplified approach;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c) and section 302, use the delta-plus approach; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, use another approach.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Option Exposures: Simplified Approach

section.name: s300
section.heading: Application of Division 8

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall not use the simplified approach to calculate the market risk capital charge for its option exposures unless the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purchases option contracts but does not write option contracts; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: purchases option contracts and only writes option contracts which are fully hedged by matched long positions in the same option contracts.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution which uses the simplified approach to calculate the market risk capital charge for its option exposures shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: exclude from that calculation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: option contracts written by it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the corresponding purchased option contracts which fully hedge the option contracts referred to in subparagraph (i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: only use its outstanding purchased option contracts for that calculation.

section.name: s301
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for outstanding purchased option contracts

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), an authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for its outstanding purchased option contracts (with or without related positions in the underlying exposures of those option contracts)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the institution has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a long position in a put option contract and a long position in the underlying exposure of the put option contract; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a long position in a call option contract and a short position in the underlying exposure of the call option contract,

paragraph.continued: multiply the fair value of the position in the underlying exposure of the option contract by the sum of the market risk capital charge factors for general market risk and specific risk for the position in the underlying exposure of such option contract as set out in Table 31 less the amount by which the option contract is in-the-money (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the institution has a long position in a put option contract or a long position in a call option contract, use the lesser of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fair value of the underlying exposure of the option contract multiplied by the sum of the market risk capital charge factors for general market risk and specific risk for the underlying exposure of such option contract as set out in Table 31; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the fair value of the option contract; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate in a way such that—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the institution uses the sum of the market risk capital charge for individual option contracts to calculate the total market risk capital charge for its portfolio of option exposures.

content.b: Market Risk Capital Charge Factor for Each Risk Category
