tr.td: as per the market risk capital charge factors for specific risk set out in Table 28 according to the class, credit quality grade and residual maturity
as per the risk-weights set out in Table 30 according to the residual maturity for fixed rate exposures or residual term to next interest fixing date for floating rate exposures and coupon rate

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), where the amount derived from the calculation under that subsection is negative, an authorized institution shall treat the market risk capital charge for the relevant outstanding purchased option contract and the position in the underlying exposure of such option contract as zero.

Where it is unclear to an authorized institution which side of an option contract purchased by it constitutes the underlying exposure for the purposes of the simplified approach, the institution shall take the exposure which would be received by it if the option under the contract were exercised to be the underlying exposure for this purpose.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for an option contract purchased by it which has a residual maturity of more than 6 months—

paragraph.name: a
b

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall add the market risk capital charge calculated under this Division to the market risk capital charge calculated for the risk category concerned.

division.name: D9
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Option Exposures: Delta-plus Approach

section.name: s302
section.heading: Application of Division 9
section.leadIn: An authorized institution which writes option contracts (other than such an authorized institution which, by virtue of section 300(1)(b), uses the simplified approach) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: incorporate the delta-weighted positions of its outstanding option contracts into their respective risk categories; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: calculate and provide the following market risk capital charges against those positions—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the market risk capital charge for general market risk and specific risk for delta risk;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the market risk capital charge for gamma risk; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the market risk capital charge for vega risk.

section.name: s303
section.heading: Delta risk
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for the purposes of calculating its delta risk—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: slot its delta-weighted positions which have debt securities or interest rates as the underlying exposures of the relevant option contracts into the time bands set out in Table 30;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: treat its interest rate option contracts as having long and short positions such that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one position is referenced to the time the option contract concerned takes effect; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the other position is referenced to the time the option contract concerned matures;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (d), calculate the market risk capital charge for its option contracts with equities or equity indices as the underlying exposure by applying the calculation treatment under Division 4 to the delta-weighted positions of those option contracts;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (c), treat equities or equity indices on each exchange as a separate underlying exposure;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: calculate the market risk capital charge for its option contracts with foreign exchange or gold as the underlying exposure by applying the calculation treatment under Division 5 to the net delta-weighted positions (being the difference between the institution’s total delta-weighted long positions and its total delta-weighted short positions) of those option contracts; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: calculate the market risk capital charge for its option contracts with commodities as the underlying exposure by applying the calculation treatment under Division 6 to the delta-weighted positions of those option contracts.

section.name: s304
section.heading: Gamma risk

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall calculate the gamma impact of each of its option contracts by the use of Formula 28.

text.b: Calculation of Gamma Impact of Option Contracts

tr.td: variation of the underlying exposure of the option contract calculated as—

for option contracts relating to debt securities, debt security indices and interest rates, the fair value of that underlying exposure multiplied by the risk-weight for the appropriate time band set out in Table 30;
for option contracts relating to equities and equity indices, the fair value of that underlying exposure multiplied by 8%;
for option contracts relating to commodities, the fair value of that underlying exposure multiplied by 15%.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an authorized institution shall treat the following positions as the same underlying exposure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for interest rate exposures, positions within each time band set out in Table 30;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for equities and equity indices exposures, positions on each exchange;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for foreign exchange and gold exposures, positions in each currency pair and gold; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for commodity exposures, positions in each commodity.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: offset the positive and negative gamma impacts for each option contract on the same underlying exposure to produce a positive or negative net gamma impact for that exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: only use negative net gamma impacts to calculate the market risk capital charge for gamma risk.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall calculate the total market risk capital charge for gamma risk as the sum of the absolute value of the negative net gamma impacts.

section.name: s305
section.heading: Vega risk

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall calculate the market risk capital charge for vega risk by multiplying the sum of the vegas for all its option contracts on the same underlying exposure, applying section 304(2) by a positive or negative change of 25% in the volatility of the value of the underlying exposures of those option contracts. (L.N. 267 of 2006)

An authorized institution shall calculate the total market risk capital charge for vega risk as the sum of the absolute value of the individual market risk capital charges for vega risk calculated under subsection (1).

division.name: D10
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Credit Derivative Contracts Booked in Authorized Institutions’ Trading Book

section.name: s306
section.heading: Application of Division 10

subsection.content: This Division applies to credit derivative contracts booked in an authorized institution’s trading book.

An authorized institution shall use the notional amount of the credit derivative contract to calculate the market risk capital charge for its credit derivative contracts except for section 312(6) and (7) where the fair value of the credit-linked note shall be used.

section.name: s307
section.heading: Specific risk

subsection.content: Where an authorized institution has entered into a total return swap or credit default swap as the protection seller, the institution shall record a long position in the reference obligation specified in the swap contract.

Where an authorized institution has entered into a total return swap or credit default swap as the protection buyer, the institution shall record a short position in the reference obligation specified in the swap contract.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution has purchased a credit-linked note, the institution shall record a long position in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference obligation specified in the note; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the note issuer.

subsection.content: Where an authorized institution has issued a credit-linked note, the institution shall record a short position in the reference obligation specified in the note.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), an authorized institution must, for the purposes of calculating the market risk capital charge for specific risk for nth-to-default credit derivative contracts that fall within section 286(a)(iv)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), apply section 287 and Division 10; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the nth-to-default credit derivative contract has an ECAI issue specific rating, in respect of positions in which the institution is the protection seller, apply section 287A as if that contract were a securitization exposure. (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 156 of 2012; L.N. 175 of 2017; L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), for the purposes of subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), where an authorized institution has a position in one of the reference obligations underlying a first-to-default credit derivative contract and the contract hedges that position, the institution may offset with respect to the hedged amount—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its position in the reference obligation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that part of the market risk capital charge for specific risk for the credit derivative contract that relates to the reference obligation in which the institution has that position; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where an authorized institution has multiple positions in the reference obligations underlying a first-to-default credit derivative contract, the offsetting of market risk capital charge otherwise allowed under paragraph (a) is allowed only for its positions in the underlying reference obligation having the lowest market risk capital charge for specific risk. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6), an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must offset the long and short positions in identical first-to-default credit derivative contracts before applying that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not offset the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its position in any nth-to-default credit derivative contract, where n is greater than 1, with the market risk capital charge for its position in any underlying reference obligation. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.content: Where an authorized institution enters into a credit default swap, total return swap or credit-linked note which provides for payment to be made proportionately in respect of the reference obligations in the basket of reference obligations specified in the swap contract or note, as the case may be, the institution shall record its positions in the reference obligations according to their respective proportions specified in the swap contract or note, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution has purchased or issued a credit-linked note which is referenced to multiple reference obligations and satisfies the conditions for a qualifying debt security or debt-related derivative contract set out in section 287(4), the institution may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it has purchased the note, record the specific risk arising from its long positions in the multiple reference obligations specified in the note as a single long position in the note;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it has issued the note, record the specific risk arising from its short positions in the multiple reference obligations specified in the note as a single short position in the note.

section.name: s308
section.heading: Use of credit derivative contracts to offset specific risk

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2) and section 307(6), an authorized institution may use a credit derivative contract booked in the institution’s trading book to offset the market risk capital charge for specific risk calculated for the institution’s trading book position in the underlying exposure in accordance with section 309, 310 or 311. (L.N. 137 of 2011)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution may use a credit derivative contract booked in the institution’s trading book to offset the market risk capital charge for specific risk calculated for the institution’s trading book position in another credit derivative contract in accordance with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 309 (excluding section 309(1)(b)) with all necessary modifications;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 310 with all necessary modifications; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 311 (excluding section 311(1)(a)) with all necessary modifications. (L.N. 51 of 2013)

subsection.content: Where section 309, 310 or 311 does not permit an authorized institution to use a credit derivative contract booked in the institution’s trading book to offset the market risk capital charge for specific risk calculated for the institution’s trading book position in the underlying exposure or in another credit derivative contract, the institution shall calculate and provide the market risk capital charge against both trading book positions.

section.name: s309
section.heading: Offsetting in full

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 308(1), an authorized institution may offset 100% of the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its position in a credit derivative contract against that for a position in the underlying exposure which is identical to the reference obligation specified in the contract where the values of the 2 positions, being the long or short position in the contract, and the short or long position respectively in the underlying exposure which is identical to the reference obligation specified in the contract, always move in the opposite direction and broadly to the same extent due to— (L.N. 51 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the 2 positions consisting of identical exposures; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a long or short position in the underlying exposure being hedged by a total return swap and there being a match between the reference obligation specified in the total return swap and the position in the underlying exposure in every respect, and notwithstanding that the maturity of the total return swap may be different from that of the position in the underlying exposure.

subsection.content: Where an authorized institution offsets the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its positions pursuant to subsection (1), no market risk capital charge for specific risk is required to be calculated in respect of those positions. (L.N. 51 of 2013)

section.name: s310
section.heading: Offsetting by 80%

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 308(1), an authorized institution may offset 80% of the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its position in a credit derivative contract against that for a position in the underlying exposure which is identical to the reference obligation specified in the contract where— (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 51 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the values of the 2 positions, being the long or short position in the contract, and the short or long position respectively in the underlying exposure which is identical to the reference obligation specified in the contract, always move in the opposite direction but not broadly to the same extent as set out in section 309(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the contract can mitigate the credit risk of the institution’s position in the underlying exposure effectively.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the demonstration referred to in subsection (1)(b), an authorized institution falls within that subsection in any case where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b), (c) and (d), the institution’s long or short position in the underlying exposure referred to in that subsection is effectively hedged by a credit default swap or credit-linked note;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there is a match between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reference obligation specified in the credit default swap or credit-linked note referred to in paragraph (a) and the position in the underlying exposure;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the maturity of the reference obligation specified in the credit default swap or credit-linked note referred to in paragraph (a) and of the swap contract or note, as the case may be; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the currency in which the credit default swap or credit-linked note referred to in paragraph (a) and the position in the underlying exposure are denominated; (L.N. 51 of 2013)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the credit event definitions and settlement mechanisms and other key factors of the credit default swap or credit-linked note referred to in paragraph (a) do not cause the price movement of the swap contract or note, as the case may be, to materially deviate from the price movement of the position in the underlying exposure; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the credit default swap or credit-linked note referred to in paragraph (a) transfers risk effectively taking account of any restrictive payout provisions (including fixed payouts and materiality thresholds).

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution offsets the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its positions pursuant to subsection (1)— (L.N. 51 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: only 20% of the market risk capital charge for specific risk is required to be calculated for the position with the higher market risk capital charge for specific risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the market risk capital charge for specific risk to be calculated for the other position shall be zero.

section.name: s311
section.heading: Other offsetting

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 308(1), an authorized institution may offset partially the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its position in a credit derivative contract against that for a position in the underlying exposure where the values of the 2 positions, being the long or short position in the contract, and the short or long position respectively in the underlying exposure, usually move in the opposite direction in any case where— (L.N. 137 of 2011; L.N. 51 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the positions would fall within section 309(1)(b) but for there being an asset mismatch between the reference obligation specified in the contract and the position in the underlying exposure (being that the reference obligation and the position in the underlying exposure are similar but not identical) and— (L.N. 51 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reference obligation specified in the contract ranks for payment or repayment equally with, or junior to, the position in the underlying exposure; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the obligor in respect of the position in the underlying exposure is the same legal entity as the obligor in respect of the reference obligation and legally enforceable cross default or cross acceleration clauses are included in the terms of the position in the underlying exposure and the reference obligation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the positions would fall within section 309(1)(a) or 310 but for there being a currency or maturity mismatch between the contract and the position in the underlying exposure; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the positions would fall within section 310 but for there being an asset mismatch between the reference obligation specified in the contract and the position in the underlying exposure (being that the reference obligation and the position in the underlying exposure are similar but not identical) and the position in the underlying exposure is included in one of the deliverable obligations specified in the contract. (L.N. 51 of 2013)

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution offsets the market risk capital charge for specific risk for its positions pursuant to subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 100% of the market risk capital charge for specific risk is required to be calculated for the position with the higher market risk capital charge for specific risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the market risk capital charge for specific risk to be calculated for the other position is to be zero. (L.N. 51 of 2013)

section.name: s312
section.heading: General market risk

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution has entered into a total return swap as the protection seller, the institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record a long position in the reference obligation specified in the swap contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are periodic interest payments under the swap contract, record a short position in a specific risk-free security with fixed or floating rate interest according to the payment terms of the swap contract.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution has entered into a total return swap as the protection buyer, the institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record a short position in the reference obligation specified in the swap contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are periodic interest payments under the swap contract, record a long position in a specific risk-free security with fixed or floating rate interest according to the payment terms of the swap contract.

subsection.content: Where an authorized institution has entered into a credit default swap with no periodic premiums or interest payments under the swap contract, the institution is not required to calculate or provide the market risk capital charge for general market risk for the swap contract.

Where an authorized institution has entered into a credit default swap as the protection seller with periodic premiums or interest payments under the swap contract, the institution shall record a long position in a specific risk-free security with fixed or floating rate interest according to the payment terms of the swap contract.

Where an authorized institution has entered into a credit default swap as the protection buyer with periodic premiums or interest payments under the swap contract, the institution shall record a short position in a specific risk-free security with fixed or floating rate interest according to the payment terms of the swap contract.
Where an authorized institution has purchased a credit-linked note, the institution shall record a long position in the note.
Where an authorized institution has issued a credit-linked note, the institution shall record a short position in the note.

division.name: D13
division.heading: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge under IMA

section.name: s322A
section.heading: Application of Division 13

subsection.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that uses the IMA to calculate its market risk capital charge.

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a reference to an approved trading desk is a reference to a trading desk specified in an approval under section 18(2)(a).

section.name: s322B
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount for market risk before first anniversary of commencement of profit and loss attribution test

subsection.content: This section applies at any time before the first anniversary of the day on which section 322G comes into operation*.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its risk-weighted amount for market risk as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the product of 12.5 and the market risk capital charge calculated under section 322D for all approved trading desks that fulfil the back-testing requirements in section 322G(1), independent of the zone they are assigned to in the profit and loss attribution test; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the risk-weighted amount for market risk calculated under the STM approach for—

subparagraph.content: approved trading desks to which section 19A applies; and
trading desks that are not approved trading desks.

section.name: s322C
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount for market risk on and after first anniversary of commencement of profit and loss attribution test

subsection.content: This section applies at any time on or after the first anniversary of the day on which section 322G comes into operation*.

subsection.leadIn: If none of the approved trading desks of an authorized institution is assigned to the yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test under section 322G(4), the institution must calculate its risk-weighted amount for market risk as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the product of 12.5 and the market risk capital charge calculated under section 322D for all approved trading desks that fulfil the back-testing requirements in section 322G(1) and are assigned to the green zone in the profit and loss attribution test; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the risk-weighted amount for market risk calculated under the STM approach for—

subparagraph.content: approved trading desks to which section 19A applies; and
trading desks that are not approved trading desks.

subsection.leadIn: If at least one approved trading desk of an authorized institution is assigned to the yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test under section 322G(4), the institution must calculate its risk-weighted amount for market risk in accordance with Formula 28A.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Risk-weighted Amount with at least One Approved Trading Desk in Yellow Zone

subsection.leadIn: where—

td.p: Cu is the market risk capital charge calculated under the STM approach for approved trading desks to which section 19A applies and trading desks that are not approved trading desks;

IMAG,Y is the market risk capital charge calculated under section 322D for all approved trading desks that fulfil the back-testing requirements in section 322G(1) and are assigned to the green or yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test;
SAall desks is the market risk capital charge for all trading desks calculated under the STM approach; and

SAG,Y is the market risk capital charge calculated under the STM approach for all approved trading desks that fulfil the back-testing requirements in section 322G(1) and are assigned to the green or yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test.

section.name: s322D
section.heading: Calculation of market risk capital charge for approved trading desks under IMA

subsection.content: This section applies to the calculation of an authorized institution’s market risk capital charge for approved trading desks that fulfil the back-testing requirements in section 322G(1) and are assigned to the green or yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate the market risk capital charge by using its internal models as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the greater of the following—

subparagraph.leadIn: the sum of—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: the institution’s latest available market risk capital charge for NMRFs, calculated in accordance with subsection (4);

subparagraph.leadIn: the sum of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the average market risk capital charge for modellable risk factors, calculated in accordance with subsection (3), for the last 60 trading days, multiplied by a multiplication factor mc determined under section 322E(1); and

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the default risk charge.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate the market risk capital charge for modellable risk factors by using its internal models in accordance with Formula 28B.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for Modellable Risk Factors

subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: IMCC is the market risk capital charge for modellable risk factors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: IMCC(C) is the unconstrained ES capital charge at the portfolio-wide level, with no constraint on cross-risk class correlations, calculated in accordance with Formula 28C; and

leadIn.b: Calculation of Unconstrained ES Capital Charge

paragraph.leadIn: where—

td.p: IMCC(C) is the unconstrained ES capital charge at the portfolio-wide level;
ESR,C is the current ES calculated under subsection (7) with the reduced set of modellable risk factors across all 5 risk classes; and
ESR,S is the stressed ES calculated under subsection (7) with the reduced set of modellable risk factors across all 5 risk classes.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: IMCC(Ci) is the constrained ES capital charge at the risk class level calculated in accordance with Formula 28D.

leadIn.b: Calculation of Constrained ES Capital Charge

paragraph.leadIn: where—

td.p: ESR,C,i is the current ES calculated under subsection (7) with the reduced set of modellable risk factors within risk class i; and
ESR,S,i is the stressed ES calculated under subsection (7) with the reduced set of modellable risk factors within risk class i.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate the market risk capital charge for NMRFs by using its internal models in accordance with Formula 28E.

content.b: Calculation of Market Risk Capital Charge for NMRFs

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: SES is the market risk capital charge for NMRFs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ISESNM,i is the stress scenario capital charge for the idiosyncratic credit spread NMRF i from the I risk factors where the institution has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it is appropriate to aggregate all I idiosyncratic credit spread NMRFs with a zero correlation assumption;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ISESNM,j is the stress scenario capital charge for the idiosyncratic equity NMRF j from the J risk factors where the institution has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it is appropriate to aggregate all J idiosyncratic equity NMRFs with a zero correlation assumption; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: SESNM,k is the stress scenario capital charge for the NMRF k other than the I idiosyncratic credit spread NMRFs and the J idiosyncratic equity NMRFs.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of calculating the current ES and stressed ES for the purposes of subsection (3), the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obtain the approval of the Monetary Authority to use a reduced set of modellable risk factors and for any update of the set;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regularly review, and update if necessary, the reduced set of modellable risk factors on at least a quarterly basis or whenever there is an update on the stressed ES relevant period under paragraph (c); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: regularly review, and update if necessary, the stressed ES relevant period on at least a quarterly basis or whenever there are material changes in the composition of the portfolio or in the time series of the relevant risk factors in the portfolio.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may grant an approval to an authorized institution under subsection (5)(a) if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reduced set of modellable risk factors are relevant for the institution’s portfolio of exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a sufficiently long history of observations for the reduced set of modellable risk factors; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ES of the reduced set of modellable risk factors is able to explain at least 75% of the variation of the fully specified ES based on all modellable risk factors on average measured over the preceding 12-week period.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate the current ES and stressed ES in accordance with Formula 28F.

content.b: Calculation of Current ES and Stressed ES

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ES is current ES or stressed ES (as the case requires);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: P are positions that are exposed to a set of modellable risk factors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: T is the length of the base liquidity horizon of 10 days;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: EST(P) is the ES at horizon T of a portfolio with positions P with respect to shocks to the modellable risk factors to which positions P are exposed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: EST(P,j) is the ES at horizon T of a portfolio with positions P with respect to shocks to a subset of modellable risk factors with a liquidity horizon that is equal to or longer than LHj to which positions P are exposed, with other modellable risk factors held constant; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: LHj is the liquidity horizon where j ranges from 1 to 5 as follows—
LH1 is 10 days;
LH2 is 20 days;
LH3 is 40 days;
LH4 is 60 days; and
LH5 is 120 days.

section.name: s322E
section.heading: Multiplication factor

subsection.leadIn: The multiplication factor mc to be used by an authorized institution for the purposes of section 322D(2)(a)(ii)(A) is the sum of—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a back-testing add-on specified for the number of back-testing exceptions in Table 32A for the most recent 250 trading days, determined on the basis of—

subparagraph.content: all the positions of all approved trading desks using the IMA; and
the VaR calibrated at a one-tailed 99% confidence level; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any additional back-testing add-on assigned to the institution under subsection (3).

p.class: not_bold align_justified below_space_between_line_8 left_indent_0 right_indent_0 first_line_indent_0

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the number of back-testing exceptions under subsection (1)(b), the institution may exclude any back-testing exception if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the back-testing exception relates to an NMRF the market risk capital charge for which exceeds the actual or the hypothetical loss for the day on which the exception occurs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the back-testing exception does not result from deficiencies of the relevant internal models.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to an authorized institution, assign an additional back-testing add-on to the institution if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the institution satisfies all the requirements specified in Schedule 3 applicable to or in relation to the institution but there is a minor imperfection in the relevant internal models due to an assumption or approximation underlying the models.

section.name: s322F
section.heading: Calculation of stress scenario capital charge

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating its stress scenario capital charge, an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine a common stress scenario across all idiosyncratic credit spread NMRFs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine a common stress scenario across all idiosyncratic equity NMRFs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determine a common stress scenario across all NMRFs within the same risk class that are not idiosyncratic credit spread NMRFs or idiosyncratic equity NMRFs; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: with the approval of the Monetary Authority, determine a common stress scenario across the NMRFs that belong to the same bucket within a curve, surface or cube.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), the model inputs must be calibrated to a 12-month period of significant financial stress to which the institution experiences the largest loss within the set of NMRFs referred to in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d).

section.name: s322G
section.heading: Back-testing requirements and profit and loss attribution test for approved trading desks

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), an approved trading desk fulfils the back-testing requirements if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are no more than 12 back-testing exceptions against the VaR calibrated at a one-tailed 99% confidence level for the most recent 250 trading days; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are no more than 30 back-testing exceptions against the VaR calibrated at a one-tailed 97.5% confidence level for the most recent 250 trading days.

subsection.leadIn: An approved trading desk is assigned to the green zone in the profit and loss attribution test if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Spearman correlation metric is higher than 0.80; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Kolmogorov-Smirnov distribution test metric is lower than 0.09.

subsection.leadIn: An approved trading desk is assigned to the red zone in the profit and loss attribution test if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Spearman correlation metric is lower than 0.70; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Kolmogorov-Smirnov distribution test metric is higher than 0.12.

subsection.content: An approved trading desk is assigned to the yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test if it is not assigned to the green zone under subsection (2) or the red zone under subsection (3).

For the purpose of calculating the number of back-testing exceptions under subsection (1), an authorized institution may exclude any back-testing exception if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the back-testing exception relates to an NMRF the market risk capital charge for which exceeds the actual or the hypothetical loss for the day on which the exception occurs.

section.name: s322H
section.heading: Calculation of capital surcharge for approved trading desks assigned to yellow zone
section.leadIn: At any time on or after the first anniversary of the day on which section 322G comes into operation*, the capital surcharge for an approved trading desk that fulfils the back-testing requirements in section 322G(1) and is assigned to the yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test under section 322G(4) is calculated as the product of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the market risk capital charge calculated under the STM approach for trading desks that are assigned to the green or yellow zone in the profit and loss attribution test minus the market risk capital charge calculated under the IMA for those trading desks, subject to a floor of zero;

paragraph.name: b

part.name: P8A
part.heading: Calculation of CVA Risk Capital Charge

division.name: D1
division.heading: General

section.name: s322I
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 8A
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: CVA delta (CVA得爾塔) means a first order sensitivity to capture the changes in CVA values of an authorized institution’s covered transactions and contracts set out in section 322J due to movements in its non-volatility risk factors;

CVA vega (CVA維加) means a first order sensitivity to capture the changes in CVA values of an authorized institution’s covered transactions and contracts set out in section 322J due to movements in its volatility risk factors;
risk factor (風險因素) has the meaning given by section 281;
RRAO has the meaning given by section 281;
SBM curvature risk (SBM曲率風險) has the meaning given by section 281.

section.name: s322J
section.heading: Transactions and contracts to be covered

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the CVA risk capital charge for the following transactions and contracts in both its trading book and its banking book—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its OTC derivative transactions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)—its SFTs that are fair-valued for accounting purposes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hedges falling within paragraph (a) or (b) that are entered into by it with external counterparties, whether or not those hedges are eligible CVA hedges,

subsection.continued: other than any transactions and contracts specified in Schedule 1A.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority determines an authorized institution’s CVA risk arising from SFTs that are fair-valued for accounting purposes is material, the Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to the institution, require the institution to calculate the CVA risk capital charge for those SFTs.
An authorized institution must include a hedge referred to in subsection (1)(c) in the CVA risk capital charge with respect to the counterparty providing the hedge.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Reduced Basic CVA Approach

section.name: s322K
section.heading: Application of Division 2

subsection.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that uses the reduced basic CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge.
A reference to an authorized institution in this Division is a reference to an authorized institution that uses the reduced basic CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge.

section.name: s322L
section.heading: Calculation of CVA risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its CVA risk capital charge for a portfolio of counterparties by using Formula 28G.

content.b: Calculation of CVA Risk Capital Charge for Portfolio of Counterparties under Reduced Basic CVA Approach

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: SCVAC is the standalone CVA risk capital charge applicable to counterparty c calculated under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The institution must calculate its standalone CVA risk capital charge for each counterparty by using Formula 28H.

content.b: Calculation of CVA Risk Capital Charge for Each Counterparty under Reduced Basic CVA Approach

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: SCVAC is the standalone CVA risk capital charge applicable to counterparty c;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: EADN is the default risk exposure of a netting set N with counterparty c calculated in a manner permitted under the IMM(CCR) approach or SA-CCR approach or the current exposure method or any of the methods set out in Division 2B of Part 6A, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: DFN is a supervisory discount factor of a netting set N with counterparty c, being—

subparagraph.content: if the institution calculates the default risk exposure of the netting set by using the IMM(CCR) approach—a factor of 1; or
if the institution does not have an approval to use the IMM(CCR) approach to calculate the default risk exposure of the netting set—a factor equal to .

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of Formula 28H, the institution must determine the risk-weight applicable to a counterparty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the counterparty has an ECAI issuer rating—by mapping the sector and credit quality of the counterparty based on its ECAI issuer rating to the risk-weights in Table 32B; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the counterparty does not have an ECAI issuer rating—

subparagraph.content: where the institution uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures to the counterparty—by mapping the internal rating of the counterparty to one of the ECAI issuer ratings based on a mapping scheme approved in writing by the Monetary Authority; or

subparagraph.leadIn: where the institution uses the STC approach or BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures to the counterparty—by considering the counterparty as unrated and allocating a risk-weight to the counterparty as such under Table 32B.

leadIn.b: Risk-weights of Counterparties under Reduced Basic CVA Approach

td.p: Non-investment credit quality grade or unrated
Sovereigns including central banks and multilateral development banks
Local government, government-backed non-financials, education and public administration
Basic materials, energy, industrials, agriculture, manufacturing, mining and quarrying
Consumer goods and services, transportation and storage, and administrative and support service activities
Health care, utilities, and professional and technical activities

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of Formula 28H and subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a counterparty has 2 ECAI issuer ratings the use of which would result in the allocation of different risk-weights to the counterparty under Table 32B, the institution must use the higher risk-weight; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if a counterparty has 3 or more ECAI issuer ratings the use of which would result in the allocation of different risk-weights to the counterparty under Table 32B—

subparagraph.content: if the 2 lowest risk-weights are the same—the institution must use that risk-weight; or
if the 2 lowest risk-weights are different—the institution must use the higher risk-weight.

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (c) of Formula 28H, the institution must determine the effective maturity of a netting set as M calculated in accordance with section 168 without having regard to section 168(2), as the case requires.

An approval of a mapping scheme by the Monetary Authority under paragraph (b)(i) of Formula 23J that was in force immediately before the commencement date* of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023 is taken, on and after that date, to be an approval of a mapping scheme by the Monetary Authority under subsection (3)(b)(i) if the mapping scheme is used to map the internal rating of the counterparty to one of the ECAI issuer ratings.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Full Basic CVA Approach

section.name: s322M
section.heading: Application of Division 3

subsection.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that uses the full basic CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge.
A reference to an authorized institution in this Division is a reference to an authorized institution that uses the full basic CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge.

section.name: s322N
section.heading: Calculation of CVA risk capital charge

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its CVA risk capital charge for a portfolio of counterparties by using Formula 28I.

content.b: Calculation of CVA Risk Capital Charge for Portfolio of Counterparties under Full Basic CVA Approach

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: BA_CVAfull is the CVA risk capital charge under the full basic CVA approach;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: BA_CVAreduced is the CVA risk capital charge under the reduced basic CVA approach calculated in accordance with section 322L; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: BA_CVAhedged is the amount calculated under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (c) of Formula 28I, the institution must calculate BA_CVAhedged by using Formula 28J.

paragraph.name: a

division.name: D4
division.heading: Standardized CVA Approach

section.name: s322O
section.heading: Application of Division 4

subsection.content: This Division applies to an authorized institution that uses the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge.
A reference to an authorized institution in this Division is a reference to an authorized institution that uses the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge.

section.name: s322P
section.heading: Calculation of CVA risk capital charge
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its CVA risk capital charge as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its CVA delta risk capital charge under section 322Q for all risk classes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its CVA vega risk capital charge under section 322R for all risk classes except the counterparty credit spread risk class.

section.name: s322Q
section.heading: Calculation of CVA delta risk capital charge

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate its CVA delta risk capital charge separately for each risk class in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: For each risk class, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.leadIn: for interest rate, counterparty credit spread and reference credit spread risk factors; or
for equity, commodity and foreign exchange risk factors,
where CVA(k) is the aggregate CVA as a function of the CVA delta risk factor k.

paragraph.name: b

paragraph.leadIn: for interest rate, counterparty credit spread and reference credit spread risk factors; or
for equity, commodity and foreign exchange risk factors,
where V(k) is the market value of all eligible CVA hedges as a function of the CVA delta risk factor k.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content:

WS_delta k CVA
, for each CVA delta risk factor k as the product of
delta k CVA
and the risk-weight determined under section 322T;

WS_delta k Hdg

paragraph.name: e

WS_delta k Hdg

WS_delta k CVA

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the capital charges for each CVA delta bucket b, Kb_delta, by aggregating the net risk-weighted CVA delta sensitivities within the same bucket in accordance with Formula 28P; and

leadIn.b: Calculation of Capital Charges for Each CVA Delta Bucket

paragraph.leadIn: where ρkl is the correlation parameter between 2 net risk-weighted CVA delta sensitivities within the same bucket that is specified by the Monetary Authority so that it appropriately captures the extent to which the 2 CVA delta risk factors are related.

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the CVA delta risk capital charge by aggregating the CVA delta buckets within the risk class in accordance with Formula 28Q.

leadIn.b: Calculation of CVA Delta Risk Capital Charge

paragraph.leadIn: where—

paragraph.content: KCVA_delta is the CVA delta risk capital charge;

mCVA is 1 or the larger number that is assigned by the Monetary Authority by written notice given to the institution, taking into account the level of model risk for the calculation of the CVA sensitivities;
γbc is the correlation parameter between 2 CVA delta buckets that is specified by the Monetary Authority so that it appropriately captures the extent to which the 2 CVA delta buckets are related;

Sb_delta =
max[−Kb_delta, min(∑kWS_deltak, Kb_delta)] for all CVA delta risk factors in bucket b; and

Sc_delta =
max[−Kc_delta, min(∑kWS_deltak, Kc_delta)] for all CVA delta risk factors in bucket c.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), the institution may determine a CVA delta sensitivity by another formulation if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the other formulation is conceptually sound and yields results very close to Formula 28N.

For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), the institution may determine a fair value delta sensitivity by another formulation if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the other formulation is conceptually sound and yields results very close to Formula 28O.

section.name: s322R
section.heading: Calculation of CVA vega risk capital charge

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate its CVA vega risk capital charge separately for each risk class except the counterparty credit spread risk class, in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: For each risk class except the counterparty credit spread risk class, the institution must—

paragraph.name: b

paragraph.content:

WS_vega k CVA
, for each CVA vega risk factor k as the product of
vega k CVA

paragraph.content:

WS_vega k Hdg

WS_vega k Hdg

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the capital charges for each CVA vega bucket b, Kb_vega, by aggregating the net risk-weighted CVA vega sensitivities within the same bucket in accordance with Formula 28T; and

leadIn.b: Calculation of Capital Charges for Each CVA Vega Bucket

paragraph.leadIn: where ρkl is the correlation parameter between 2 net risk-weighted CVA vega sensitivities within the same bucket that is specified by the Monetary Authority so that it appropriately captures the extent to which the 2 CVA vega risk factors are related.

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the CVA vega risk capital charge by aggregating the CVA vega buckets within the risk class in accordance with Formula 28U.

leadIn.b: Calculation of CVA Vega Risk Capital Charge

paragraph.leadIn: where—

paragraph.content: KCVA_delta is the CVA vega risk capital charge;
