γbc is the correlation parameter between 2 CVA vega buckets that is specified by the Monetary Authority so that it appropriately captures the extent to which the 2 CVA vega buckets are related;

Sb_vega =
max[−Kb_vega, min(∑kWS_vegak, Kb_vega)] for all CVA vega risk factors in bucket b; and

Sc_vega =
max[−Kc_vega, min(∑kWS_vegak, Kc_vega)] for all CVA vega risk factors in bucket c.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), the institution may determine a CVA vega sensitivity by another formulation if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the other formulation is conceptually sound and yields results very close to Formula 28R.

For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), the institution may determine a fair value vega sensitivity by another formulation if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the other formulation is conceptually sound and yields results very close to Formula 28S.

section.name: s322S
section.heading: CVA risk factors

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must, in respect of a risk class—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine buckets as specified by the Monetary Authority for the risk class that appropriately distinguish the risk characteristics of risk factors across different buckets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allocate each risk-weighted sensitivity calculated under section 322Q(2)(e) and 322R(2)(e) to an appropriate bucket.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must, in respect of a risk class—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: define the CVA delta risk factors for its portfolio, at a level of granularity specified by the Monetary Authority, as—

subparagraph.content: risk-free yields and inflation rates for interest rate risk;
credit spreads for counterparty credit spread risk and reference credit spread risk;
equity prices for equity risk;
commodity prices for commodity risk; and
foreign exchange rates between the Hong Kong dollar and each foreign currency for foreign exchange risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: define the CVA vega risk factors for its portfolio, at a level of granularity specified by the Monetary Authority, as the simultaneous relative change of all relevant volatilities of the underlying exposure.

section.name: s322T
section.heading: CVA risk-weights
section.content: An authorized institution must allocate a risk-weight to each CVA delta risk factor and each CVA vega risk factor at a level specified by the Monetary Authority that sufficiently represents stressed market conditions.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Eligible CVA Hedges

section.name: s322U
section.heading: Eligible CVA hedges

subsection.leadIn: A hedge is eligible to be taken into account in the calculation of an authorized institution’s CVA risk capital charge only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the hedge is entered into with an external counterparty or, subject to subsection (2), entered into internally with the trading book;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the institution uses the full basic CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge, the hedge is used and managed for the purpose of mitigating the counterparty credit spread component of CVA risk and the hedging instrument used in the hedge is—

subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (3), a single-name credit default swap;
subject to subsection (3), a single-name contingent credit default swap; or
an index credit default swap; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the institution uses the standardized CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge, the hedge is used and managed for the purpose of mitigating the CVA risk and the hedging instrument—

subparagraph.content: is not split into several effective transactions;
hedges either the counterparty credit spread component or the exposure component of the CVA risk;
in relation to the credit spread delta risk, is assigned entirely to the counterparty credit spread risk class or the reference credit spread risk class; and
is not a securitization exposure or a collective investment scheme that cannot be looked through but is assigned to the trading book.

subsection.content: If the institution enters into an internal CVA hedge with its trading book and the hedge involves an instrument that is subject to the SBM curvature risk, SA-DRC or RRAO under the STM approach, the hedge is eligible only if the trading book additionally enters into a hedge with an external counterparty that exactly offsets the trading book leg of the internal CVA hedge.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the full basic CVA approach to calculate its CVA risk capital charge, the institution may include a single-name credit default swap or single-name contingent credit default swap as an eligible credit default swap only if the swap references—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the counterparty concerned directly;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entity legally related to the counterparty concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an entity that belongs to the same sector and region as the counterparty concerned.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), a reference entity and a counterparty are legally related if they are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a holding company and its subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsidiaries of a common holding company.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution has included in its CVA risk capital charge calculation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an eligible CVA hedge obtained from an external counterparty, the institution must exclude the hedge from its market risk capital charge calculation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the CVA leg of an eligible hedge obtained from its trading book internally, the institution must include the trading book leg of the hedge in its market risk capital charge calculation.

subsection.content: The institution must include all ineligible CVA hedges in the trading book, irrespective of whether the CVA hedge is obtained from an external counterparty or from its trading book and, for an ineligible CVA hedge obtained from its trading book, both the CVA leg and the trading book leg must be included in the trading book.

division.name: D1
division.heading: General

section.name: s323
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 9

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: BI means business indicator;
BIC means business indicator component;
dividend income (股息收入) means income of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(a);
fee and commission expenses (費用及佣金開支) means expenses of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(b);
fee and commission income (費用及佣金收入) means income of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(c);
formula approach (公式計算法), in relation to an authorized institution’s calculation of its ILM, means the approach set out in section 334;
ILM means internal loss multiplier;
interest earning assets (有息資產) means assets of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(f);
interest expenses (利息開支) means expenses of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(g);
interest income (利息收入) means income of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(h);
interest, leases and dividend component (利息、租賃及股息組成部分), in relation to an authorized institution, means the amount calculated by the institution under section 325(3);

last n years (最近n個年度)—(a)in relation to the calculation of BI, means the last 3 years ending on a calendar quarter end date; and(b)in relation to the calculation of LC, means the last 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 or 10 years ending on a calendar quarter end date (as the case requires);
LC means loss component;
loss component (損失組成部分), in relation to an authorized institution, means the amount calculated by the institution under section 335;
net interest income (淨利息收入), in relation to an authorized institution, means its interest income after deducting its interest expenses;

net P&L on banking book (銀行帳淨損益), in relation to an authorized institution, means the gains minus losses arising from assets and liabilities booked in the institution’s banking book as specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(d);

net P&L on trading book (交易帳淨損益), in relation to an authorized institution, means the gains minus losses arising from assets and liabilities booked in the institution’s trading book as specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(e);
operational loss event (業務操作虧損事件) means an event specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (4);
other operating expenses (其他營運開支) means expenses of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(i);
other operating income (其他營運收入) means income of a type specified by the Monetary Authority under subsection (2)(j);
second year (第二年度), in relation to the last n years, means the year immediately preceding the first year;
year (年度) means a period of 4 consecutive calendar quarters.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the BI of an authorized institution, the Monetary Authority may, having regard to Chapter OPE10 of the current Basel Framework, specify the following types of income statement or balance sheet items—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dividend income;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fee and commission expenses;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fee and commission income;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: gains minus losses arising from assets and liabilities booked in the banking book;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: gains minus losses arising from assets and liabilities booked in the trading book;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: interest earning assets;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: interest expenses;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: interest income;
other operating expenses;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: other operating income.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, the Monetary Authority may, having regard to the minimum standards for the use of loss data under the standardized approach set out in Chapter OPE25 of the current Basel Framework, specify standards in relation to the identification, collection, treatment, validation, review, scope and content of data on operational loss.

For the purposes of this Part, the Monetary Authority may, having regard to Table 2 in Chapter OPE25 of the current Basel Framework, specify events the classification of an operational loss into which forms part of the requirements that the data of an authorized institution must meet for the data to be high quality operational loss data.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Calculation of Capital Charge and Risk-weighted Amount for Operational Risk

section.name: s324
section.heading: Calculation of capital charge and risk-weighted amount for operational risk

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), an authorized institution must calculate its capital charge for operational risk by multiplying its BIC by its ILM.
An authorized institution must calculate its risk-weighted amount for operational risk by multiplying its capital charge for operational risk by 12.5.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that has been in operation for less than 18 months on any calendar quarter end date after this section comes into operation* must obtain the prior consent of the Monetary Authority to calculate its capital charge for operational risk—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the method specified in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by an alternative method.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Calculation of BI

section.name: s325
section.heading: Calculation of BI

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: after each calendar quarter end date, calculate its BI as the sum of—

subparagraph.content: the financial component;
the interest, leases and dividend component; and
the services component; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in calculating each component, include the data of any acquired business and merged activities over the period prior to the acquisition or merger that is relevant to the calculation.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the financial component as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of its net P&L on banking book for the last 3 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of its net P&L on trading book for the last 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the interest, leases and dividend component as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the lower of—

subparagraph.content: the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of its net interest income for the last 3 years; and
2.25% of the arithmetic mean of its interest earning assets for the last 3 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the arithmetic mean of its dividend income for the last 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the services component as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the higher of—

subparagraph.content: the arithmetic mean of its fee and commission expenses for the last 3 years; and
the arithmetic mean of its fee and commission income for the last 3 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the higher of—

subparagraph.content: the arithmetic mean of its other operating expenses for the last 3 years; and
the arithmetic mean of its other operating income for the last 3 years.

section.name: s326
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for calculation of BI

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 327, an authorized institution must calculate the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of each of its net P&L on banking book and net P&L on trading book under section 325(2) and its net interest income under section 325(3)(a)(i) for the last 3 years by—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: calculating the absolute value of each of the net P&L on banking book, net P&L on trading book and net interest income recognized by the institution in the third year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for each of the net P&L on banking book, net P&L on trading book and net interest income, dividing the sum of the respective absolute values calculated under paragraphs (a), (b) and (c) by 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 327, an authorized institution must calculate the arithmetic mean of its interest earning assets under section 325(3)(a)(ii) for the last 3 years by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the first year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the second year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the third year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: dividing the sum of the arithmetic means calculated under paragraphs (a), (b) and (c) by 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 327, an authorized institution must calculate the arithmetic mean of each of its dividend income under section 325(3)(b) and its fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income under section 325(4) for the last 3 years by, for each of the dividend income, fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: aggregating the respective values for the last 3 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dividing the respective aggregate amount by 3.

section.name: s327
section.heading: Calculation of BI for authorized institutions operating for 18 months or more but less than 3 years

subsection.leadIn: If, on any calendar quarter end date after this section comes into operation*, an authorized institution has been in operation for 18 months or more but less than 3 years, the institution must, for the purpose of calculating any arithmetic mean in accordance with section 326—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat any partial year of operation of 6 months or more as a full year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: treat any partial year of operation of less than 6 months as zero.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), if, on any calendar quarter end date after this section comes into operation, an authorized institution has been in operation for 2 years and 6 months or more but less than 3 years, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of each of its net P&L on banking book and net P&L on trading book under section 325(2) and its net interest income under section 325(3)(a)(i) for the last 3 years by—

subparagraph.content: annualizing the absolute value of each of the net P&L on banking book, net P&L on trading book and net interest income recognized by the institution for the partial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of its interest earning assets under section 325(3)(a)(ii) for the last 3 years by—

subparagraph.content: calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the first year;
calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the second year;
calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at the end of each full calendar quarter within the partial year; and
dividing the sum of the arithmetic means calculated under subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iii) by 3; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of each of its dividend income under section 325(3)(b) and its fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income under section 325(4) for the last 3 years by, for each of the dividend income, fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income—

subparagraph.content: aggregating the respective values for the first year and the second year;
annualizing the respective values for the partial year; and
dividing the sum of the respective amounts under subparagraphs (i) and (ii) by 3.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), if, on any calendar quarter end date after this section comes into operation, an authorized institution has been in operation for 2 years or more but less than 2 years and 6 months, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of each of its net P&L on banking book and net P&L on trading book under section 325(2) and its net interest income under section 325(3)(a)(i) for the last 3 years by—

subparagraph.content: calculating the absolute value of each of the net P&L on banking book, net P&L on trading book and net interest income recognized by the institution in the second year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of its interest earning assets under section 325(3)(a)(ii) for the last 3 years by—

subparagraph.content: calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the first year;
calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the second year; and
dividing the sum of the arithmetic means calculated under subparagraphs (i) and (ii) by 2; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of each of its dividend income under section 325(3)(b) and its fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income under section 325(4) for the last 3 years by, for each of the dividend income, fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income—

subparagraph.content: aggregating the respective values for the first year and the second year; and
dividing the respective aggregate amount by 2.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), if, on any calendar quarter end date after this section comes into operation, an authorized institution has been in operation for 18 months or more but less than 2 years, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of the absolute value of each of its net P&L on banking book and net P&L on trading book under section 325(2) and its net interest income under section 325(3)(a)(i) for the last 3 years by—

subparagraph.content: annualizing the absolute value of each of the net P&L on banking book, net P&L on trading book and net interest income recognized by the institution for the partial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of its interest earning assets under section 325(3)(a)(ii) for the last 3 years by—

subparagraph.content: calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at each of the 4 calendar quarter end dates of the first year;
calculating the arithmetic mean of the interest earning assets as at the end of each full calendar quarter within the partial year; and
dividing the sum of the arithmetic means calculated under subparagraphs (i) and (ii) by 2; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: calculate the arithmetic mean of each of its dividend income under section 325(3)(b) and its fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income under section 325(4) for the last 3 years by, for each of the dividend income, fee and commission expenses, fee and commission income, other operating expenses and other operating income—

subparagraph.content: calculating the respective values for the first year;
annualizing the respective values for the partial year; and
dividing the sum of the respective amounts under subparagraphs (i) and (ii) by 2.

section.name: s328
section.heading: Exclusions from BI

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must not take into account any of the following in calculating its BI—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: expenses or income arising from the institution’s insurance or reinsurance underwriting businesses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: premiums paid, or reimbursements or other payments received, in relation to insurance or reinsurance policies purchased;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: expenses of an administrative nature, including—

subparagraph.content: staff expenses;
other administrative expenses;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: recovery of administrative expenses, including recovery of payments on behalf of customers;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: expenses of premises and fixed assets, other than expenses that result from operational loss events;

paragraph.name: f
g
h
paragraph.content: expenses due to share capital repayable on demand;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: changes in goodwill recognized in profit and loss accounts;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: corporate income tax (being tax based on profits, including current tax and deferred tax).

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may give approval for an authorized institution to exclude data related to its divested businesses and activities from the calculation of its BI if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the divested businesses and activities are no longer relevant to the institution’s risk profile.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Calculation of BIC

section.name: s329
section.heading: Calculation of BIC
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must, after each calendar quarter end date, calculate its BIC by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: separating its BI into 3 portions in accordance with Table 33;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: multiplying each portion with the marginal coefficient applicable to that portion as set out in that Table; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: aggregating the 3 products.

td.p: More than 10 but not more than 300

division.name: D5
division.heading: Calculation of ILM

section.name: s330
section.heading: Calculation of ILM: General
section.content: An authorized institution must calculate its ILM in accordance with this Division.

section.name: s331
section.heading: Classification of authorized institution for purpose of calculating ILM
section.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating its ILM, an authorized institution is classified into one of the buckets set out in Table 33A based on the size of its BI as set out in that Table.

td.p: More than 10 but not more than 300

section.name: s332
section.heading: ILM for bucket 1 AI

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a bucket 1 AI has an ILM of 1.

subsection.leadIn: A bucket 1 AI may calculate its ILM using the formula approach if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the bucket 1 AI—

subparagraph.content: is a subsidiary of a bank; and

subparagraph.leadIn: has notified the Monetary Authority, at least 3 months before the bucket 1 AI intends calculating its ILM using the formula approach, that the following conditions have been met—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the bucket 1 AI has maintained high quality operational loss data for at least the last 5 years;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the bucket 1 AI’s parent company calculates its ILM on a consolidated basis under the capital rules applicable to the parent company; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the bucket 1 AI’s operational loss data are either included in the calculation of its parent company’s ILM or would be included in that calculation were it not for justifiable considerations such as the materiality of the bucket 1 AI in relation to the banking group; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the bucket 1 AI has obtained the prior consent of the Monetary Authority.

section.name: s333
section.heading: ILM for bucket 2 AI and bucket 3 AI

subsection.content: A bucket 2 AI or bucket 3 AI that has maintained high quality operational loss data for at least the last 5 years must calculate its ILM using the formula approach.
Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), a bucket 2 AI or bucket 3 AI that has not maintained high quality operational loss data for at least the last 5 years has an ILM of 1.25.
A newly established bucket 2 AI or bucket 3 AI that has been in operation for less than 5 years has an ILM of 1, unless otherwise required by the Monetary Authority.

An authorized institution, on first becoming a bucket 2 AI or bucket 3 AI, may initially have an ILM of 1 for a transitional period of no longer than 9 months, or the longer period agreed with the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If a bucket 2 AI or bucket 3 AI is required to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on both a solo basis and a consolidated basis under section 3C and has only maintained high quality operational loss data for at least the last 5 years on a solo basis, it has the following ILM on a consolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1.25, if its ILM calculated on a solo basis using the formula approach is less than or equal to 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the higher of 1.25 or its ILM calculated on a solo basis using the formula approach, if the latter is higher than 1.

subsection.content: If a bucket 2 AI or bucket 3 AI has been granted approval under section 28(2)(a) to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo-consolidated basis, a reference in subsection (5) to the institution calculating its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis is a reference to the institution calculating it on a solo-consolidated basis.

section.name: s334
section.heading: Formula approach for calculating ILM
section.leadIn: The formula approach for an authorized institution to calculate its ILM is set out in Formula 29.

section.name: s335
section.heading: Calculation of LC

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate its LC by using only high quality operational loss data.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its LC by multiplying the arithmetic mean of its annual operational risk losses incurred over the following period by 15—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the last 10 years, if the institution has maintained high quality operational loss data for the last 10 years or more;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of years for which the institution has maintained high quality operational loss data, if the institution has maintained high quality operational loss data for the last 5 years or more but less than the last 10 years.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), an authorized institution must calculate the arithmetic mean of its annual operational risk losses incurred over a period of years by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculating the amounts of its operational risk losses for the first year and each year preceding the first year in the period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: aggregating the amounts of its operational risk losses for each year in the period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: dividing the aggregate amount by the number of years in the period.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3), if, on any calendar quarter end date after this section comes into operation*, the number of years in the period is between 5 and 10, an authorized institution must treat any partial year of operational loss data maintained of 6 months or more as a full year and any partial year of operational loss data maintained of less than 6 months as zero.

For the purposes of this section, an authorized institution’s operational risk losses incurred in a year is the sum of the gross loss amounts of any operational loss events recognized by the institution in the year less the recovery amounts of any operational loss events received by the institution in the year.

section.name: s336
section.heading: Exclusions from LC

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating its LC, an authorized institution must exclude the losses arising from an operational loss event under any of the following situations—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where the losses have been accounted for in the risk-weighted amount for credit risk;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the Monetary Authority has approved the institution to exclude the losses arising from the event from the calculation of its LC.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), the Monetary Authority may specify a threshold, having regard to OPE25.18 of the current Basel Framework.
The Monetary Authority may grant approval under subsection (1)(c) if the Monetary Authority considers it prudent to do so, having regard to the risk profile of the authorized institution.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Interpretation

section.name: s342
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 10

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: Exposure Limits Rules (《風險承擔限度規則》) means the Banking (Exposure Limits) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. S); (E.R. 4 of 2019)

def.name: SpecifiedSovereignEntity
def.leadIn: specified sovereign entity (指明官方實體) means an exempted sovereign entity, as defined by rule 39(1) of the Exposure Limits Rules, but excludes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Central People’s Government of the People’s Republic of China;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the People’s Bank of China;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a sovereign foreign public sector entity of the Mainland of China;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Government of the United States of America; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Government;

subsection.def: specified sovereign exposure (指明官方實體風險承擔)—see section 342A. (L.N. 167 of 2023)

subsection.content: In this Part, the amount of an authorized institution’s specified sovereign exposure to a jurisdiction is the amount calculated in accordance with section 343(1). (L.N. 167 of 2023)

division.name: D2
division.heading: Calculation of Risk-weighted Amount for Sovereign Concentration Risk

section.name: s342A
section.heading: Calculation of specified sovereign exposure to specified sovereign entity

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate the amount of its specified sovereign exposure to a specified sovereign entity as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if, in relation to that specified sovereign entity, the institution makes a deduction of exposure in accordance with rule 57(1)(c) of the Exposure Limits Rules in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to another counterparty of the institution for Part 7 of those Rules—the amount of the exposure deducted; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if, in relation to that specified sovereign entity, the institution makes a deduction of exposure in accordance with rule 57(1)(c) of the Exposure Limits Rules in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to another specified sovereign entity for this Part—the amount of the exposure deducted.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: ASC exposure (ASC風險承擔) has the meaning given by rule 39(1) of the Exposure Limits Rules.

section.name: s343
section.heading: Specified sovereign exposure to jurisdiction and concentrated sovereign exposure

subsection.content: An authorized institution must calculate the amount of its specified sovereign exposure to each jurisdiction by aggregating the amounts of its specified sovereign exposures to the specified sovereign entities of the jurisdiction, each exposure calculated in accordance with section 342A.

An authorized institution’s specified sovereign exposure to a jurisdiction is a concentrated sovereign exposure if the amount of the specified sovereign exposure exceeds 100% of the Tier 1 capital of the institution.

section.name: s344
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount of concentrated sovereign exposure to jurisdiction
section.leadIn: If an authorized institution’s specified sovereign exposure to a jurisdiction is a concentrated sovereign exposure, the institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount of its concentrated sovereign exposure to the jurisdiction by— (L.N. 167 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dividing the exposure into the portions as specified in column 2 of Table 34;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each portion of the exposure exceeding 100% of the Tier 1 capital of the institution as specified in items 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 (as applicable) in column 2 of Table 34—multiplying the amount of the exposure in the portion by the risk weight specified in column 3 of that Table opposite the portion; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: aggregating the results from paragraph (b) for the portions specified in items 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 (as applicable) in column 2 of Table 34.

text.b: Risk-weights for Portions of Concentrated Sovereign Exposure to Jurisdiction

p.span: Portion of concentrated sovereign exposure to jurisdiction (expressed as percentage of Tier 1 capital)

section.name: s345
section.heading: Calculation of risk-weighted amount for sovereign concentration risk
section.content: An authorized institution must calculate the risk-weighted amount for sovereign concentration risk by aggregating the risk-weighted amounts of the institution’s concentrated sovereign exposures to all jurisdictions calculated in accordance with section 344.

section.name: s354
section.heading: Application of Part 11
section.content: This Part applies to an authorized institution that uses a model-based approach to calculate its credit risk or market risk or both.

section.name: s355
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 11
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: model-based approach (模式基準計算法) means any of the following—(a)IRB approach;(b)SEC-IRBA;(c)internal assessment approach;(d)IMM(CCR) approach;(e)value-at-risk model as set out in section 226ML;(f)IMA;
output floor (出項下限), in relation to an authorized institution, means its floor risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk calculated under section 356.

section.name: s356
section.heading: Calculation of output floor

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (9), an authorized institution must calculate its floor risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk by multiplying the amount determined under subsection (2) by the corresponding output floor level specified in Table 36.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must arrive at the relevant amount for the purposes of subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: calculating its risk-weighted amount for credit risk by using—

subparagraph.content: subject to subsections (3), (4), (5) and (6), the STC approach for non-securitization exposures; and
the SEC-ERBA (except the use of internal assessment approach), SEC-SA or SEC-FBA for securitization exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: calculating its risk-weighted amount for market risk and CVA risk respectively by using—

subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (7), the STM approach or, with the Monetary Authority’s approval under section 17A, the SSTM approach; and (L.N. 167 of 2023)
the calculation approach used by the institution for CVA risk;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: calculating its risk-weighted amount for operational risk by using the calculation approach used by the institution for operational risk; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: aggregating the amounts calculated under paragraphs (a), (b)(i) and (ii) and (c).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i), an authorized institution must use—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (6)(b), the SA-CCR approach to calculate its default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the methods set out in Division 2B of Part 6A (except the use of value-at-risk model set out in section 226ML) to calculate its default risk exposures in respect of SFTs.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i), an authorized institution may, subject to subsection (5) and section 61(3) and (4), allocate to all of its general corporate exposures that are unrated exposures that fall under section 61(2)(a) (concerned exposures) risk-weights specified in Table 35 according to the loan classification category of the exposure in compliance with the Guideline on Loan Classification System (loan classification method).

td.p: Loan classification category of concerned exposures

subsection.content: If an authorized institution chooses to allocate the risk-weights to its concerned exposures in accordance with the loan classification method set out in subsection (4), the institution must apply the method consistently over time and must not change the method without the prior consent of the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for all its non-securitization exposures may choose to use—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the BSC approach for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the current exposure approach to calculate its default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts unless, under section 10A(2B), the Monetary Authority has required the institution to use the SA-CCR approach to calculate its default risk exposures.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(i), an authorized institution must apply the SEC-ERBA (except the use of internal assessment approach), SEC-SA or SEC-FBA to determine the market risk capital charge for securitization exposures in its trading book.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (9), an authorized institution must use the corresponding output floor level specified in Table 36.

td.p: Applicable dates for output floor level

On and after the commencement date of Part 3 of the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2023 (commencement date*) but not after 31 December of the year within which the commencement date falls (year of commencement)
Any date within the first year after the year of commencement
Any date within the second year after the year of commencement
Any date within the third year after the year of commencement
Any date within the fourth year after the year of commencement
On and after 1 January of the fifth year after the year of commencement

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by written notice given to one or more authorized institutions, require the institution to apply an output floor level specified in the notice to the calculation of its output floor if the Monetary Authority considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a rating system or an internal model used by the institution to calculate its credit risk or market risk or both causes, or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, adverse impacts on the financial soundness of the institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prudential concern causes or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, the financial soundness of the institution or the stability of the financial system in Hong Kong to be put at risk in prevailing, or likely prevailing, economic and market conditions.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subsection (9).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Doubtful (呆滯), Loss (虧損), Pass (合格), Special Mention (需要關注) and Substandard (次級) mean the category of that name into which an exposure can be classified under the Guideline on Loan Classification System;
general corporate exposure (一般法團風險承擔) has the meaning given by section 51(1);

Guideline on Loan Classification System (《貸款分類制度指引》) means the guideline set out in Appendix 2 to the Completion Instructions of return “Quarterly Analysis of Loans and Advances and Provisions” as amended from time to time, published on the Monetary Authority’s website;
unrated exposure (無評級風險承擔) has the meaning given by section 51(1).

section.name: s357
section.heading: Calculation of actual risk-weighted amount
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its actual risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculating its risk-weighted amount for credit risk by using the calculation approach used by the institution for credit risk;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculating its risk-weighted amount for market risk by using the calculation approach used by the institution for market risk;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: calculating its risk-weighted amount for CVA risk by using the calculation approach used by the institution for CVA risk;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: calculating its risk-weighted amount for operational risk by using the calculation approach used by the institution for operational risk; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: aggregating the amounts calculated under paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d).

section.name: s358
section.heading: Adjustment of capital adequacy ratio if output floor is larger than actual risk-weighted amount
section.leadIn: An authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must calculate the difference between—

subparagraph.content: its output floor; and
its actual risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk calculated under section 357; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the output floor is larger than the actual risk-weighted amount referred to in paragraph (a)(ii)—must add the difference to the total risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk for the calculation of its capital adequacy ratio.
